kd_3d4aXFCfZcG02525Uxg.text: Chocolate fountain is cool, service is relatively poor and employees argued over who would help us.

yV-F76J2DaFvvBUyaVSdzQ.text: I was very disappointed with the food that this buffet. First, the buffet is $21. Thats ridiculous even for the strip. Second, the mac and cheese is horrible, the food is cold, the bacon is limp and the corn bread has no taste. For a $21 buffet I expect high end fresh food. Not typical buffet food that lacks taste. Not to mention their food signs are incorrect. Don't waste your time. Just go to dennys down the street.

1XBW9VEjGIbYs66d86zZlg.text: Yeah I gotta tell you. Being surrounded by a bunch of senior citizens says something about this place. Not to mention some of the other weirdos. Last time I ate here was years ago. And I haven't returned either. Let's be honest. You get what you pay for. The flamingo is obviously an older hotel. So their standards aren't really up to par.  First of all, I will say. Their dining area is nice. Only because you can stare at the different animals outside. From their huge glass windows. They have, of course flamingos, wild birds. Koi fish in the ponds, ducks. And other mammals I can't remember.  Now the food is another story. It's not fresh. They don't have a big selection. And they have maybe two chefs helping you. One for crepes, and the other to carve your cold prime rib. It's kinda depressing to be honest. The dessert section isn't any better. In fact it just straight sucks. Tried this place twice and both times were exactly the same. Disappointing. Oh well on to the next buffet.

ywoxZzIzaYa73ogB0hWriA.text: This is a pretty standard buffet. I used a Buffet of Buffet pass and came here for breakfast right when it opened at 7:00 am.  The food was good, although there was no crepe person on duty that morning. However, the playing card suite-shaped mini waffles made up for that. And they weren't too soggy. Biscuits and gravy were pretty good too, and so was the omlette station cook.  Coffee wasn't great and mine had some grounds in it. Overall, I'm not sure I'd pay $18 for it, when I could get the same price for better tasting food from a restaurant (albeit a lower quantity).  BTW, valet wasn't open that early in the morning.

1jMLrsuYgVFJ7IOKIHkdvg.text: Do Not Eat Here. $25 seems like a bargain but it's gna cost you $50 more cuz your gna eat something else after throwing up. And probably $2000 more for food poison.

G5StrUfkaYV4ZIGAHYL3bw.text: This is easily the worst and saddest buffet I've ever been to. We only went here because it was convenient for us, but prob won't ever go again. Not a lot of selection, whatever is available is poor quality.  Our server didn't seem like she wanted to be there either. Do not recommend.

TlIVUnYS5RD_IDVVl62TEg.text: Even with $20 off this was horrible!!!!!!!!!!!! I could of gotten a better meal at McDonald's!! Listen to the reviews please don't waste your money. I'm so disappointed. We came off the plane tired and hungry and didn't want to walk too far...I would of walked to the moon and back if I knew it was this horrible! Food is cold, sitting out,, tasteless and no selection. Waste of calories

rLK6nnvLXM-u1L9kIrwLuA.text: I have a bunch of 2 for 1 coupons for this place so we decided to go the other night.  Right on par with the Imperial Palace buffet with a couple more things at the carving station (prime rib, turkey and lamb) and a semi-large selection of desserts.  They did have crab, shrimp (unpeeled), crawfish and mussels but it was all dry and tasteless.  How can they serve crab like this?    There was also this old lady walking around muttering to no one that they didn't have a very big vegetable selection which I agreed with.  Quite a "garden" it was.   I guess I am just spoiled from having so many other buffets choices here in town.  This is not worth coming to..EVER.  Even The Palms buffet is better than this.

i3TOV3lP4k8-mgSdVcAPKg.text: "At midnight every self-respecting casino premieres its $1.50 buffet--the eighth wonder of the world, the one True art form this androgynous harlot of cities has delivered herself of.... We marvel at the Great Pyramids, but they were built over decades; the midnight buffet is built daily. Crushed-ice castles and grottoes chill the shrimp and lobster. Sculptured aspic is scrolled with Paisley arabesques. They are, laid out with reverent artistry: hors d'oeuvres, relish, salads, and sauces; crab, herring oyster, sturgeon, octopus, and salmon; turkey, ham, roast beef, casseroles, fondues, and curries; cheeses, fruits and pastries. How many times you go through the line is a private matter between you and your capacity, and then between your capacity and the chef's evil eye." -- William Pearson (in his 1965 novel, The Muses of Ruin, describing a Las Vegas buffet) Whilst discovering the above quotation in Wikipedia, I was surprised to learn that the "all you can eat" buffet is said to have been first introduced in 1946 by Herb MacDonald, a Las Vegas hotel manager. I did know that eating at a Vegas buffet is a quintessential experience one must sample if their visit to this town is to be truly memorable. My friends and I didn't want to leave deprived in this regard, so we pre-paid for Flamingo's version for a Sunday morning (our departure day). For days, when I walked by, I monitored the line in front of the buffet room which always seemed to be unappetizingly long. I was a bit worried we were in store for a long wait and a big disappointment. However, when we arrived at 9:00 AM on Sunday, there was not another patron in sight! Over the course of our brunch, a few other folks wandered in, but the place remained essentially empty. Because of this, we were offered a prime table with a great view of the garden, waterfalls and flamingos. Our excellent waitress kept our champagne glasses brimming throughout. My first foray to the buffet table landed me the "heart healthy" portion of my meal--salad and fruit. What I sampled was fresh, crisp and sweet. I particularly liked the prunes (go figure). During my second, third and fourth forays, I abandoned all intentions of health consciousness and scarfed on a huge omelette, prime rib, more prime rib and just about every other fat-filled, cholesterol-laden, blood pressure-increasing concoction available in their impressive spread. Ref: yelp.com/biz_photos/_kb6... When it was time for dessert, I realized I was already completely stuffed and just sampled their cheese plate and some wonderfully tasty dried figs. They reminded me of my Grandmother's figs dipped in brown sugar that she dried under glass in the sun back in the 60's. A dose of nostalgia on a full belly is always good. It was a great way to end our trip to Vegas and I definitely got my money's worth. I didn't even suffer the following day.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omlette vying for space on the plate with the prime rib

dBLjF25erklrRnieZqNo-g.text: Paradise is one of the tagging along buffet for the 24hour Buffet of Buffets (BoB). We decided to visit because we wanted to have a relaxing breakfast/brunch, and Paradise is the right place for it, if you don't mind the food.  We asked for a window seat, and they were great to accommodate us. So I got to watch Flamingos, koi fish, swans, and other creatures roaming around the habitat while enjoying my food. I think the experience alone is worth the dollars spent.  There weren't a lot of choices offered at Paradise, and the food were just average. They had cold crab legs for breakfast, which tasted salty to me. There were different toasts and bagels, and other breakfast items like eggs, hams, etc. Oh, there was a crepe station, and the nutella crepe I had was pretty good.  We ordered only one "all you can drink", and at first I asked for a Bloody Mary. The server was nice to mention that the Bloody Mary was spicy, which was exactly what I was looking for. As I was sipping my Bloody Mary, I asked for a Mimosa next, and the server told me she could only give it to me after I've finished my first drink, since we were a party of two and only one of us bought the "all you can drink". I nodded my acknowledgement and told her I just wanted to tell her in case she got busy, since I wanted my drinks to keep on coming. And that's what she did. As soon as my Bloody Mary sank to the bottom, she put down a Mimosa on our table. As the Mimosa slowly making its way into my lovely tummy, she served up a new one. That was really nice!  So... come to Paradise not for the food, but for the relaxing atmosphere and the wonderful attentive service! Price is relatively cheap compared to other buffets, and I think quite worth it if you come for breakfast.

QXXnvVMqbJZeml_aLY1ByQ.text: Do not eat here!this place doesn't have anything good. The happy hour's drink were terrible! Do NOT waste your money.

vgTaPwhqziRlokEX4S2SSQ.text: Was not a fan of this buffet.  I had heard it wasn't good, and we only came because we were doing the Buffet of Buffets (Where you pay $35 for 24 hrs of access to any of 7 buffets) and we were gambling and decided we were wanted to take advantage and go to as many buffets as we could and we'd just go here.  Luckily it was a late meal, so we weren't starving but just wanted a little late night snack.    There was nothing that was that great here.  It didn't even look all that great.  I did enjoy the cotton candy that they had when I left, though!

eRs3RpuqItdWf-5h8PgEqg.text: I can't imagine a trip to Las Vegas without at least MENTIONING that we might try to go here for the Champagne Brunch on the weekends. We don't always make it here for brunch. I don't know about YOUR Vegas but my Vegas often includes very late nights and about mid mornings, or a room that's to suite (pun intended) to leave in an early morning rush.   Regardless of whether I make it or not,  the champagne brunch still occurs and its still delicious.   My best friend and I usually get different types of seafood so that we can both taste everything. Equally we both love breakfast so a customizable omelet it is!  The lil champagne they serve with the brunch packs a nice lil' buzz - it'll have me feelin good!

gSPnXbUimEsHSIDKl6NifQ.text: It is smaller than Rio's& Planet Hollywood's buffet. Good congee...  Prime rib is more like roast beef ..  Half of the buffet is desserts.

WJX_F8Vv484SB7QtdAVI5Q.text: I'm not sure why everyone is being so grumpy when reviewing this buffet... I've definitely been to most every buffet in Vegas and I can honestly say that this one is pretty amazing (you may want to reserve your opinions as I did spend 4 hours here for CHAMPAGNE BRUNCH).    I had the champagne brunch with a large group.  We were sat immediately and they didn't even charge us the crap required gratuity that most places charge you when you're in a group of 6 or more.  The food isn't exactly top of the top but it was definitely still tasty... A whole island dedicated to crab legs and shrimp (you have to peel the shrimp yourself, but eh.... Still worth it) AND comfort food galore!!!  Also, if you were like me and wandered, you found that there was a whole separate area dedicated to nom nom nom desserts!!!   For $26 each, we got 4 hours worth of champagne and all the food we can eat.  Not to mention the fact that our servers were really FRIENDLY... REALLY.  I know this isn't the Wynn buffet or anything but I would say this buffet is definitely a GREAT value.  TIP: Ask for Juana or Eddie to be your servers... They are PHENOMENAL.

cjRKqY6XWJXkCXJm8aQLeA.text: After a long day at the Go-Pool, decided we needed a buffet. Let me first start by saying....Save your money by not going here. Very expensive for Hometown buffet quality food. Go to Caeser's buffet. Very expensive, bad attempt at sushi, bad quality seafood, and horrible service. Went for dinner and it is poorly lit and servers are hardly ever around. Go somewhere else!

pGq66fZgrmPG0q3ciPdjPw.text: FOOD POISIONING WARNING We went for "prime rib" night. The food selection was so small. The staff that served the meat yelled at someone "what do you want? Pick what you want!" But that is not why I am giving it such a low score. My husband got food poisioning from the chicken in the Italian section he saw that it was pink so he stopped eating it but that ruined our whole trip. Having to stay in our hotel room because he couldn't leave the bed. Way to go Fremont hotel. Never again.

zTx4GJeJaE812MkTZ7nLGg.text: Do not eat here.  Old food, limited selection, stingy with the roast beef.  I asked for seconds and watched the server cut it from the toughest part of the meat.  Uneatable.  Sushi was old, desserts very dry.  Could not eat most of what we chose.

lXQLWKQ4qAgNyxOF1Bmwmw.text: This buffet was pathetic. Flamingo should be ashamed. We payed and walked out without even eating. Fortunately we had the unlimited buffet pass. The food was all cheap stuff and looked like it has been sitting there for days, forget hours. Very disappointed. I guess that's why it was one of the only buffets with no line.

xRnxz3vZW8no_lLCMUXUHA.text: I'd eaten here years ago, and we had breakfast here on the Sunday and Monday morning of our stay this weekend.  We didn't have any coupons or discounts, but even at $19 a person, I definitely felt we got our money's worth.  They have basically pretty much anything normal you could want for breakfast, and up the ante with a delicious ham carving station, omelet station, borderline sad smoked salmon for lox, and not so sad shrimp/crayfish on ice.  I think all non-alcoholic drinks were included, so if you wanted coffee, OJ, and pop, knock yourself out.    Do yourself a favor (especially if you brought kids) and ask for a table along the windows.  They look over the ponds and waterfalls of The Flamingo's courtyard, and it definitely added to the meal to sit there watching koi swimming and black swans getting pissy with the crows

_llRku44VEVEI4jiUK8urw.text: Worst buffet ever in Vegas!! Don't waste your money, go to somewhere your money is worth $26.99.  Every time you get food, food are gone and empty, you have to wait!  They don't have much selection and food taste sucks!!  I won't ever comeback to this place ever, plus service is slow.

Jayg10KfvebcbBMVTIO5zg.text: Had brunch buffet during my lunch break at a conference I was attending at the Flamingo.  At check-in the front desk staff said I could get a food credit of $30 if I declined housekeeping to turnover my room daily (3 day stay).  I used the credit toward my meal at PGB and had some left over credit.  Food was great.  Nothing fancy.  Country fried steak, mac and cheese, and herb baked chicken were delicious.  Standard breakfast items including omelette bar.  Also helped my self to some crepes which was good.  Overall, great value.

yBVpsna7QoVTGH30VQxm8Q.text: Pretty tasty brunch! We enjoyed it! I had about 5 different plates because I wanted to try everything. A few things that I didn't like - the sauce on the chilaquiles tasted very canned. Also, the eggs florentine with the frozen salmon was a disgusting idea. Other than that we enjoyed everything. I have to agree about it not being mind-blowing but it served its purpose of filling us up. $50!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cT9KiTD_eZUk-y4MBISdCA.text: Ate here around 11 on a Wednesday. It was very good. Large selection of fresh foods. Everything tasted good. Endless juices, mimosas, and bloody Mary's as well. The OJ was soooooo good.

TVokGx5kyp2Nu9TEigmGNQ.text: I've been here several times before, I'm not sure if everyone is just having a bad day or if it's the Thanksgiving holiday. But it appears as if some of the staff are discriminating against individuals who are elderly and or of a Asian background. This is what I experienced first hand but I can't speak for everyone else that is here. My parents were going to the meat cutting section of the buffet asking for turkey and sausage but the server pretending not to understand what my parents were saying and just standing there and ignoring them. It wasn't until I interfered and specifically said the name labelled on front glass. They had to specifically say kiebalsa for the server to do anything, pointing at the food or saying sausage was not enough. It was absolutely ridiculous. Yet, when the next person in line who said sausage and simply pointed at what they wanted, they received what they wanted right away. When I went to a different station myself and ordered something I wasn't offered the same items as the next person in line. It was extremely obvious that some of the servers favored individuals who were not of a Asian background. This has never happened before in all my previous visits and if this is how the Paradise Buffet treat their guests, we will take our business elsewhere.

A5JGOIsMRkAg80Y143TT-Q.text: Not the best selection I've ever seen at a buffet. I wasn't even practicing veganism at the time of my visit, because I was eating eggs, but it was still hard to find something fulfilling to eat. What I was able to eat was mediocre at best.

io9-ZuIsJZEkrdGVj7EHmA.text: This buffet offers window views of a beautiful garden.  I notice the reviews are not too good.  But I have dined her twice, for lunch and dinner, and thoroughly enjoyed the experience.  It was memorable for me and I am NOT easy to please.  I won't compliment the table service and the selections are not great.  But they had everything I wanted so I'm speaking for myself. Our brunch waitress was really busy handling many tables.  But she managed to keep my mimosa flowing and I staggered out completely satisfied.  It's unfair to compare THIS buffet to others in the bigger and newer hotels.  The Flamingo is an old hotel.  But the ambiance at the buffet and the scenery was very nice and just right for the price.

FoQ5S0_Ku4tFos2N3UPTCQ.text: Not the best buffet on the strip but very convenient if you are staying at the Flamingo. The buffet was very small in comparison to other buffets and most of the food was oily and bland.   Paradise Garden does offer bottomless bloody marys and mimosa for breakfast. You can also sit next to the window overlooking the koi pond and animal sanctuary. These are the only two perks of visiting the Paradise Garden Buffet.

VYT8Q3ZXaeBIL8w_F2WL_g.text: HUGE disappointment. And I am not picky eater. The line was long and we thought that the buffet is good. You will spend much better your money visiting the buffet in Planet Holiwood.

c_zUZwiq7urJN7KWGu6cSA.text: Had my breakfast at this location and I would give this place 3 and half for the great view of the garden and real flamingos.  The foods are plenty and you get deli style chef to make omelets of your choice.  There is the sweet stop where the lady would also make fruit crepe on the spot for you.  Overall environment was pleasant and roomy.  Make me feel like I'm in Disney dinning at animal kingdom.

BRnbWp4pT2RLU6yauFCBAg.text: It was 9:00am on a Sunday morning which you would think would be prime time. However, there was no line and we were excited to being seated quickly. We hadn't eaten here in years but had good memories of the distant past. Most of those good memories were quickly erased. The old school feel and the view of the courtyard with the flamingos is still fun. The food, however, all tasted like it has been out on the line about 30 minutes too long. If you are willing to pay $58 for two people, self-serve your own beverages, and wait for them to bring out some fresh scrambled eggs you'll be okay. Stick with bacon, hash browns, and the scrambled eggs. Dump plenty of salsa and cheese on everything to add some flavor. Take one of the eggs Benedict and give it to a kid in a Golden Knights sweater. Tell him it's a hockey puck. He won't know the difference. If you get a comp buffet you'll probably be happier, otherwise it is very overpriced for what you get. There are much better places to have breakfast on the Strip. Harrah's/Caesars Entertainment seems to struggle with their buffets with one shining exception--The Paris. If you are willing to wait in line, go there.

AquzuujPULjVETIdayeJ1Q.text: This is a great deal for a buffet. The food is just as good as the others and it's cheaper too. You get a great view of the flamingo pond AND you can get unlimited Bloody Marys or Mimosas for ONLY A DOLLAR MORE. We went to the Bellagio buffet the other night and it was 20 bucks more for the same food and no view. Definitely recommend!!!

aE4-qu9C19ZeZ4AfvnV_gg.text: BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS!!! Okay now that I have your attention let me talk about what makes this buffet incredible. So I stumbled upon this buffet when I was passing through the Flamingo. The food quality is good for the amount of money you pay. They have a wide range of food too! The main reason I would recommend dining here is because it gives you an incredible view of the habitat (aka real Flamingos). It's incredible! For the price you pay and the friendliness of the staff, I would recommend this place to everyone I encounter.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lfro0FKejqBDWqaLq4rjjQ.text: Highly recommend the dinner buffet only available Fri/Sat night. Full service buffet and includes beer, wine courteous competent servers. So many comparable Vegas buffets have installed self serve beverage stations and downgrade clearing dirty plates from the table. Staff & server were great. Fully met our needs. Selections including crab, oysters, prime rib, salads were delicious. Deserves 5 stars.

u1aDAfptQAeW44hOhPyMFg.text: We arrived in Vegas pretty early Friday morning for a vacation and wanted a good priced breakfast/brunch buffet. That's exactly what we got here. The line went by super fast and everyone we came in contact with was very nice. I personally thought it had more than enough options for brunch. The Made-to-order stations (omelets and crepes) made the place. Our server was always on hand to offer more OJ and coffee. Pair that with the cool view of the flamingos out the window and we really enjoyed the entire experience, especially for the price.

7hrxv58QwIDg6ShM2J8EYQ.text: This is for whatever reason just not a very popular buffet. This results in food that isn't as fresh as it could be. Food is often cold. The highlights here are the garden views. I could actually see a person coming here just to look at the flamingos and wanting a place to sit to soak it all in.   The ambiance is 5 star. I wish I could enjoy the good food from other restaurants here. Most buffets are tucked into some basement (Luxor comes to mind) or stuffed into the last corner as an afterthought... not here.  Lets just say you want a decent view while you eat. If you have a car I would recommend Golden Nugget in downtown. It overlooks the pool and shark tanks. Food at Golden Nugget is great. Variety is not the strong point but what is there is simple and good.... Also, the best bread pudding on earth.

HREsyyEJnLmk-s7VPSEHXg.text: There are very limited options for breakfast when staying at the Flamingo, so we decided one day to do the buffet. At $15 per person, the cost seemed reasonable. However, in a city known for buffets, this one falls far short of average in quality and selection of food.   Nearly everything was cold! Some of the meat at the carving station was weird (kielbasa?) and the sliced ham was cold. The omelet station was decent. Bacon was cold and the waffles were cold and hard as a rock.  There were far more lunch and dinner food items given the morning hours. Some of the food looked like it had been sitting out for days.   The service was very attentive, especially for a buffet.   There is no chance that I would return.

wTAAYixQTd4Tw64494Od1w.text: The Paradise Garden now combines lunch and breakfast into a daily brunch buffet.  They are mostly breakfast offerings - no more prime beef or chocolate fountain.  I had a made-to-order sandwich and it was tasty enough, and quite filling.  A piece of fried chicken was also quite good as was a slice or pork loin.  My children loved the pizza.    The crepes weren't that good.  My favorite part was still the view of the flamingos, even if we were sitted pretty far away from the windows.

OXEfcF00oC6oJY3kUcUdbQ.text: Great buffet for the price! Lots of fresh choices and Groupon had a great promotion for it! Maybe a few more homemade dessert choices but other than that the food and view were great!

9wda_p9BLt71RGXO63eE-g.text: Breakfasts were great .  Wait  staff were efficient but crabby.

pNex-WmVXwMKa5HSxFuB0Q.text: My fiance and I came here for breakfast and bottomless bloody Mary's on 1/19/17. We sat down and waited for a solid 10 minutes before Julie came to our table to serve us. She was downright rude from the get go, as her attitude was simply disrespectful throughout our entire breakfast. We should've gotten up and gone to a different breakfast buffet right off the bat, but we decided against it since we were looking forward to the bottomless bloodys. When we asked her about said bloodys, she looked at us, speechless, like we were insulting her by even asking. She demanded our id's and proceeded to drop our id's on our table and walk away instead of hand them back to us. Incredibly rude. When the bloodys did come, they were as plain as day and tasted like 100% tomato juice. We did not drink them. Don't be fooled by this marketing ploy, they are trying to rip you off. The food was below average, and even the ice cream came out of the machine like chocolate milk since they didn't bother to turn it on... Lazy and uninterested. I could go on and on about the entirety of the visit but the experience altogether was simply terrible. The worst service (Julie was downright nasty to everyone), below average food and drink, and a regretful atmosphere. With so many places to spend your money in Vegas, why go somewhere where you are sure to be disrespected and not get your money's worth? TAKE YOUR MONEY ELSEWHERE.

XwlERZFTPUB_FnqAuVINuw.text: Meh. Just came for breakfast so wasn't expecting anything spectacular to begin with. Lots of cold food, food that didn't really require any preparation. We just went there because we were staying in the Flamingo hotel. I didn't look ahead of time at places to eat, so we just settled for this. They do have tons of desserts, especially considering it is breakfast time. Their waffles were pretty crispy though!  I later found out that it actually cost more than the Bellagio buffet! kind of ridiculous, considering the Bellagio buffet was so much better!

f1B76bVRVocyLI2YBfW6Ig.text: I was wrong to go against Yelp consensus and think this would be okay, but we were given comps for this lunch buffet, so I convinced myself that the Paradise Garden Buffet just suffers in comparison among the Buffet of Buffet-ers.   It's difficult to understand how the same company that has the amazing buffets at Rio and Paris could serve such substandard food at the Flamingo. The food was almost uniformly awful, lukewarm at best, and while we were there, I heard a chef chastising a worker for keeping the temperature too low, which made me afraid to eat any of the meats. I honestly would have rather paid to go to another buffet, any other Vegas buffet I've had was better, including Bally's, which isn't all that great either.   It's a nice space adjacent to the gardens and waterfalls, so I hope that the PGB gets a major refresh as part of the ongoing Flamingo remodel, which is slowly but effectively transforming a lot of their dated hotel spaces into a hipper atmosphere.

MdlIeyhdkw4M0owayUKWqQ.text: Prolly not worth it. Food is subpar and at times barely passable. I'm told the prime rib was good and they do offer crab legs. Beer selection =coors light. Wine is a bit better. Sangria is where it's at tho! The dessert brings it around, especially the crepe station. Service staff jokes around and is very friendly. Nice to see the birds in the sanctuary.

0fzDr-vhxvdYXH8SMehl1A.text: It was the first and only buffet we hit in Vegas because it met all of our needs so well. I could get breakfast past noon, and my friend could eat nachos and fried chicken at 9 in the morning if she wanted. The mimosa bar was a plus, why not have some booze at breakfast? All of the food was well prepared, and the range of options was a pleasant surprise.

z486gu2uXypJhZ07tql0Xw.text: I don't get all the hate, this was a fine buffet for breakfast. Good selection, they had everything from crepes to smoked salmon and even some dinner foods like fried rice.  Nice setting to enjoy it in too, you can watch the ducks and flamingos while you eat. Definitely worth doing again.

b7T8vES5sxDmzrzTUMSQ6A.text: It's one of the cheapest brunch buffets on the strip and you get what you pay for. Thus review is for brunch only. The mimosas and Bloody Mary are endless in 6 oz cups, if your waiter is attentive. The breakfast options are limited, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, French toast, biscuits and gravy and made to order pancakes, omlettes, and hash browns, the made to order line is long. There's fruit, sandwiches, pizza (that was awful) shrimp, prime rib, chicken, and unidentifiable Mexican. There was taco meat but no tortillas to be found, enchiladas that looked like tacos, chiliquilles with no egg. The desert was pretty bad too. Lots of unidentifiable "yogurt" cups with fruit, macaroons, eclaires, and my favorite creme brulee that was just scrambled egg with sugar on top. But it's only $19!

eHuhUncssJYFMzRCYQCczA.text: really bad food i hated the service ppl please dont waste your money coming here go to in n out dont come her for dinner food had no taste they only have coors light beer the cheapest and the sangria is also cheap the service is bad please take a word for advice don't waste your money go to a better buffet than this one i wish i could get my money back.

sU4Y_JGezggEWhyb22avig.text: Slim pickings. Teeny, tiny, dirty crab legs. Even the salad bar was sad. All the meats were dry and overcooked. I give this place one star because they have a pretty good dessert section, I suppose it's so you can go away remembering that instead of the main dishes. They should be charging half of what they do for that poor excuse of a buffet, there are more choices at a sizzler.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cotton candy made it worth it for the boys.

4wLz7PaD_Ul21K0Q9y6ZHw.text: Used to be the IT buffet but no longer for sure.  Should have gotten a clue when we arrived and there's no line.   Buffet is really a blah with absolutely nothing special.  It 'looks' like there's alot of food but selections are really limited.  Fried chix were dry, pastas were dry and stirred up by people, limited vege choices and desserts that are... again... just plain blah.   Whole experience felt much like dining at Hometown, at 30% higher price. The only saving grace was the view with the flamingos.

NzHS5AvvRK1bsw2x1z7Rtw.text: It was NOT my decision to come here, I just want to make that clear before I start this review!!   I'm going to keep this review relatively short because I don't have anything nice to say about this place. Variety of foods, NOT impressed at all. In fact, it was kind of depressing seeing that this was all they had even though it was lunchtime. The food was so very disappointing and even saying that is an understatement. The desserts were cute, that's one nice thing I have to say BUT I took a big spoonful of one of the desserts, ONE bite and that thing came flying out into a napkin. It  was so disgusting that I actually gagged and sat there for a couple of minutes and tried to keep myself from throwing up.  Cost around $16 for lunch, sure it's "cheap" but save your stomach and please choose another buffet to eat at. I knew I should have checked yelp before agreeing to come here!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That THING sitting on the plate to the right, is the thing that had me sitting there trying to NOT to throw up.
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KfIsPkFx16CDTD8NCHVFeg.text: I will never eat here again!  the only thing that was decent was the prime rib, and I've had better sushi from a supermarket! Everything seemed over cooked and tasteless, they used canned or frozen vegetables, They did have a wide verity of olives, but who goes to a buffet for olives! DON"T WAST YOUR MONEY, IT'S NOT WORTH IT!

gBCZai1zqnPpWw-q0zyt0w.text: Buffet of Buffets Marathon - Stop #2 of 7 10:30 AM We walked from Caesar's Palace to the Flamingo to make it to this stop on the BoB tour. I was already beginning to feel stuffed from the Caesar's buffet, but charged ahead anyway. The line here was a little longer than Caesar's, but we were seated promptly and had a nice view of the pool area where the Flamingos & Swans hung out. I even saw a Black Swan....cool! yelp.com/biz_photos/_kb6... The 1st round we all went to the buffet near the entrance, which had standard breakfast offerings....we were a little disappointed that it was so small. I grabbed a few Pastries, Eggs, Potatoes, and other stuff. The food was so/so (2.5 Stars for this section)....then another Yelper Holly C said that there was a Crepe station in another room past the 1st buffet section....what?! How did I miss that?! yelp.com/biz_photos/_kb6... I immediately went to investigate.....yes, there was another huge section of Desserts, a Crepe station, Chocolate Fountain, Donuts, and other goodies. I ordered a Blueberry Crepe from the nice woman working the station. yelp.com/biz_photos/_kb6... yelp.com/biz_photos/_kb6... She was very pleasant and curious about what we were doing with attempting to eat at all 7 Buffets in one day. She did a good job on the Crepe, which tasted awesome. The other Desserts in the area were very good (4 Stars for this section).....but it really started to fill me up. yelp.com/biz_photos/_kb6... Just when we thought we saw it all, we discovered that there was a 3rd section of the Buffet!!! There's a Chinese food section that opens at 11 am....I was done, but a few of the Yelpers I was with went to check it out and said it was very very good. Overall, this was a hidden gem surprise as we had low expectations for this buffet. I wish I would have paced myself better so I could try the Chinese food....next time. 3 Stars weighted average for the Desserts and 1st section of the Buffet. Incomplete on the Chinese food for me because I didn't have any.....other Yelpers loved it. Return Factor - 72%

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l77phFdLiYxon7ParvifSw.text: Awful, awful, awful. Only time will tell if my fiance and I will get food poisoning from this buffet. Every single dressing at the salad bar had a thickened, congealed layer on top- looked like instant sickness if consumed.  The food selection overall was limited and left a lot to be desired. We have the 24 hour pass and the other buffets have been great. But if I just paid full price to eat here, I would have demanded my money back.

21XyVt-kFkiRmfppbuuwqg.text: I personally think there are bunch sniveling people here writing these reviews. I almost didn't go to breakfast here this morning because of the reviews, but then decided in the end I know I can drink 20 dollars in mimosas very easily if the food actually sucked. I had eggs Benedict, pizza, waffle, corned beef hash, and a custom omelet. All of which was warm and tasted great. The pizza was fluffy and tasteful. My eggs benedict tasted like it should. Omelet was filled with ham bacon and cheese just how I like them. My waffle was yummy with the house syrup and the corned beef hash had amazing flavor! Then I also proceeded to drink 5 mimosa :) unlimited mimosas are wonderful! Oh and waited till later to write review to make sure I didn't get sick. And I feel good!

QviNIFJMZUDEuxrgxXlKaQ.text: I was highly dissapointed with the food here. No flavor on anything. It was cheaper than other buffets but you get what you pay for. After trying a bit of everything I thought i would get french toast because it is pretty hard to butcher french toast but boy was i wrong. Soggy and flavorless is the best way to describe the french toast. There were only 2 things that I liked. The staff was super friendly and unlimited mimosas.

c4MMTallgmxc0obCUIwPMg.text: This review is long over due. Me and my bf came here about a month ago. We went for breakfast and we loved the food! The host seated us at a real nice table. We sat byvthe window and got to see their live flamingos which were surround by water with coy fish and turtles. We had their ham, French toast, eggs benedict( which I and my bf absolutely loved), breakfast potatoes(were ok, but my bf liked them) mimosas (yummy) and some cereal. Everything was great. Until we met our server. Please keep in mind me and my bf have never been to a buffet in las Vegas. Our sever (I think that's the title) Julie was absolutely rude! We were seated by the host and she put our receipt on the table. We didn't know that we where suppose to leave it there so my bf grabs it. Julie abruptly was like NO, NO, NO, NO. We stop dead in our tracks and thought we did something wrong. She tells us to leave the receipt on the table. Then she asks did we want something to drink we said oh were going to get mimosas( not knowing we didn't get water, juice, etc. on our own) and with a snide remark "so you're not getting something to drink." And were like no...I guess not. Again puzzled by the attitude. Then we finally started eating and when we were done she would come by and just grab our plates and not say anything. I also noticed that she was very pleasant with the other customers. So it had me puzzled once again to why she was being rude to us. So other than that we really enjoyed their food and will be avoiding Julie if we come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table

Be57pKdNeBwrDwRjv_6APw.text: We were disappointed with the food here. We were there in 2009 and thought the food was fantastic. This time the food wasn't as good, we were bummed. Also I guess they are reserving the tables with a view of the Habitat for "Diamond members" what ever that is. We are not frequent Vegas people, only there for business, so this means we don't get a nice seat? Again, Flamingo does not care about guests or apparently repeat customers.

Mgtce1Uo2JZiCn0OspU5iA.text: I had the brunch and was very pleased with food quality.  95% of the food was a 9 out of 10. Love the koi pond and of course the Flamingos.

G4K7V9mBthvv_zLNWJgPzw.text: BRUNCH BUFFET ONLY  Not impressed..  The salad bar and the crepes were the only thing exciting about this place..   Since the food didnt have descriptions, I had to keep asking what this and that was..  Not a great buffet experience.

QADCN1dUT89kipo8Csmhwg.text: I would put this place among the lowest tier of buffets on the Strip. I would even put some off Strip buffets like Sam's Town and The Orleans above it, and they charge half as much. The staff was friendly, attentive and helpful, but there's not much selection nor was the food anything special.   The big gripe I have about this place, which might not happen every night, is the carving station was slow because everyone was wanting their prime rib cooked more.  As the carver would cut each slice and cook it on the grill before getting to the next person, a line formed that started blocking all of the items to the left of the carving station. It eventually wrapped around the back half of the salad bar. After waiting in line to get inside, people were waiting in a 10-15 minute line to get food.   If you're staying at the Flamingo, maybe it's worth a shot because of its convenience, but don't go out of your way to come here.

NOb8xvLMdg6wM7a9gwUmRw.text: For the price I would probably pay a little extra and go somewhere else. We went on a Sunday and the food was very basic with some of the food tasting like microwaved type of food ! The place was very under staffed but that is not the workers fault and I would put it management.  Bottomless mimosas was the reason we went and they served them in small 6oz cups. On top of that we only got served two which sucked. Not a fun experience but at least it was nice to look at the flamingos after brunch

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paradise

Nlhjz5ICKCLXzzpdogkndA.text: $30.00 a head for dinner, fair selection, nothing spectacular, bottomless drinks included; beer, sangria, wine or soft drinks. Service is excellent. Sushi, great clam chowder, salad bar is good. Great dessert bar!  Returned for breakfast. $25 each. Omelet bar, pancakes, eggs Benedict was excellent, French toast, all the dinner meats, sushi, etc. Fresh fruit, but No waffles though. Service was again excellent.

K1w-YdLfY4vdR5fd4yKk5A.text: We waited in line for about 1/2 hour for brunch on weekday. My party was next in line to be seated when a bunch of people showed up in the preferred member line. After they kept taking people from the preferred member line, I got irritated. They lost a star for this. Note to management - I get that you have preferred members, but once they show up in line, how about alternating one from each line so that you don't piss off potential new preferred members!  We were seated and there were plenty of open tables. Like one of the other reviewers, I was baffled by the long wait.  The food was not great but pretty good. The wait staff was very attentive and kept our unlimited Mimosas and Bloody Marys coming.  Because the cost after Groupon discount was about $16 per person, I bumped them back up to 4 stars. I may or may not go back as there are still other good buffet deals to be found in Vegas.

9YnroBL5on-IF6t0DQi6hQ.text: Food, meh. You get what you pay for. Service.... -stars if I could. Waitress complaining loudly about people in general and acted like we were inconveniencing her every time we asked for anything. And the only thing we ever asked for was too get our mimosa, not happy.

4GGRLM7NeUVofORVHzjHTg.text: I went for breakfast yesterday here! The cost is 21.95 pp there are a lot of food choices not just breakfast but brunch as well. They have a crepe station!!!! Amazing crepe , seriously!!!  Omelet station, which I didn't try and a huge dessert bar! They also offer all you drink bloody Mary's and mimosa's.. this is my complaint, you aren't informed by your waiter about the all you can drink I read it on the sign on my way out the door!!! Probably best since I had work to do!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qodEPnhYBBp23k4ZBYlOUg.text: 3.5 stars  Enjoyed my dinner buffet at the Flamingo. Not a lot of food choices, but the food that was offered was delicious. Fresh salads, tons of meat options, seafood. The Guac & chips were good too! Only complaint is that some items get cold - it'd be nice if they constantly restocked.   I did get this off groupon - don't think I'd pay full price.  Got there around 4:55 PM and there was already a line. Goes by fast - waited around 15 mins.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kmSEsq0QsiqMjH0EjtsfVg.text: I reviewed this buffet 8 years ago and the service is still just as terrible as it was then. I guess it's not ok to ask for silverware and napkins, because the food server sort of slammed them down on the table. Should I eat my eggs with my hands? Forget getting a refill on coffee, such an inconvenience I suppose. Many tables had piles of dirty dishes.  No separate dining area for Total Rewards Diamond Members.  The dining area is dingy, worn, and needs an update. Food is ok and not a big buffet selection. Not worth it. The buffet at Harrah's is better if you are doing the 24-hr buffet pass, which I think I will just never get one ever again and eat at other places in Vegas.

QbX4ROCwd-VM5DnoXM5oZQ.text: So we experienced this buffet together as a family today for breakfast. 21.99 for an adult and I believe 10.99 for children for ages 4-12. With the ambience I would actually give it a four but took away 1 star for the bad stuff. We asked for a table near the waterfalls so that the children could see outside. The maitre di did accommodate our request which we appreciated. Also what I did appreciate about our waitress was that when my three year old spilled an entire glass, yes an entire glass, of orange juice on my lap, she did everything in her power to try and help me by getting some warm towels for me to wipe off.  OK now for the bad stuff. Watery scrambled eggs. Slow. Slow. Slow. You get the point. Service. I think I had to ask for Diet Coke two times. I think I asked for coffee a few times. The line for the omelette station was long. I think there was a guy in front of me ordering six omelettes. They spoke in Spanish and seem like they even knew each other. Because it took almost like 20 minutes for me to get one single omelette. I don't get it. Also, just the line to get food seem like it took forever..  I don't know if I'll ever be back, if I did I would at least know what to expect with the slow service. If I did come back I would probably do the deal where you spend about $50 and you can eat at five different buffets for 24 hours. That way you can actually get your moneys worth and experience different locations. So if you're unhappy with one you can just go to another the next day. I would also suggest going maybe earlier in the day for faster service.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xneRNlUi2rz9vh6OF22kdg.text: Hardly a buffet set up.  More like cafeteria set up.  One long line to go through the crab/ carving station which ties up the other stations.  We didn't finish our meal.   Money back and left.

axExSbtxfzyf0cpOdsQ6Cg.text: Part of Vegas's intrigue (for me, at least) is the Buffet of Buffets tour, an all-access pass to some of the best buffets the city of sin has to offer! For 24 hours after time of purchase, your buffet credentials allow you to literally pack it in, to be the glutton you've never before dared yourself to let loose and become. This--and more! Much, much more!--for only $59.99. My review, then, reflects our complete and utter indulgence--our loosened belts and the imminent guilt--touring the Buffet of Buffets. Flamingo's "Paradise Garden Buffet": (Lunch, $21.62 without the pass.) Flamingo's--besides the fact that there are actual flamingos, beautifully pink and spindly-legged, roaming the campus (you can even see them from the Buffet)--isn't my favorite hotel along the Strip. It's no surprise, then, that their Buffet isn't my favorite either. I mean, there's nothing really wrong with it, but in comparison to the others with the Buffet of Buffets, Paradise Garden is much smaller, and, in being so, has a smaller selection. Although the service was great, many smiles, "hello's," "can I get you anything more's?," and "goodbye's," it isn't quite as colorful and exciting as the others. I wasn't nearly as eager to get started as I was with the others. BUT...no other buffet has flamingos! Three stars: simply due to limitations. Paris' "Le Village Buffet": yelp.com/biz/le-village-... (Breakfast, $21.99 without the pass.) Rio's "Carnival World": yelp.com/biz/carnival-wo... (Dinner, $34.99 without the pass.) Planet Hollywood's "Spice Market Buffet": yelp.com/biz/spice-marke... (Dinner, $30.99 without the pass.)

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bR5qF5ZIwmkBTZYG7ZU0Iw.text: We went here the morning of our last day before heading home.   The line to pay was about 10 - 15 min long, but moved quickly. It was about 10:30am and perfect for brunch. Weekday brunch costs 21.99 unlimited.   Once we paid we waited about 5 mins to be seated. The Asian ladies who seat guests seemed to be having a rough morning and were not the friendliest to deal with. The restaurant was going through some construction to the center and other only thing preventing you from falling in dirt are some black curtains held up by PVC pip. As we walked by you could hear the workers complaining about some drama ect.   We were seated in the second patio-like area. There is no outside seating. However the tables that line the outside glass walls back up to the flamingo lagoon. the view was lovely being able to see the flamingos, and waterfalls.   The booths and tables were clean and ready for us to sit. We sat to wait for our waitress to take our drink order and waited about 5-10 minutes before she arrived. We both ordered orange juice.   The brunch buffet had a ton of choices, classic breakfast options included an omelet station, and crepe station. Plus a full salad bar, and various other lunch options. Carving station had turkey break, sugar ham, sausage, and another option I cannot remember. Also served pasta, tacos, and Chinese food.  The desert bar was located around the corner which is were the crepe station was located. A good variety of breakfast baked goods, and even a good selection of sugar free options.   We enjoyed the food here and would come back.

WiQb580ufaAv4vY4SMMa7Q.text: In comparison to other Las Vegas buffets this is just okay, middle ground in terms of food quality, service and interior of the restaurant.   BUT we found a really great deal on Groupon which was a brunch buffet for 5 for something like $62 which included unlimited mimosas. We jumped on it. The restaurant also is along the flamingo pond so we asked to be seated by the windows, that was really cool to see the birds, koi fish, etc.   Our server was VERY slow to greet us, refill mimosas, etc. Not very attentive or friendly.   The food was so-so but I would come back for the price. They had a delish crepe station on the dessert side! Other desserts didn't look so great. The food was decent, they had made-to-order omelets, hot breakfast sandwichs, plenty of meat, salad bar, lox bagels, fruit, yogurt, etc.

B0TekPzm_pUmYG3Amn9AYA.text: Went for Sunday Brunch here today. So disappointed. Way over priced. For my wife and I it was $60. I have had better buffets at the primm for $7.95 a person. Save your money guys. Go somewhere else. The only thing good I had here today was my salad and the scramble eggs. But how do you mess up a salad that you make yourself. Lol... turkey was dry! Thank god for water at the table. Even the service sucked. A line to be seated with many tables empty where people could be seated. The host lady seating people looks and acted like she just came from the local hospice center to work. I wish I could give this place a no start. Probably one of the worst buffets that I have visited! Place sucks!

ocyNQ5ygObmoh1oGMc79uw.text: Great buffet. There was 6 of us and everything we had tasted great! The dessert section is pretty small, and I have seen bigger buffets, but for the price totally worth it! Plus we used a groupon!

kxJ25nv7JwCbpyAlBMl-tw.text: This place was awesome! Hubby and I stood in line for almost 20m but the wait was worth it. The atmosphere, service and food was great! We didn't drink the mamosas or bloody Mary's, but if we did I'd probably give 4 stars. It's too bad it's under staffed, the waitress was had was really nice, she took our empty plates most times but I feel like they're all overworked. The older guy who made our omletes is so kind. We noticed that the food was never low for too long. Only complaints is I do wish there was more crepe options - there's only plain or strawberry - not fresh, it's kinda like a strawberry syrup to choose from so I just got the strawberry w/whipped cream & chocolate and sliced some fresh bananas over it - tasted pretty good. I'd go back with my family one day.

aT3dQeV5mowHeVoYFBWj8Q.text: We ate here on a Friday night and it was pretty disappointing. While I will say, the pho was delicious but everything else was seriously lacking. They had all the fix ins for tacos but no tortillas anywhere to be found. The pizza looked dry and aged and like it had come out of a digornio box. The corn still had strings in it and the meat was super fatty. Unlimited drinks only included house sangria which was not so yummy and coors light, yuck! It was also really hard to get a second round of drinks because the service was awful. The woman skipped our table multiple times to go to larger tables and when we said "excuse me" she said hold on and walked away all stressed out about what appeared to be a big order behind us. It was not that busy so it was irritating that she couldn't even keep up with our table just because she had one large group.  Edit: I will say that the crepes were delicious and the woman making them was super sweet and lovely to meet

wnQDXaQpn3jwvUX9ZgfdJQ.text: Crape guy was so rude and a crabby patty to everyone was obvious he did not want to be there whatsoever.They say  it's unlimited bloody Mary's and Mamosa's good luck getting them it's like pulling teeth to get one,they  won't bring you one tell everyone is sitting down even though we were all on separate tickets. Food was ok no good not great nothing to brag about nor write home about...

rTdycdByJgogL9bjAzeHVw.text: The upside of this buffet is that they serve breakfast until 2pm, while the other Buffet of Buffet options go until 11. Also, the flamingos are nice. Everything else is just not good. The food is just ok. The service is atrocious. I'm still here waiting for a water, and the crepes guy is the worst. He snapped at me twice. I asked for strawberries and chocolate and he refused, only giving me strawberry because he said I had to order off only what was listed (chocolate and strawberry were both listed, but apparently combining them into the crepe was a step too far). When I tried to use the chocolate topper, it was empty. I asked for more and he rolled his eyes and complained that he would have to go all the way to the back, and he also didn't offer to put on chocolate topping from the giant vat of chocolate next to him. So, I walked away with no chocolate anywhere on or in the crepe. His attitude was seriously the worst. In contrast, I was at the Paris buffet last night and the crepe maker's tip cup was filled with tips because he acted professional. Look crepe man - you chose to work here! I paid for your service so drop the attitude. You lost a tip and a customer.  Ugh. Never coming back.

k81CAoOm7FLghyCLF0drvQ.text: My wife and I were utilizing the Buffet of Buffet pass and had a VIP pass as well.  We arrived at 4:50 on a Friday for dinner and there were at least a dozen people in the VIP line and 40+ in the regular line.  Part of the dinner buffet draw on the weekends is free wine and beer.  Food selections were interesting.  Prime rib, turkey, pork, sea food, and Chinese.  Crab legs were also a big draw.  Really no rhyme or reason to the food choices.  Food was average at best.  My wife thought it was fresh so at least it had that going for it.  Room itself was good but dated.  Great view of outside but room itself looked like 1985.  I loved gambling here, service was friendly and attentive but the buffet was really lackluster.  Hit other options.  My stomach actually bothered me after eating here.

xLtiiXEEKDMDivEBzlf7-w.text: Breakfast, Everything was cold. Eggs benedict, potatoes, sausage, bacon, french toast pancakes.   Literally could not find anything that was prepared well.  Honestly the worst buffet i have ever eaten at.  4 people $100. Coffee was mud as well.  I can say the ice water was good but thats it.  Worst buffet i have had on the strip.  The first time I couldn't finish my plate when i was starving.  Actually i found an edible, bagel.  Heading out for some food.

5wbOiTiCC0EmdT8sdxl3nw.text: I will start off and say I wasn't hungry going into the Flamingo so it might be the reason of my judgement but still. I walked in wi my boyfriend and this buffet was one of the smallest I've seen since coming yo vegas. It reminded me of the size of an old country buffet. The selection was not even that great.  The one thing that was interesting was the "make your own quesadilla " but too bad I'm not a big fan if quesadilla.  I honestly spent my time taste testing desserts. The cotton candy was awesome and the cheesecake pops were very yummy but I couldn't say the same about the main courses.

qjwCzrn-GUBzKJAX16lTsQ.text: Went to the brunch buffet with some friends, and it was one of the worst experiences I've ever had in my life. Where to begin. The food was mediocre at best, which was fine because we had used a groupon and thus, didnt pay full price. However, the service was god awful. Our server was extremely rude. We had done the bottomless and the server kept telling us that she couldn't refill our drinks too quickly- so our drinks were constantly empty and she likely failed to check on us because she was trying to avoid giving us refills. Then to make matters worse, finally we did get a second round of drinks (about 30-40 minutes after we had been there), and our lovely server said that she was refilling our drinks "as a courtesy to us" and that she had other tables to take care of. Given the fact that 3 of my friends are in the service industry, we ensure that we aren't difficult, but I don't think it's too much to ask for a round of refills- in a buffet where that is the only thing that you are doing as a server. we asked for the manager, Linda, who we voiced our complaints to. Meanwhile, a few tables next to us was another group complaining about the terrible service. Linda said that she would "look into the situation." Did not say she was sorry, or try to do anything to rectify our terrible experience. All in all, do not go here unless you want to eat sub par food and have terrible service. Not even worth it with the groupon.

-g7CBK3RWWG0JGlp9FP6sA.text: Tried this spot for breakfast while my boyfriend and I did the "buffet of buffets." The wait was only about ten minutes long and the cashier workers were very nice and helpful. I would definitely recommend the omelette station, as it was by far the best part about this Buffet. The guy making the omelettes was super friendly and had great customer service. Other than that, the buffet was very "meh". The bacon was extremely greasy and the "turkey potato hash" was not good at all. Definitely not worth the price tag for breakfast, unless you're doing the buffet pass through total rewards.

v-mbSiOUCdjOZ2kIiElfvw.text: Food was not labeled so you have no idea what you are eating the cleaning carts with all the food not eaten being rolled around the entire restaurant. We ate here because of the reviews but it was horrible. Definitely not recommend this place.

H1MAr0h2aaLkRRjepaNxHw.text: My wife and I stayed at the Flamingo in Las Vegas last week.  On one of the days we ate at the Paradise Garden Buffet in the hotel.  We only have previous visits to the buffets at Bally's and Paris as a comparison, but we were quite pleased.  We actually thought it was comparable to Paris, and a touch cheaper; and much better than Bally's.  The buffet itself was fairly standard I guess, but I did note an omelette chef that was still on duty when we were there in the early afternoon.  Apparently, there was also a made to order burger bar station that we didn't discover until we had started dessert (which was a great disappointment when I saw the results some of the other patrons got).  The dessert selection was better than both Paris and Bally's, including a crepe chef (which I acknowledge Paris has too).  Beyond the food, the price of the buffet included unlimited champagne, mimosas, and screwdrivers - which made the cost of the meal quite cheap when you throw 2-4 drinks into the mix.

2f8heK_4sfg0SbahRGymEA.text: We made a reservation for a group of 53 adults for the Sunday brunch after our wedding. Our total price was $42.66 per person, which included the brunch, unlimited alcohol, reserved seating, and skip-the-line entry (base walk-in price was $23pp). The brunch itself was pretty good & I liked that we were seated right next to the window by the flamingos.  I downgraded this review for 2 reasons. (1) We were offered mimosas & coffee right when we sat down, but the wait staff never came by again to ask if we'd like anything else nor offered us any of the other included beverages such as bloody mary's, beer, or wine. Service was bad, yet we were charged 21% gratuity regardless. (2) We signed a contract that required us to give a final count a week before our event. I gave the count, but we had a couple last minute cancellations and Linda Brookins denied a credit for those cancellations. I was aware of this as part of the contract so I'm not disputing the charge, but a few cancellations the day before would have had zero impact on Flamingo. (They're not buying more food & could have easily seated someone else in the vacant seats. Had I thought of it at the time, I should have sold the empty seats to people in the back of the buffet line.) To combat this greed & lack of flexibility, they get a worse review.

jGDTpxZ5f4c52-1ICr2y6A.text: Avoid at all costs. I was intrigued by their $20 brunch with bottomless mimosas so I gave this buffet a shot despite the bad reviews.   Our waitress, Julie, was by far the rudest waitress I have ever encountered. She took 10-15 minutes to approach our table to take orders despite us waving her down multiple times. Her demeanor was cold and she took forever to give us refills of our mimosas. She also messed up our simple drink orders when all we wanted was OJ and coffee. The buffet wasn't even busy at this time. Food wise, it is just standard breakfast that you can find at your local Denny's. For $20, there are breakfast buffets at superior buffets like Mirage or Paris.   This buffet really shouldn't advertise "bottomless" mimosas when it takes the waitress 30 minutes to get you a refill. They serve you the mimosas in tiny plastic cups. You are better off gambling and ordering these from the casino waitresses as they were faster than our waitress.

YkGjURj7kpbQczOd51cmEw.text: Definitely turned out to be a lot better than I had expected. The food anyways.  The place is a very calm, peaceful environment. There isn't that much variety in the food. In fact, compared to the other buffets in Las Vegas, or even in buffets in general, there wasn't that many options to choose from. However, the food is honestly not even that bad! In fact, it's quite tasty and feels "homey." There is a whole section dedicated to desserts for the sugar lovers out there. They have a chocolate fountain for yummy treats, cotton candy, cakepops, cookies, etc. The red velvet cookie they have there is delicious.   The service was pretty bad. My waiter has reached that time in age where waiting tables is probably not such a good idea. We were seated down fairly quickly, but whenever I'd ask for napkins or something, I wouldn't get them until like 10 minutes later. Sometimes the waiter wouldn't even acknowledge my question so I'm only left with an awkward silence. It takes them a little while to take away finished dishes as well. Pretty slooooow workers.  Not too bad of a buffet, but you're better of spending a little bit more money for a higher quality buffet.

URS8MJEkdC8KsB_jVsjo3g.text: This was the second buffet in seven on the Buffet of Buffets circuit. This was definitely the sleeper hit of them all. The ambience is very nice. There is nice view of the gardens outside, complete with flamingos! They have flamingos at the Flamingo - who knew! This buffet is huge, but it doesn't look like it. Make sure to walk around everywhere before making a decision. There was an omelet station over by the windows that wasn't obvious. And there are three different dining rooms. The thrill of the hunt definitely comes into play here. Also make sure to come after 11am when all the stations are open. The Asian food stations at the end (with prime rib thrown in the mix for good measure) are amazing. Great, unique desserts. They also have a make your own soup station where you fill up a bowl with vegetables, noodles, and meat. You get a choice of chicken or beef broth. Very tasty. The Asian station also has chicken feet, which I have never seen at a buffet. The buffet also was serving crawfish, another unique buffet item. A little too much work for me. See joe c.'s review from Flavors Buffet and his rant on peel and eat shrimp. yelp.com/biz/flavors-the... That pretty much sums up my feelings on the subject. Another unique item at this buffet - they have a chocolate fountain. Complete with custom made sneeze guard. You have to stick your fruit, marshmallow, or rice krispies treat through a hole in the plastic to get to the chocolate. A fun addition to a buffet. It's over by the crepe station in the second dining area. Also, on the weekends, if you come after 10:30 am - unlimited champagne and bloody marys are included! I think it is a little more expensive, but worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy Asian dessert!
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken feet!
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate fountain complete with custom sneeze guard.

klnfCY3JufkVbSd0I2YoTw.text: Went to LV over the weekend with my boyfriend and we both loved this place !! $20 I think for brunch , you can not go wrong with that. And the food was delicious and a lot of variety . We literally ate here every morning lol . And the waitress were nice as well .

DVeLhEhNnpEeFPpMHCQACQ.text: This buffet was an immediate mistake. The wait was whatever but could have been faster. The food was pretty bad and they didn't have the best selection. They did give us unlimited mimosas but they used most pulp to make them and it wasn't very good. We asked for some without pulp and it was way better! I tried the eggs Benedict and they were cooked totally wrong and I couldn't cut through the biscuit. I also had a slice of pizza that wasn't great but it coulda been worse. The crepe I had was good at first til the whipped cream separated and I was pretty much done at that point anyway. All in all id say, absolutely do not eat here. For the price you can find a way better buffet like the one across the street at the mirage for just a little more! Seriously don't eat here or you'll probably regret it... If you do, make sure to take advantage of the unlimited mimosas!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Overdone eggs Benedict. Cool. Soooo bad

6rHAh_rdapvmvuGd_iOQfA.text: An expensive nacho and salsa bar. Selection is very weak, quality is also weak.  Much better off going to a full service restaurant.  With tip your in for $26, not worth it in any way

ljmCanynnoUBL81rwichMg.text: We got the "Buffet of Buffets" thing.  We ended up here for our last dinner because it was right across the street from the show we were going to see (less stress getting there on-time).  We'd already gotten our money's worth out of the pass, so this buffet was "free".  We arrived at an ideal time...only one group in line ahead of us.  When we left the line was rather long.  The food was OK. Not great, but not bad.  Surprisingly they had a very limited selection.  Really just the one counter of items (maybe 10 or 15), and then the dessert counter nearby.  Literally only about 1/3rd the size of the Paris buffet, and not even 1/8 the size of the RIo.  No, I'm not exaggerating.  What they did have was pretty ordinary.  The sushi was cooked, not "fresh" (i.e. raw).  When compared to other buffets on "the Strip", this was pretty weak.  Were we not pressed for time because of the show I would have left and gone somewhere else.    One positive thing was that they have Sierra Mist.  That's the only major soda that is made with real sugar only (i.e. they don't have a high fructose corn syrup version anymore).  I avoid HFCS due to the toxic nature of it, so it was really nice that they had Sierra Mist.   They also had cotton candy.  Cotton Candy??  What, is this the state fair??  That was an odd thing to see there.  If this buffet is convenient (as it was for us), then it's OK I guess.  But you can do a LOT better if you're willing to walk a bit (or grab the shuttle to the Rio).  With the Buffet of Buffets you would do much better to visit other places.  If you don't have that, this place is cheap and not horrible.

ME235pDffQsvWiyZ5P_EBw.text: Ask to sit by window, even if you aren't VIP.    Its a basic, average, Vegas buffet.  There are some buffets worse than this one, and there's some like Bellagio or Caesars, which exceeds.  So come to this one with an open mind, and expect average food.  The service was just ok.  The staff will help you more if you're a regular.  My server came 2x's. Once to give me my drinks, and once to clear some plates.  No refill and no chit chat.   Lucky my buffet was free because I'm a platinum player, and got comp'd.

qWXY6c_7diJUrQcvdAFdpw.text: This breakfast buffet at the Flamingo normally costs about $20 or so, but we got complimentary buffet vouchers so luckily didn't pay anything besides tip.  It isn't bad for breakfast, but definitely NOT worth $20!  Amongst their selections was an omelet station, crepe station, shrimp cocktail, smoked salmon, bagels, muffins, danishes, fresh fruit, oatmeal, donuts, cookies, chocolate fountain where you can dip fruit, scrambled eggs, eggs benedict, sausage and bacon, and some other common breakfast items.  I would come again if it were free, but otherwise.. I'd skip it and find a better use for my money!

Wa1thll8C7XSKlyVmHKE2g.text: Would rate 2.5 stars. At $20 for brunch plus tax and tip, it's overpriced for mediocre food and drink. Unlimited mimosas and Bloody Marys but you have to order them yourself. Servers bring additional drinks like soda and coffee but not always attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. At $20 for brunch plus tax and tip, it&#39;s overpriced for mediocre food and drink.

uiyETDrbeGlgFNApJoLPtQ.text: Amazing brunch buffet for a great price. This buffet was much cheaper than many of the other buffets. The food was fresh and there were so many options to choose from. Our waitress was super nice and came back often to refill our mimosas and coffee. I highly recommend going to this buffet.

q_PwIobZqAUq9bUAxs8T2Q.text: Came for the Breakfast Brunch $23. I think this spot is a great value for the money. Mimosas and Bloody Mary bar included for a bit of that "hair of the dog". Full salad and fruit bar, large dessert bar, made to order crepes and omelettes, bacon cut off the slab just to name a few items. Very good overall. I'd come here again for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Made to order crepes
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prepared, cut and served omelette
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad and fruit bar

FlGMHQr3xiX_zUeU_44VUQ.text: We were ignored for over an hour by our waitress and when we asked to talk to a manager another woman that worked there (who wasn't the manager) insisted on knowing the issue before she would bring him over. When the manager finally arrived he essentially blew us off and wouldn't listen long enough to actually understand the issue. Definitely not a place I would go back to.

ycrO6j2lYqhJjZqgi2pIYg.text: Literally crap served on a plate. Food is clearly unsanitary and seems to be left out for a while. The food is seemingly cold and i wouldn't ever come to eat here again.

niaiyJNlwQZ3hPLv0Eu6-A.text: This is a paradise if you are a senior looking for a retirement home. The carpeting, decor and the attire screams bingo for 80 year olds.  Never have I seen such a bad assortment of badly done foods. The fish had a distinctive fishy taste, the prime rib was well done which is a crime, the chicken had a layer of slime on top, the mashed potatoes needed gravy which likely meant it wasn't going to be good enough on its own, and I basically stopped there.  Their dessert section looked like they had just lifted the bakery section from a Wal-Mart. Their soft serve machine reminded me of Hometown Buffet, their chocolate fountain looked like they picked it up from Target, and their enormous cotton candy made me think they were too cheap to give us gelato or crepes.  No no no.  No.

yORfs4Ti3bhmx0dDLi06kA.text: Service was good. Food options were limited but it's worth it compared to other buffets charging $60 a person! Me + 1 ate for $32 and endless mimosas of course.

usD5vP4-Rh0NkAlmi90SiA.text: They do not have a separate seating area for diamond members as other buffets do. I will not be going back again the food is mediocre. Drink service is slow. there was a party of 11 in front of me and I had to wait to pay to get in. Total disappointment as a diamond card holder.

r8-fxMbne4sa9X_Jw2UdLQ.text: Good brunch, good customer service unlimited Bloody Mary and mimosas . Nice view , unlimited  mimosas. It's very relaxing in there .

ULO4qQbqOr35gYtve98QGg.text: Went during the lunch buffet and was pretty good. I'm a picky eater so would've liked a little more selection. Mostly just breakfast, taco/Mexican sides, salad bar, pizza, and a dessert bar. The bottomless mimosas were great and mainly why we went. The flamingos, fish, and ducks were nice to see so I'd ask for a window seat. The soft serve ice cream was actually delicious and really creamy. It was $23 for one adult so kinda pricey but all in all not bad.

FTUz4dUDmhwRWgayR8IN0Q.text: Not bad for $20 on a Saturday night. All you can drink sangria, wine and beer. No lines to deal with.  Limited pickings but enough for $20 from Groupon.  The lady serving us Alma provided very good service to make this place worth while...

vZQjXOwHB7EVHCen-rfhsA.text: Not my top brunch buffer but it was ok. At list I didn't have to wait that long to get sit. I'll give you points for that. Service was ok. Food is ok. But mimosas are always good u can not say not to that lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosas

USMqFBdVRvRulxS7rpfoOQ.text: Another buffet deal from buffet of buffet,  but this one not my favorite,  the food for buffet just too so so. Service was good and nice view of the flamingos, that's it.

Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh fruits and some of desserts
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of desserts

Vq7goTGnJ_esV5EEAzgL2w.text: Let me start with unlimited mimosas!! They have a good selection of good food which they serve in shallow dishes which they refill more often which makes the food fresh and not sit too long. They have a carving station, omelet station and crepe station in addition to their buffet. Staff is good and friendly. Will definitely recommend for breakfast

XdGtfmQacshmDN2hgbhkxw.text: Did a Sunday brunch.  Food was ok overall.  Pretty good selection.  The table service was great.  My biggest problem was the lines waiting for the food.  It was so long I never got an omelette.

uXNgBf-3e3OqwzhGnwbJew.text: Food was good, mimosas gave me a buzz, what else could I ask for on a nice Saturday morning?

z4oQ2h4M_9TpFGGDem1rfw.text: I have been coming to the Flamingo and the Paradise Buffet for years but just had my last bad meal there. The place has lost it's charm for me; there are too many other great places nearby for me to risk wasting another meal here.  Everything about the experience was below expectations: line-up and pay, seating, table service. I left my table to get more food (hoping for better offerings than my first try) and they cleared my table - water, utensils, everything- before I got back. Glad I was quick to reclaim my table before they seated others there.  Food - the main appeal of any dining experience has to be the food and it was uniformly disappointing! Limited variety, hot food was cold and tasteless, shrimp were still frozen in an ice ball, bland, blase and disappointing on every level. Even the dessert bar was bad: brown stuff that did not taste like chocolate, unimaginative and boring.  Do yourself a favor and skip this one.

-qn97dTqpkJUm2Z9lem9ZQ.text: Food was horrible.  Employees were rude.  Eat out on the Linq Promenade.  Many more choices and much more edible.

CJf2nGdqjY5C5binTX_MDA.text: Do you want to pay 30+ dollars for a place with similar quality but less selection than Golden Corral? Perhaps you would like to also look at flamingos, because flamingos are cool. Too bad that they don't have a buffet to match their rose hued majesty and one legged, quacking existences.   All the dishware was warm, which may have just been due to the time of my visit, but it did put a stopwatch on the soft serve. Overall the food ranged from "this is ok" to "we'll that's enough of that". Save yo money and order a pizza or just give up and spend more at the more prestigious buffets on the intersection. You don't come here to not spend money.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flamingos are cool. They quack. They stand in one leg. They represent our baser desires to eat shrimp and harass ducks.

pdFXvpn2JcJ0LdVdEQBQug.text: Yucky! I took one bite of everything that I put on my plate. This place was horrible. My drink, iced tea, was the only thing that I really enjoyed. Lucky for us, this place was included with our ticket to see George Wallace. Do yourself a favor, don't pay to eat here.

0UJ_Ycf5y_fWjheuUe4HVg.text: We purchased the "Buffet of Buffets" and decided to try this spot for breakfast because it is closed for dinner except on weekends. This is by far the least favorite. The overall decor is very dated and dingy. The tables and chairs are beat up badly. The booths that are combined chair and cushion seating are horribly mismatched size. My wife sat in cushion seat and the table height was at her shoulders. We switched seats and the table was uncomfortably high for me and I'm 6'3". The table service was slow to clear plates and they never brought the ordered mimosa. The food was decent enough, but nothing to rave about. The eggs Benedict was dry. The country grave had the consistency of soup. The orange juice was a a disappointing concentrate. Two saving graces were the delicious scrambled eggs and the perfect oatmeal. This buffet will be skipped if we ever do this again.

pPEncSbSlJSeskKbSHNf5g.text: How did I miss reviewing this place for so long?!?  I must be trippin' hard, but I digress.  This buffet is a blessed curse.  There is nothing that truly stands out about the buffet itself outside of sheer volume of choices on the first go around.
