Please note that I hate going to a buffet and not having access to filling up my drink myself because I do not like not leaving a tip for the waiter or waitress, but sometimes my cup sits empty for an extended period of time.  Tips should be earned, and not just expected...my personal issue though.  When you are first given the clearance to go inside this eatery, and are escorted to your seat by the hostess, you can't help but to notice the massive amount of food that you pass by on the way to your seat.  Once you are given clearance to eat, and given the information that a waiter will be over to take your drink order later, it is just a good idea to just go around and view everything that is offered.  Depending on the meal, you may have an omelet station or a pasta station or whatever!   Truly, there are a lot of options to choose from that ranges from sushi to sliders to carved this and curried that!  A massive salad bar with many options is located next to boiled shrimp and other seafood stuff.  Move over to the next island and you will see sliders, chicken sandwiches and subway sandwiches cut into palm size.  Move to another island and you have a choice of crepes.  Move to another island and you have a huge variety of sweets that includes cotton candy, fondue machines, many cakes and ice cream just to name some yums.    Truly, there is not stand out taste when it comes to this buffet.  Don't look for anything that will knock your taste buds socks off because that is not what this establishment is about.  This food-ship is strictly about shoveling massive amounts of items that you care to indulge into your pie hole often!  Find something that is good for that moment, and just go with that.  Try a little of each variety and leave full.  Just give them a try.  Make sure to ask about any discounts that are available with the buffet as well, which includes them being part of the eat at 6 buffets as often as you would like for 24 hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7-HsyJAo1sHB9pbYQINdFg.text: We were hungry and had to wait for hour room for about an hour while carrying laptop bag (didn't wanna leave it with the bellhop). This plus a coupon, plus someone's platinum status (=free drink at the buffet) and we decided to stop by this buffet. I've been here before, so I didn't have high expectations. The food was edible, but nothing really stood out in a good or bad way. The service was good.  I couldn't find anything too good for dessert and for some reason the chocolate fountain wasn't assembled (it was weekday lunch). Overall, an ok place to get some food. It I had more time and nothing heavy to carry, it would have been better to add $8 and go to Wicked Spoon!

mlMOMOd337XwJW7wNOacpg.text: I went to the Paradise Buffet at 6 pm on a Saturday. The line was not horrible. I ate less then $30 worth of food. The salad bar was a basic salad bar, you could make tacos and nachos which was nice but the only meat option was ground beef. I don't like seafood but my friend loves crab legs, shrimp, sushi etc. She could not eat the crab legs because they tasted wrong, the fried shrimp were okay, she enjoyed the sushi. It seemed like every station was down to the bare minimum- no pizza, three pieces of fried chicken, three tortellinis etc. The desserts were okay but I almost broke a tooth on a cherry pit inside one of their mini pies. I did enjoy the ice cream.  Bottomless alcohol- but I was driving, the soda was well calibrated.    I give the service 5 stars, the waitress was very attentive. One star for the food. I left hungry. I had gone to the Planet Hollywood buffet the previous day and left in pain from overeating. Same price and six times the amount of options.

2H7xTF7WNL3nn5OjI9H6Cg.text: This was a last minute choice, seeing how most buffets close at 10 and this one was inside our hotel. Would have chosen the Aria instead.   We get there and it is seafood and prime rib night. The staff were pretty on top of things. Drinks are self service minus the alcohol. They have soda, hot drinks, juice, iced tea, and milk.   The crab is not self serve, an employee actually pulls the crab out of the boiling pot of water.  The crab smelled old, a bit too fishy. A lot of the legs had meat that stuck or shrank inside the shell. Which makes me believe, and it may not be True, but that the crab has been defrosted and reheated before.   The sushi was previsouly made and the rice was hard, it made the sushi inedible. The tempura shrimp rolls were made awhile prior, since the crispy outside was detaching from the shrimp and was just a soggy layer between the rice and shrimp.   The fried seafood was old. Hush puppies were overcooked and cold. The onion rings were good. The clam chowder that came out was like warm to cold. It came back out piping hot. I found more crab in it than clams. It was overtly salty.    The Mexican food has been sitting forever and barely anyone ate it. The beans had a dried film of beans on top since they hadn't been touched all evening it seemed like. The rest of the Mexican food look like it had not been touched.    The prime rib was cooked well, a bit salty too. The ham was alright.   The desserts were definately old or recycled from lunch. The berries were soft and dried out looking. The crust on a lot of the desserts were soft when they should have had a slight bite or crisp to them.   The gal making the crepes was super nice. But the filling tasted old- strawberries in syrup or bananas foster.  I would almost prefer fresh cut fruit placed in the crepe with the whip cream and chocolate sauce. I ended up adding the lovely sugar coated sliced almonds to mine. I skipped eating the inside because it was slimy.  For the price and convenience it was ehhhh... I wouldn't come back here if I had a choice.

qf1qrmRHPWHOLQvGV1jD2g.text: This buffet is the absolute worse buffet I've ever went to. There were 3 in my party and I bought the brunch (7am-12pm) buffet for a party of 4 so I could take some back to my hotel. I paid $65 for 4 when there were only 3 of us. Upon arriving, I mentioned that I had purchased 4 plates for 3 people to take one back to my hotel and was ignored.  After we got our plates and ate with a ton of leftovers we were expecting to take back (that I paid for), we were denied not only out leftovers, but the 4th plate as well. They also denied reimbursing me the 4th plate. This buffet will charge you for 4 and not allow you to take your leftovers, or any other plates you've bought. Our server even brought the whole buffet's manager to me to confirm we couldn't take food back - even though I paid for i

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flamingo&#39;s Cheating Buffet leftovers they wouldn&#39;t let me keep (even though I paid).

KwIL-3yoHJlADuFL3ujvAw.text: We decided to try the breakfast buffet since we are staying at linq. We came at 9am, about alittle more than 30 min wait... the food here does not worth it. Many of the food here is overcooked. If you plan to eat and watch the flamingo at the same time, it really depend where you seat and not much table near the window. Just go outside to watch the flamingo, no need to eat the food here.

0QyILulLwOdd870mjdMUvw.text: We bought a groupon to this place and overall it ended up being a great deal.   We waited about 45 minutes to be seated. We arrived around 10am on a Saturday, so it may be better to come earlier.   We sat near the window and had a nice view of the fish and birds.   I thought that the food was mediocre but that is to be expected for a buffet at this price range. The mimosas and bloody Mary's were very good. The Bloody Mary was spicy, which is how I like them.   Our server was fantastic. She kept our drinks filled the whole time... it definitely made the experience worth it and we would come back with a Groupon again if available.

UQG97qhKORWfScBh9q7_nQ.text: The food always tastes old and  not a great selection. We have given this place a few tries now and have been disappointed every time

ZruG63BLFSEdCRRIgBL-RQ.text: Worth going if you have a groupon. Pros.  Has a great view of flamingos Fun nacho bar Got a huge turkey leg  Cons Really bad service. Our bottomless drinks were like 3 drinks, because waitress never came by, and they serve it in tiny sippy cups No seafood. No crab or shrimp. Just smoked salmon Dessert area so so  This place is like an upgraded hotel buffet you'd find in a normal town.   Skip it.

Wky6lzxVNZUuMpd2O3y1Zg.text: Service was great. The food was fairly bland. Bought a voucher on Groupon so for that it was worth the price. I definitely think you can find better for the price..even on the strip. Crab legs were good..but that is about it. Overall, it was 'meh.'

4b1HfC0QW-CmH_6IYGg8gA.text: This buffet depressed me.  And food normally is my friend (it never leaves me and turns into cellulite-it loves me back). But the food here for the price is depressing. Even the view of the beautiful flamingoes didn't help. The service also not the greatest.   The brunch buffet doesn't seem to have any flow or organization. The live cooking stations seemed understaffed. I got in line for an omelet behind four people. My first mistake was getting other food-pancakes and French toast first so they got cold while I was waiting forever.  There was one guy doing it. My omelet was really good. I will say that. Get your omelet first then go for other things.   My next trip I got a crepe and some pastries the woman doing the crepes spread them out on the first crepe thing let that side cook, picked it up by hand and transferred it to the other crepe thing to finish it. Folded it with her hand and flopped it on a plate with her hand. What??? No spatulas... I should mention she was wearing gloves but hello? Cross contamination anyone? Raw batter on her gloves...  I am going to brunch which as we all know is inherently classy...I didn't feel very classy with my mimosa in a plastic cup. Am I at a frat party?     The server was in LaLaLand, she never looked directly at us.   Oh and the pizza was bad. I don't even know why I tried that. I had two desserts one was like a chocolate mousse thing with a metric ton of cinnamon on it. Weird. And I think it was a mango mousse thing. I have never actually wanted to spit a dessert out until this monstrosity hit my taste buds.   One of my dining companions got an omelet it was raw. He took it to the manger and she did right by us she refunded his buffet.  I asked if they were understaffed and she said actually today we are overstaffed.  Well you could have fooled the flamingoes out of me because the amount of time I waited in line at the live cooking stations tells a very different story.  Let's revisit the organization of this buffet.  Salad bar in the center as all buffets do. But from when you walk in this is the way the stations are laid out: bagels, rolls, biscuits, butter, toppings-breakfast meats (bacon, sausage) mashed potatoes, Mac and cheese-made to order breakfast potatoes-made to order omelets-rice, gravy, pancakes, French toast, syrup, biscuits with hollandaise-sandwiches, bread, cold cuts, cheeses-pizza-desserts-cereal and muffins-made to order crepes-Danishes and croissants. There's no rhyme or reason or cohesive flow.   This is the worst buffet ever. The food is mediocre at best.  The manager did do right by us though.  Oh and my booth seat needed to keep being readjusted. It wasn't in right.   Just bad. Just don't.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view is the only redeeming quality!
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepe literally made by hand...no spatulas involved. Do not appreciate the risk of cross contamination
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa served in plastic just like a frat party!

tKUVPrvpVV40m0nU2qsgFg.text: Average buffet. A couple levels up from a continental breakfast. I used the groupon with three friends, which was a great deal but probably wouldn't come here if it was full price.  There is a nice omelette bar, crepe station, fresh fruits and salads. The bacon looked less than appetizing and sat in a pool of grease. Some items definitely looked more fresh than others...  The brunch buffet includes "unlimited" mimosas or bloody Mary's. It took ages for our server to even come over (to be fair she seemed like she had a ginormous section to serve), so we only got a couple mimosas in. However they are very sweet, and when asked if  and we could have more champagne instead of juice in them she said no, despite what other reviewers have mentioned.  The other weird thing is they wouldn't accept BC drivers license as ID, and said we could only use our passports? We thought this was bizarre and have never encountered this before...  All in all wouldn't come back but if you had a groupon it's OK.

fijiZcIIcw7oPyiu1ju4nw.text: Omg ! The food was just amazing!  Lots of steak option and unlimited crab legs, everything was delicious, Service is really good! I am glad they have a sales at groupon now!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WeoiydPDYk8qgeUWgcLZDQ.text: Got a buffet pass and stopped at Paradise for a snack at dinner time. No line kinda told the story of what we were about to experience (which we are all happy we didn't pay full price for).   We got a cool seat neat the flamingo's outside. If only the buffet was as nice as the view. Everything was just below what you would expect of a Vegas buffet in 2018. One portion even seems completely cut off, so it is as if they had to downsize the buffet because no one was using it.

uRnFsMOugJRr3OrOGJAFHQ.text: I wanted to take my mom around Vegas to have fun for her birthday! But it didn't turn out so good, swear we all  ended up with food poisoning after we ate here,literally as soon as we left! I'm not going back, we could barely make it back to the hotel room we were all so sick! Looking back it was funny yet horrible at the same time lol. I only gave it 2 stars for the friendly people(waiter)who was very nice also I'm not a complete a**hole....other then that,food was sitting out and old, I was smart enough not to eat much! Anyways nope not doing this buffet first and last time! Vegas buffets aren't as good as they used to be!

7phhXjEzALCXEVvnhW7zcQ.text: Overpriced.  They advertise 21.99 with bottomless mimosas and u pay $36.00 and have to pay extra for mimosas.     Buffet is average at best.    GO SOMEWHERE ELSE

xms1hSLJLQXYWqkTx8H9wA.text: I was not impressed at all. Honestly the food was not good- the only good thing was the crepes. And by good I mean not terrible. The service was worse. The wait was long to even see her/ the we had to flag someone down in our area and apparently she was 'covering' so we actually had a different waitress.  And she was was downright rude - and to like 4 tables near her. To the point it was discussed amongst the tables. The mimosas were watered down and eh. Overall the only good experience was we had a window seat so we had a nice view

O_50AjZSv4yu0AiUAT2qjQ.text: We went for unlimited brunch on a weekday. It was $52 ($100 value) for a party of four for bottomless bloody mary and mimosas. The breakfast food was delicious! However, prime rib could've been less salty.   I got freshly made crepes with strawberries and chocolate topped with whipped cream. They had an omelet bar and I requested easy over eggs.  The service was great! We absolutely loved our server.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TFE7xsBHy8aKkCLc0eaV9A.text: Not quite like what I remember from eating there years ago. It's sad that the quality of their food has gone down. The food is dry & lacks flavor. Imagine food sitting under the warmers for hours, yeah not quite appealing. The server we had was nice & attentive but the ones serving behind the food bars weren't very happy. There was one guy behind the carving station that treated us like we were vagrants looking for hand outs. I highly doubt we will visit there again.

sA6zIF18tyEv5B1rsQ79Xw.text: This is a buffet in need of a serious makeover.   On a busy Saturday night, no lines at 7pm might sound tempting, but after experiencing the quality of the food, it's probably in your best interest to search for food elsewhere.  Almost anything else would be a better option for your $30.    The selection is very limited, and within your choices, even fewer were actually good.   The carving station provided a decent prime rib and my wife said the turkey was not bad.   A korean pork dish over white rice was the only item I considered getting a second serving of.   The asparagus had no flavor.  I spit out the shrimp tacos.   A lot of the clam shells were missing its contents inside.   Salads looks inedible and probably left out all day since there's no one to eat and replace it from the salad station.   The biggest draw for this buffet on the weekend is supposed to be its crab legs.   Sorry, but it's smaller and less flavorful than the Asian buffet down the road.    Finally the dessert section is limited and nothing stood out  to save the meal.   It's a shame.   Service itself was average at best.   Took a few moments to flag servers for refills.  Tables were dirty when we arrived.  We were walked to a booth that was dirty and had to wait for it to be wiped down.   Can't see myself supporting this buffet in the future if it remains in its current state.

PLXcPVKmfk7nqNEGPLIvOQ.text: The food is decent the view and location is great! My favorite thing was the fettuccine Alfredo! Just feeling like most of the food is missing flavor and spices

QyQOuLTegn4GAgXfPWXs2g.text: Worst buffet ever food was cold not a lot of options dessert horrible as well  To get a small miniature beer plastic cup 10 min or more why even pay for beer included if beer is hot by time it gets to table  Honestly super disappointed regret spending my money here  Never again !

QYdADzjbEJCqpRN5TIMf5w.text: The 2** Bright Spots  "Paradise?"  This Buffet was anything but . . .   1* is for Miss Julie, who works the Brunch ~ Window section looking out @ the Flamingos in the Wildlife Habitat.  Best Server & Best View!  The excellent Chef who cooked the Best Omelets ever earned 1* also.    But the quality of the food was sadly lacking.  There is not room here to detail the disappointments.   I've never had a bad Mimosa before ~ but whatever "Champagne" was mixed with "OJ" was sickly sweet & overpowering.    I was really looking forward to the Crepes, but none today .  Desserts were mostly stale.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Uy1HhMsBQUQPDqoCpSNOLw.text: I hate to use such a negative description, but this buffet was truly awful.  We stopped here for lunch because we had purchased the 24 hour pass where you can eat at any M Life property buffet as many times as you want in that 24 hour period.  I've been to almost every buffet on the strip and this was the worst.    First of all the line to get in took about 30 minutes even though there were only a handful of  people in front of us all because there was one person working and each transaction at the register took at least 5 minutes.  Lots of people in line just walked away.  One hostess walked over to see how big the line was and deemed it unnecessary to open another register.  And when we finally got seated about 75% of the restaurant was empty so I couldn't believe they wouldn't want to move the line along quicker and get people in. Even when we left, the place was still empty and the line was still long and moving slowly.  The food selection is the smallest of any buffet I've been to in my life.  There were honestly about 60% less food options than every other Vegas buffet, and worst of all, there were fruit flies in the salad and dessert bar.  How gross!  The place was just filthy and our server only gave us a drink refill once.  Needless to say, we will never return.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old, dirty, and bad service.
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiny buffet and fruit flies in fruit and dessert.  Gross!

BbOHjrd9wG5UOk955SGdtQ.text: Let me start by saying I love the Flamingo Hotel.  Stay there all the time.  But this is a horrible buffet.  Horrible.  The food choices are boring (and limited) and the quality is low at best.  This is just a Golden Corral in a better room. And the room isn't that much better.   I would never recommend this pace, not for breakfast, lunch or dinner.  Too expensive, not good.  Pay an extra dollar or two and go to one of the nicer buffets in the area.

Qk01IapMybmDX9LMxq7-WA.text: It was the week between Xmas and NYE in Vegas. There were so many people there...all the more popular buffets like the Paris and Spice(planet hollywood) were packed! There was literately a line to get in line.  Since me and my friend were in a hurry to catch a show and had bought the buffet of buffets pass, we wanted to get some food in our tummys before the show started. I remember Flamingo was the closest one that was open.  The lines werent too terrible. Both me and my friend were surprised at all the delicious asian food they had. It was authentic and a lot faster than ordering at a restaurant. Since they had a make your own Pho bar, I mixed all my fav stuff, and used UDON noodles instead of the traditional PHO noodles. It was delicious. Definitely give it a try. Bet you cant get that at ur pho or japanese restaurant!  I didnt really have time or the stomach for the other stuff that night, I've been here before, everything else was decent.  Not the best in vegas, but definitely a good alternative if you dont wanna walk to Paris, Spice, or Rio.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ninja please

UzlhSPDpzAHMc9mqqVFQtg.text: Not open Sundays for dinner even though yelp and group on say so, flamingos staff were rude about it

nQbqkTCuQgk93HdxU3bLIg.text: Stayed at the Flamingo tried the Buffet. Wasn't impressed, food did not taste like good quality. $19.99 a person without alcohol is kinda pricey for a mediocre buffet. Food was lack luster, I went back for seconds to get my moneys worth but really wasnt into the taste of the food.  Caesars has a way better one for $1 more!   Save your money and go somewhere better

laDr0TVBXuPpt3R0pv3DEw.text: We got the Buffet of Buffets Pass for this Vegas trip, so we had to try as many buffets as we can. We came to Paradise Garden Buffet the next morning for breakfast. First of all, I don't know why people even waited in line for this place. Secondly, I don't know why anyone would wanna pay the single Buffet price for this place neither. To quote my boyfriend on this place: "it was low ass iHop quality food for high ass prices". I couldn't say anything here was worth making another trip down the buffet line for. The restaurant itself was old and outdated. The presentation of the food was served on steam tables like at a Chinese buffet. The flavor was lacking in ALL the food and desserts. If you get the buffet of buffets pass, I would skip this place. If you're looking to purchase and eat at a single buffet restaurant for your Vegas experience, I would DEFINITELY skip this one. No way would I pay $20+ for a breakfast/brunch/lunch buffet here. Go somewhere else and get better food.

nvbAtcRDEYKfON3TJAkIDw.text: Sunday Brunch is always a good meal and it comes with mimosas. Decent selection of breakfast and lunch foods and a very expansive dessert area.

_08g0oBq7jP--bCjyPLabQ.text: Worst breakfast buffet I've ever eaten! VERY long line for two omelette cooks! No breakfast rolls one  would expect to see at breakfast. Poor selection of fresh fruit

Mq2jT0awqONwMTGIBeefIg.text: Sunday Brunch Buffet ran $24.99, It should have been more like $8.99 in a cheap downtown hotel. It was pathetic. The view was great, loved overlooking the gardens, sadly the food was disgusting. Dry, flavorless, cold, garbage. Horrible service that informed us halfway through our meal that she was leaving to go home... No one else came after she left. The "Shrimp Soup" was so fishy, the pizza's were dry, the mayo was warm, and Helga the hashbrown slinger was a rude beast of a woman full of crabby sass. It was a HUGE waste of money, pick ANY other buffet on the strip and I assure you, you'll have a better experience.

TsvyuG-_7L5K6Y1KK44WrQ.text: This was a delightful surprise for my daughter and I. We sat in a high backed booth and gorged on crab and shrimp. I love the view to the outside garden and grounds. We had a slightly pesky "waiter" and would have preferred to have been left alone but like the professional feel of this buffet. The room is set up a bit more privately than other buffets so we had a restaurant experience and will be back for sure. All of the food areas were clean and well stocked. It's a bummer when you go to a buffet and the shrimp are out! Not here. I say go!!!

s5wquWEcDmCDSuFC5yY4TQ.text: Part of the buffet of buffet program. Came in for breakfast and it is pretty average if not weak. The omelet station is the one shining star, made a nice western omelet that was very well prepared. The rest of the buffet is just a collection of side dishes and standard breakfast fare, nothing special. The lucky charms are always a bonus. At first we tried the Caesars buffet but there is a $30 up charge for the holiday brunch so that will be our noontime destination. It looks pretty good, far more diverse than the Flamingo. The Flamingo had just one lonely ham as the carving station. Bottom line this is not the option with so many better ones right next door.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basic breakfast
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best part of he meal

l4tov86rKyoFET9j6Xkzmg.text: Even though it says open from 7-10 this is not True they close in the middle of the day but will still sell us full price pass for 14 min of buffet time.... Go anywhere but here

0DU28FJNBQohXQQEIuZ5jQ.text: The only reason we ate here was it was free with our purchase of show tickets for Legends in Concert.    Otherwise, it would of been $24.99 per person before tax for dinner.    The food was bland and flavorless.  The crab legs weren't cut open like the buffets at Wynn, Paris or Planet Hollywood.    Service was good, but the food was awful.  It's worth paying an extra $10-$15 for a better buffet some where else.

4N3LcYe01qfYjXFr7Mp-1g.text: DO NOT EAT HERE!  I had the 24 hour buffet pass and this was by far the WORST buffet. Not only the choices are limited but the foods that they have look unappetizing and borderline disgusting. Service was not good either. I am a Seven Stars member and the service I received here was NOTHING compared to the service I usually receive at other buffets. Save your hard earned money and visit a different buffet.

TlSfG2z5tF3OyNV5Qeshbg.text: Went in for Monday brunch. For the pricing it is worth eating there (20 for unlimited mimosas and bloodymary and food). The food is alright, I recommend the teriyaki salmon and French toast. The employees are also friendly

vcJIWefG_DoOHKWCOZuRXQ.text: Tiny mediocre buffet for a World Famous resort destination, how could this be?! The food is just ok, nothing nothing special. Cut up ham sandwiches as a highlight item for Sunday Brunch? Grocery store style sushi, average breakfast items, mediocre salad bar. Cafeteria is a good word that describes the place. I live in Henderson and we have a neighborhood buffet at the Fiesta casino that is 5 times larger in comparison. Once again a multimilllion dollar casino with a chuck wagon buffet? I appologize to the tourists that come from all over the world to eat here, sorry. Service is good, watiress was attentive. That is about it, out.

jMM1RcuXysR-REj-x1GRPQ.text: I had the best dining experience sitting by the window with the view of the live flamingos! The breakfast buffet was good and the mimosa bar was refreshing. I also thought the decor was charming; it's a different feel than the other hotel buffets but I like that better. A must try!

UE-sgoUsspk88yHhfIrmEw.text: Didn't expect this buffet to be so filling. There breakfast isn't so bad and fake tasting, the waiter kept taking our empty plates which was a little bit disturbing since we were still eating. They also had mimosas which is cool since it is Vegas, whats Vegas without alcohol haha. Food was good not disappointed about that. But the waiter trying to take our plates excessively was annoying. Affordable price and a great view of some flamingos.

C4HM6GONCkhMy_V1yHO8zQ.text: The buffet was a no frills kind of place that was clean and the food was pretty good as well not to mention decent prices. The crowd encompassed a marriage entourage, international tourists, some folks looking as though the had partied hard the night before, you know all types. Great after paying and once sitting down.......  The part I wasn't so keen on was the fact that my party of two wanted to sit by the window where the view of the garden would have been to die for was told by one cafeteria lady that they were cleaning up so seating was else where....I get that. What I didn't care for was when she slipped and told us that "The woman working the area didn't want to clean it up after we finished....really?  Overall we loved the place it was right across from our hotel and the food was good. I would still recommend it but ask that the management deal with that type of behavior.

b3O2h6rPjeNn0OYniMP4kQ.text: OH MY DEEEELISH!!! I must admit that sometimes the Vegas buffets can be nasty and not too classy for me. With a combo package for a show and dinner we went to Paradise.   This place is huge and all the entrees, desserts, breads and condiments are in seperate stations. You even have views of the strip in certain areas of the dining room.   Waitstaff stay on top of your refills. There are so many different items to suit every need of a meal healthy or not and everything that I had here was very well prepared and good. AWESOME!!   ** Tip: Restrooms are not located inside the restaurant so you'll have to leave and go back outside lobby make a right around the corner and down the aisle to the left...:()

DEWerXtKqBgBUVg0ZAeYJg.text: I really enjoyed eating from the buffet at Paradise Garden, as well as entertained by a couple of the servers and other Vegas patrons. For the price that you are paying ($17.99-$18.99 with a Player's card) per person, you would expect a buffet to have everything? Judging what I saw and couldn't finish, I would say that it did. The standards of pancakes, bacon, eggs, sausage on one table, along with an omelette station that usually has long lines. A large salad bar is evident, as well as an additional station that serves crepes and a TON of dessert assortments such as muffins, mousses, doughnuts, cookies, and even ice cream. I even saw a table that had pizza slices on it, for breakfast!   An additional station also served mimosas and Bloody Mary cocktails, which are always good in the morning. The waiting staff was pretty attentive on both of my visits, to include one time where an international couple was trying to scam a server into comping their meal by scraping toast crumbs into their milk. Really, people? The server was professional in solving their "problem", yet also called them out on it to where they were embarrassed about it and went about eating their meal.   Aside from laughing my butt off at the wannabe scammers, I enjoyed my time at this buffet on both days that I stopped in. Key point to remember using your Flamingo Player's card to obtain more points every time that you eat here or at any other restaurant venue within the hotel & casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decent-sized omelette with bacon.
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry crepes, with sausage &amp; bacon.
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepes station.

p93_S9mjGaqPJSOK5sjwQQ.text: This place is very friendly, food is quiet fresh I don't know why it got such poor reviews, it's our darling. I'm vegetarian and still their sushi and salads are perfect. My partner says that their meat is also really good. I'd strongly recommend you give it a chance. Especially try their Nutella crepes with fresh strawberries on the side. They are on Groupon too!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SPs_xDm8ZlEa5xZGNay4Jw.text: We ate brunch here on a Saturday morning. It was definitely worth the price. (Which I thought would be more.) The atmosphere was amazing, the food on point, and the customer service genuine. We had a great dinning experience and highly recommend this buffet.

lVSwLhirAAi_j7OXHHseuw.text: The ambiance is very dated and cost is very pricey.  Expect the typical Eggs Benedict, Hashed Browns, Bacon, Sausage, Cooked-to-Order Omelettes, Smoked Salmon, Baked Items, limited Fresh Fruit, Dessert Bar, etc.. Don't expect anything new or unusual like a Short Rib Eggs Benedict, Udon Noodles, etc...  Will satisfy your breakfast needs if you don't want to venture from the hotel.  Would not make a special trip for this place.

vcfxwdPle_y96gU-VUDqZg.text: This is hands down the worst buffet I have ever had. Came here 8 years ago and it was wonderful. They ask if you want $1 unlimited mimosas...don't do it. Who puts ice in a mimosa? The drink was bad the food was worse. My husband who loves crap food couldn't even eat it. Terrible. We were worried we would get food poisoning. Worst was we were running to the restroom shortly after. Salad was old and gross and it was the best thing we had. Everything was runny and nasty. Beware.

aw7RWybos-mhoESe6zNM1g.text: Not bad. If you're looking for lavish, this isn't the place. However, the food was decent, service was efficient and kind, and restaurant was clean. We enjoyed the unlimited mimosas for breakfast that we had no idea were included in the price until the server mentioned it to us. The view of the gardens and flamingos is excellent, the room is bright and cheerful. There is an early bird special from 7-8am that is a more discounted price. We went around 7:30 and there was no wait and all food was freshly put out. The fruit was freshly sliced, made-to-order crepes were yummy, and everything we tried was decent. Now, this isn't the Wynn or Caesar's Palace by any means...but if you want a reasonably priced buffet in a nice relaxing location, try it.

Q8P8N2wYP9TNbg_ds8k4lA.text: Average brunch items, crapy service. How do you charge $27 for brunch and not have English tea or camomile???? They only have have southern sweet iced tea bags (for hot tea). People seem like they didn't want to be there, a real energy drainer for me. Totally killed the mood.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nUufecT4N-U8J8r3iSRKEA.text: If your cheap or lacking money or taste buds... this brunch is for you!  The mimosas were undrinkable, which my friend and I were beyond surprise to say. The food, let's say this, we both got one plate.. it ended up being salad and then we decided to leave.   Just not our cup of tea.. it's a tacky brunch buffet. No way am I coming to Vegas eating this mess. They need to update the facilities... clean the pond and greenery... it doesn't look like the picture.. more of a dull version.  We really did try to enjoy ourselves, but apparently we couldn't  The service was nice tho

YNLMwqAHFx0eXCQoI78FNw.text: To be honest it's pretty pricey for the quality of food you are getting. Yes I understand it's a statement hotel being "The Flamingo" but it's nothing too special.

EbkzrNN5CjknZNRmWcpuIw.text: Usual buffet spread in a very clean setting. Love relaxing watching the wildlife and waterfalls. Nice to get away from the casino floor for a while. Don't expect high quality but the food is descent. Much better value if you buy the Buffet of Buffets pass.

y5owaPg0x0OU5MIB4Oov9Q.text: I should have listened to the warnings in the other reviews! Such a disappointment of a buffet, definitely ranks in the worst buffets I've been to in Vegas, and I am quite the buffet enthusiast!   To start off, it is extremely outdated and everything looks so dingy and old. The service from our waiter was probably the only good thing about this experience. My family and I went on Prime Rib night, and the prime rib tasted like rubber. There is not much of a selection of food and everything is everywhere !!! The limited food they did have taste like freezer foods, not fresh at all! I'm also pretty sure the pizza was freezer Digornio. Absolutely no order to the food. So if your looking for what they call "sushi", it's in between the ice cream machine and the rest of the desserts ... seriously!! And if you want taco meet that looks and probably taste like like cat food, then you can come here :/  Stay away from this place !

lNvUz52_vwmpVeo6Arf0Og.text: Came here for dinner buffet and it wasn't worth the price. The adult buffet price is way over priced for the quality of the food. Found the food lacking in flavor from the salads to the wide range of meats and seafood. There are other buffets in the area that are better financial bargain and more flavorful food.

CS2OAK14yqOct2OlVsW9VA.text: Went for breakfast on our final day in Vegas as we were staying at the Flamingo and didn't want to carry our luggage all over town while we killed time between checking out and the shuttle arriving.   For $20, I think this place was a pretty good value, especially considering the fact that the price included all-you-can-drink mimosas or bloody marys. There are about four or five buffet tables featuring fruit, traditional American breakfast fare, crepes, pastries, and Mexican breakfast options.  As with any buffet, the food was hit and miss, but I thoroughly enjoyed the Mexican offerings.  And if you've got time to kill like we did, getting trashed on free mimosas is pretty sweet.  It's not the fanciest of buffets, but it does have a nice scenic view of the nature preserve.  Oddly, they play club music at 9:30 in the morning.  I found this a little weird at first but once I got my buzz on I was singing along with the music.   Get there before 10:30 for breakfast to avoid a big line.

CWinNY-m9Em07Lwsare84A.text: What can I say, very disappointed!  We decided to stop and eat the buffet on a Sunday brunch. Went to line purchased brunch, we were greeted by staff and were not able to accommodate our large group of 12. Which was ok, we sat separate . All was good until the waitress freaked out about our receipt which was on the table last time I walked to get food ( which obviously she saw before we got up to get food )She was saying her manager keeps a close eye and needed  to make sure receipt was correct. Uhhh you would think that was confirmed once you payed. The waitress proceeded to the other part of our party asking for there receipt and they didn't have there receipt either she started to freak out. It was very confusing due to the fact we were in the restaurant eating for 15 to 20 minutes already. Waitress continue to state that her manager was very strict and needed to find theses receipts. Waitress continue to ask me to check my purse once again for the receipt. So we continued to eat with no problems. However I could tell waitress was stressing over receipt. I offered to talk to manager if there was a problem but she refused. Shame on management if they stress out the staff to the point that they cannot perform a good job!!!  Buffet: selection was not that great I am pretty sure there was more of a selection at old country buffet. Food was cold. The one pro was the taquitos had a good chipotle sauce  but were cold.  Desert were prepackaged  products and staff was literally pushing me to the side to place food on  Anyways I rather pay more and get good food than go through this again.

D--kW1P1Lub6F28C3RHelA.text: Fri night dinner with Groupon.  Low quality, limited selection of mundane entrees (especially desserts) and sporadic service.  Prime Rib was not tender with a hint of "corned beef" taste.  Buffet was comparable to "Hometown" and a step below Boyd and Station casinos.  Understandable why they need to use Groupon to lure customers.

2kSBIKuNkPJMFvd4zoMHpw.text: Worst experience I've had the crap had little to no meat at all In them payed almost 90 bucks for me and my friend to go and crap food whine was cheap and nasty only good thing about this place is desert area and that's sad who doesn't even have chicken tf is wrong with this crap buffet and I've been to plenty here in Vegas but by far this is the worst one yet don't waste your time or money

mYUlO8DH2BUs6ECtp2qPcA.text: We got a groupon for this. $45 for two. Amazinggggg deal! The food was amazing. We LOVED the prime rib and crabs! Our servor was also  so nice! The decor was so beautiful! I also loved the desserts! Each one was perfect. This place exceeded my expectations!

_cqI-gnYXFTjiHr9ScA8lw.text: Wonderful breakfast buffet while staying at the Flamingo.  The view is a peaceful spot in the middle of all the craziness.  Great food choices!  Omelette station, crepe station, breakfast burritos, breakfast desserts and oh wow the kale/quinoa/berry salad and the merengues! Yum!

iot_9SEL0nKRsWvfSgLnJg.text: Do not go here for lunch/ dinner if you DO NOT LIKE SEAFOOD. I wish I would have came for breakfast because the buffet was primarily crab, shrimp, mediocre sushi and a salad bar with some fruit. I have had MUCH BETTER buffets at that price. On the bright side, the sangria is good.

zczMsYU6pfbsgVEt43M0Qw.text: I went to a lunch and a dinner when I was in LV,the dinner is much more better than lunch. The food is not many, but the taste is good. Especially for dinner snow crab legs. If you sit in a window seat you can enjoy flamingos and fish.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ajIdRhhvSu6cJfXTZD25cA.text: While I imagined the buffet to be over the top for being in Vegas, I guess you get what you pay for.    For $17.99 pp and less for children, you get a thawing snow crab legs, thawing cocktail shrimp and so-so cooked seafood.  The sushi bar, if you want to call it that, consisted of smoked salmon (pretty good)  they keep running out of, california roll and salmon roll.  I think that's it.  There's a ham carving station that turns into the prime rib during lunch.  That was the highlight of my meal and I'm not a meat eater.  I am not much of an omelet eater when I'm out, since I make really good ones at home.    My little cutie pie was so excited about the cotton candy machine, like he needs anymore sugar. I rarely have him eat that crap, but since we're on vacation and the look in his adorable face...well we let him have one.  Hubby liked the crepes as well.  I'm disappointed because we have Pacific Buffet in Arizona for $16.99 dinner that blows this place away.  Don't forget to get your rewards card in the lobby to get 10% off your bill.  There was also a coupon the cashier asked from us we can't find anywhere for 20% more off.

UXPV0_A1526ZACTQjUIq3A.text: The Paradise Garden Buffet use to be one of the best buffet but it has sadly declined in quality and service. The line to the buffet can get pretty long unless you're a Diamond tier level for Total Rewards then you can avoid the long and be seated right away. The decor of the buffet has that 80's Beach Boys vibe because that was the last time the Flamingo had a major renovation. My seat cushion kept falling off every time I went to start a new plate and the flooring needed to be replaced too!  The food is was pretty average and the layout from one station to the other is just horrible and on the far end of the buffet behind the wall was a dessert section and I didn't even know it was there until I wanted to see what the other side of the buffet looked like. They really need to update this buffet to compete with the other buffets and some of the staff are pretty rude and some very friendly, I wouldn't put this buffet on my worst buffet list:   Emperors Buffet - Imperial Palace  (Old and rundown buffet with old tasting food)  Paradise Garden - Buffet (Horrible layout and quality)  Roundtable Buffet - Excalibur (Food is too salty)  More Buffet - Luxor  (Low quality)  Dishes Buffet - Treasure Island (Small and no enough selection)

0UqbTaPqIioS7ZLFdi0BQA.text: Their salmon from carving station was so dry I couldn't eat it, while my wife and kids were comparing about overcooked crab legs. Then while leaving we heard other people complain about overcooked crab legs. These people don't know how to cook and are destroying their own business. They've been struggling for years, so their quality and selection went down, but what's so f... difficult to not overcook crab legs or salmon? You just cook them less for god's sake! You'd save money on energy by not overcooking food and you'd make your customers happy. But Flamingo cannot even do that. They must cook their crab legs and salmon like hard boiled eggs for no reason other than having no cooking skills. Can't you people go to some training and learn how long to cook salmon and crab legs? Why would you want your customers to not come back and yourself be out of jobs? Do you just walk around like zombies not knowing what you're doing there? Don't you understand that food is your business and all you have to do is to not make it so dry that people can't wait it? How do you expect to keep your jobs?!

9ZKzxshieU6I1HSG3_xpHQ.text: We caught the end of lunch and the beginning supper. The salad and soup portion was good. The dessert bar was outstanding. It was almost as long as the hot food bar.  The hot bar was ok but the weakest area. King crab legs were cold. Boiled shrimp real good. Fried chicken was only fair.  Our server, Jose, was very proficient. We had a great table with a view of the paradise garden with birds, fish etc was very nice.  We would do it again.

VZpypb7sz-Z22PzVIPqqUQ.text: The buffet was just okay, food seemed old and the sliced beef was impossible to cut through! The champagne/mimosas were just okay, not stingy with the champagne. Service is non-existent. With all the buffets in Vegas, I would skip this one next time I travel there.

e897VwberWEJ1Fi7EcG2PQ.text: I was there on July 9th 2014. Walked in, paid for two, tried the food and walked out immediately. It was very bad. Nothing was fresh. Don't go there. Save your money, I was very surprised. Another Vegas buffet that went down the hill.

OO0evjYmO4cEqHa7csE5HA.text: This place gives buffets a bad name. I hadn't eaten prior to my flight so it has been a good 8 hours and I was starved so it wouldn't have taken too much to make me happy. A $20 lunch gets you a surly waitress and a limited and tasteless selection of food. Even the desserts were bad. Makes Golden Corral look like a 5 star restaurant. I guess the place had a nice view of the courtyard but I wasn't given a seat near the window.

6PED-aR6Hjo8NeTkfQu3Sw.text: Two times I've gone here, I've only had their breakfast buffet. Either times, I can't deny the options they have from their option of chicken & waffles and a simple egg, bacon, and hashbrown optioned breakfast. Could be one of the smaller ones but the food they offer is good enough for breakfast. They also have a dessert/fruit section as well as a salad bar with shrimp cocktails as well. Best tip is to come around 10:30am and stay until 11:00am so you get the brunch meal with options of crab legs and prime rib. The food isn't too bad and with the longer waits at other places, you can't go wrong coming here. Though a warning to you is the service is not so great. Not a lot of people working so you can be sure that once you are done with your first dish and back to start eating on your second dish that your first plate is still there at the table. Refills take a while if you don't ask your server. They don't come refill for you if you don't ask. Though the food is decent and there's not much of a wait, the customer service needs to get better here.

qb-l3uenoJH03KdV8mgDJg.text: Poor food quality and selection. Service is also slow. Definitely not worth the price. With so many other dining options, choose somewhere else. The lines are also long because of the small selection.

1d-LoPBUSuLcz7je6RAv2A.text: You get the sense of management just not caring for the place. Decorations around the food area are full of dust. Curtains towards the flamingos viewing area are sideways and dusty. Seriously how hard to keep things presentable. Just imagine how bad the kitchen is - it's not like we can see what goes on back there. NOTE TO SELF - SKIP THIS PLACE

CG1aO2xUvCykSyaA7Apgmw.text: Received a buy 1 get 1 free coupon for this buffet and that wasn't the case. Only received $10 off. The food was terrible. Dinner rolls were hard. Beef tasted as if it sat under the heat lamp for 6 hours. Only thing decent was salad and cookies. I do not recommend this establishment even if the food was free.

Ojp-b6gQnHQ1FUaiHuVu_Q.text: I wish that Yelp would let you give stars on specific aspects of the experience and then average a star rating because parts of my Breakfast Buffet experience were decent and parts were terrible.  First the good:  The food, it was good.  Nothing spectacular, but exactly what I expected from a buffet at the Flamingo.  Decent variety, food was fresh.  I had eggs about 300 ways (with chorizo, rancheros, breakfast burrito, benedict) and they were all good.  The shrimp cocktail was the bomb, the chocolate fountain was just kitschy enough to be fun.  I wouldn't complain.  I left full and ate nothing that was disappointing.  The blah: The price.  Right at $50 for 2 Breakfast buffets, food only.  Not worth it.  I can't eat that much for breakfast, and I know how much eggs cost.  Breakfast buffets should never run over $20 bucks unless I can get lobster, and maybe bottomless mimosas.  The bad: The service!   The women working the cash registers were rude.  Our server was incredibly overwhelmed, which was not the real problem.  The problem was the other servers in other areas refusing to step in and help out.  All we needed to drink were waters.  It took us 20 minutes to get water.  I tried to flag down 3 servers outside of our own who was serving tables as fast as she could and I was shrugged of by each although their areas were obviously slower than ours.  That was a major disappointment.  Our server was incredibly polite and apologetic about the wait and once she caught herself up, was very attentive.  But overall there was a lack of team work to keep things flowing and customers happy.  Overall I was happy with the food, but for 25 bucks a head I feel like I can expect decent customer service as well.  That was lacking and I would not go back or recommend this buffet to others because of this.  Sorry Flamingo, you have to do better.

1nR7ZQiFz3-I6vQCc9mRhg.text: Had brunch here with my family and really enjoyed it.  I wouldn't say that the food selection was all that great or all that delicious....but the interior was bright and friendly and my children loved the outdoor garden area with flamingos and other creatures that we could watch while we dined.  It was priced right for a mid-range buffet.

jYmwuVlfySiFpxT5Gc1qhw.text: This buffet was mediocre compared to the other buffets in las vegas. My friends and I went to this buffet using the buffet of buffet deal. I would definitely not ever pay full price to go and eat here. The selection was small and disappointing. I didnt like the decor its very dated and the whole place needs a renovation.  I did like the view of the outside of the flamingo property but that was it.

bldx4v_J0pu1vseOv-tb3w.text: Now I've been to at least 2 dozen Vegas buffets, and consider myself somewhat of a Vegas buffet connoisseur....and this is the first one that has caused me to say "Wow, that isn't worth anywhere near what I paid!!!"  At most Vegas buffets, you get more or less what you pay for.  My main area of expertise is the Champagne Brunch, and Vegas has quite the variety.  I've seen everything from the $8.99 Sahara (RIP) that served their champagne in plastic cups from some bizarre powdery mixture, to the Bellagio, which for $25 will get you a good selection of high-quality food and the coldest milk money can buy, to the Wynn, where $45 will get you every bizarre food under the sun (yet somehow omit the one food you crave most at any brunch buffet.....bacon).  Anyways....The Flamingo buffet hits bottom rung in pretty much every category.  Poor selection, poor quality, high price, and to top it off you have to pay $10 extra for champagne (unless you happen to be a diamond Total Rewards member)!  At $25 plus $10 for champagne, you get basically the smallest buffet in Vegas.  They do throw a few crab legs and shrimp in to justify the price, but don't be fooled.  They were well-below-average quality, even for buffet standards.  And the rest of the buffet is no better....I've seen $10 Fremont-strip buffets with twice the selection and better quality!  The wait staff was friendly and attentive, so I have no qualms there.  However, they were balanced off by the surly crepe chef....  I get to the front of the line and ask for my crepe with "everything".  She says, "Everything?"  I say ,"Yes, everything," and point to each of the toppings (apple, strawberry, chocolate, whipped cream, and nutella).  She gets angry, throws strawberries and chocolate on my crepe, and yells, "Next!"  Who does that?  It doesn't cost you anything.  Even if you think the combination is disgusting, just throw the junk on the crepe and the drunk idiot will go away and be happy.  Now you made him sad.  So if you happen to be in the market for a champagne brunch, pass by this one and don't look back.  There are plenty more that are well worth your while....TI, Paris, Aria, Planet Hollywood...just to name a few.

B91StNfukO1RkkgpBrr5Tw.text: You COULD probably find a better buffet. But i had completely forgotten that i had a $25 coupon for excessive wait time when I checked in to the hotel 2 days ago. My boyfriend and I had brunch for only $14 & some change. Can't beat that. It might not be the tastiest & fanciest but for that price, I'm not getting picky. Omelettes & crepes were being freshly made to order, coffee was good & employees are nice. If you aren't a total snob, you might just like this place.

mmpDJxB2krIz7qtUygpgmw.text: The flamingo buffet was truly awful. It costs 26 dollars and isn't worth the price. Most of the dishes were cold and tasted like shit. Some of the fruit was rotten and it's a poor selection. Don't waste 26 dollars, harrahs buffet is the same price and 10 times better.

54cc7WYNuSzwn7cXivBD9g.text: This review is mainly for breakfast (although we went almost in time for lunch, so got to sample a couple of the lunch items as well).  We always stay at the Flamingo while in Vegas (love it!), and end up eating here on the day we're checking out.  The environment is really sunny and nice with all the windows and the water/birds and stuff outside.. Really kind of cute.  The food is just pretty average for breakfast, nothing particularly stellar, but there's a pretty good amount of variety.  I must admit that I did sneak a little bag of cotton candy to eat a little later, mueheheh.  But hey what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas, right?  Had it not been in our hotel, we probably wouldn't have made a special trip, but for anyone staying there, it's okay, especially considering that the price is a little lower than other buffets around.

zsdNt8aHNGq2H4Csx-K7MQ.text: 2.51 stars.  What can I say?  The highlight of this buffet for me was the mashed potatoes with whole cloves of roasted garlic mixed in.  Yum.  The peel and eat shrimp was better than other buffets.  Crab legs were a fail.  The carving station meats were ok.  This buffet had pad thai...labeled as stuffed shells or something.  Strange.  The service was unimpressive bordering on rude and hurried.  Overpriced.

n4YzosjbP0xa8kHt8E7FRw.text: The food was subpar and not great. We got the discount from Tix4Tonight. So glad we didn't pay full price.  Make sure you either get the discount or a coupon.  Do not pay full price.  You will regret it.  The dessert area was ok especially the made to order crepes and the chocolate fountain. Don't forget to grab your cotton candy on the way out.

sKWQHj1C6fH7Jj8eAt3Bgw.text: Everyone talks about how awesome the food is in Las Vegas.  In my general opinion, a lot of it is OVERRATED.  You pay so much for so little.  At least at Flamingo you get your money's worth.  We loved the views of the gardens, and with bottomless mimosas, you cannot go wrong!!  The food isn't going to knock your socks off.  It's good, it's not great.  But again it's getting your money's worth after a long night in sin city.  We went in between breakfast and lunch time (10:30-11:30 ish) and that was great because we got to have both meals in one :)  They were out of champagne this last time and I was livid about that, so minus one star for Flamingo.  But I will go back again.

CobpJuvy6IxdxUojqBDzmA.text: Great place for a nice lunch buffet. The buffet was around $18. I loved the endless beer deal they have. $10 for coors or miller beer. I enjoyed about 6 or 7 beers and planned my next few hours of fun.

axQ9pyjpQjy60MsyQQ8C7Q.text: To make a long Story short: Dont waste your money.  for $22,00 you have free non-alcohol beverg. and you can choose from a small variety of food at the buffet.  the biggest problem is the quality of the food. sometimes it looks better then it tastes, but most of the time it tastes exactly so bad how it looks.  dont waste your money here, spend some extra bucks and eat somewhere else.

m-kf7639bRwyqG2iqCJEBw.text: Went to this buffet on a Thursday night when you get Prime Rib for only about $14.  There's not a hundred choices of what to eat but what there is tastes great.  The salad bar could use a lot more options but like I said earlier the food was terrific and the atmosphere was pleasing.  For breakfast there is a decent amount of choices and you can't go wrong for only $7.

jeoUIDidB4ZI6aJaZd7DDw.text: Price made it appealing, but you get what you pay for. This buffet absolutely sucks compared to the other buffets a short walk from here. Do yourself a favor and spend an extra $10 to go somewhere...anywhere else. I ate 1-1/2 plates, and didn't finish either one. The best thing they had was steamed carrots. I seriously would have rather gone to McDonalds. Plus the staff is pretty rude. It's the smallest buffet I've ever seen, even outside of Las Vegas. Save your money.

MhOF4xW64Dfvz4VE4Uc80Q.text: Food is dry or oily, perfect for the neighbors fog who poops on your lawn. Crepes are the only reason this place gets two stars

k4qobWPUPN8DJHPSeZP0bQ.text: The only reason I went here today was my 20% off coupon that I had.  It was breakfast I figured, you can't screw up breakfast food...wrong.  Where do I start.  It was more like a salad bar with breakfast as an after thought.  I mean what the hell do you have shrimp and salad on a breakfast buffet for?? Eggs benedict was rock hard, sausage old and dry, potatoes old and dry, made to order omelet person was MIA and the guy carving the ham, looked like he wanted to stab somebody.  About the only thing good here was the coffee.  I should have know better, but I got hooked by the price.  go to Denny's it is better and not far down the street.

UqGUWWSCF3oQ_FJiC1PaQg.text: The only reason we went to this buffet was because it was included free when we bought tickets for a show. The food here really isn't worth mentioning in detail (average across the board). The service was poor with long waits to refill drinks and to clear the empty plates from the table. On top of that the bathrooms were closed so you had to walk all the way across the casino to use one. Bottom line. There is no other reason to come to this buffet unless it's free (someone else is paying or you get free tickets).

HQai1Gbtaqv5_QhvwF3w4g.text: As far as buffets go this is less than average. The Paradise Garden Buffet boasts good food and $3.00 Bloody Mary's. Well the Bloody Mary's are not even worth the $3.00, so don't waste your money.   As far as the food except for the prime rib (which just came out when we hit the line) it is the typical over cooked dry tasteless buffet food for dinner. What made things worse was the Taco station with metal serving bowls on a icy stainless steel display. After sliding two bowls off the display I decided it wasn't worth it and gave up, talk about a stupid way to display food!  Breakfast was worse and only $3.00 cheaper than dinner? $17.00 for breakfast, wow. Don't bother with the Eggs Benedict, the sauce tasted like.....soap? Sausages were tasteless, scrambled eggs overcooked and rubbery, However the grits were very good. I wouldn't go back.

nxMA-A_98RoA3wQ1_nsURw.text: The only reason I'm giving this place even one star is because the food was pretty decent for a buffet. However, the service was absolutely horrendous. Starting from the rude cashiers all the way to management. Don't forget to tip before the horrible service, or they will rain fire on your table. God forbid, you leave a tip at the end of your meal where you serve yourself. Not only did our "server" slam our drinks down and ignore us the whole time, except to give our whole table an evil stare down, but she refused to give us refills on our inclusive champagne brunch. She even said we couldn't get refills on our iced teas, oj's, or sodas.... I thought this was a buffet. Luckily she brought the manager over and they had an argument about refills in front of us because our server wanted us to "see it." Whatever that means. When we asked her if something was wrong, she went on a rant about how only god can judge her and then things turned from bad to worse. I guess that God justifies bad service, rudeness, and denies us new silverware. But in a turn of fate, after being open about our concerns, she gave our table all of her attention before leaving in the middle of our meal. After she left, our new server didn't even look at our table, introduce herself, clear off plates, or anything that has to Do with good service. But we tracked her down on the other side of the restaurant and got some refills. I would like to think that maybe they just hate us, but we were not the only ones who were yelled at or ignored. Clearly customer service is not a priority. The management here obviously  doesn't want people coming back, seeing as how rude they were. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone who is looking for an easy going meal. But the food is good... So I guess that counts for something. Maybe.

JWca84HCH-1Y0-ScEu2Lrw.text: There's a reason for the 1 star review from the people that gave it a 1 star.  Like me, they have had better food elsewhere.  I have no complaints about the service. Service was great and price decent.  I stay at Flamingo all the time and every single time I come to this Paradise Garden Buffet and would be disappointed.  Their food are just bland and so limited in selections.  My guests and I would walk round and round and still have an empty plate.  There's really nothing good.  When I leave, they would hand me a slip to fill out for survey.  I would fill it out with the good service, but lousy food and selection hoping it will change next time around.  It never did; hence, the 1 star review.  Hope they act up and get some really good chef in here and put out more selection of food instead of leaving the middle with desserts only.    The buffet is divided into three sections with the middle being dessert and the front and the last section serving the same type of food.  They should move the dessert section to the end and merge the front and middle section and open up more stations with better selections like Asian menu.

Vm48lbhA1h0TacKr_gVadA.text: So I wasn't so excited about going to this place, it just didn't seem like my kind of place. Atlas, at the insistence of someone else, we went. And yuck. Well, while we were standing in line, there was a big menu-esque thing describing all the different stations they had, and it sort of got me excited. I planned on filling up on sushi and sea food. So we get in, and the buffet is literally about ten feet long, that's it. Each station consisted of one food item. Sure I was happy to see the big mound of shrimp and crab legs, but it ended up grossing me out instead. How long have they been sitting out, exactly? I don't know, but the shrimp still had the shell on them, and, it was a little fishy. Fishy seafood is a no-no.  I didn't even enjoy the desert buffet. Although I had two dinner rolls, that's pretty much what I filled up on. But you can't really screw up dinner rolls, can you? (knock on wood)  I don't plan on going back, or even recommend anyone else going there.   But I did see Donnie Osmond in person! Not that I had anything to say to the guy, I mean, exactly what is he famous for? Anyway, I would've hoped he'd have better taste in food than the buffet at Flamingo...

kZcrsuCB8lqffoP5OIvLLA.text: This place was really not up to par and should not be in existence in Las Vegas.  Compared to the other buffets around Las Vegas, Flamingo fails for dinner buffet.    THE GOOD:   1. They have cold shrimp and crab legs.      2. The mashed potatoes are very tasty!  3. They had a Crepe station!  The fruit filling is not fresh.  It's jam.    THE BAD:   1. A place like this has cold shrimp and crab legs!!???  Not too bad, but it just did not look as fresh as at Bellagio.     2. Dessert bar consists only of cookies, cake slices, iced cream (not         really ice cream).  Where's the creme brulee???  3. Very soggy vegetables.   4. No strawberries nor pineapple in the fruit section.    I would definitely spend my money elsewhere, even if I have to wait in line longer and pay a little more.  (*Hint* Think Bellagio)

Cta060xYs12WZhHgh7WXxA.text: Tooling around Vegas late at night one is left with the conundrum...do I want to spend $40/50/person+ and expect great food (being disappointed with anything less), or do I spend less and take a major roll of the dice that my dinner might be better fit for a dog?  Deciding that at least if a buffet isn't that great, you can still really fill up, we found ourselves on line for a couple minutes before entering this buffet at the Flamingo.  Selection was decent, but hardly huge, and even the dessert area, while taking up a lot of space, didn't really have that much variety to offer.  Do we really need 25 feet of "sugar-free desserts"?  The drink service was annoying to say the least, as the soda hardly tasted right, and the servers rarely paid you any attention.  Why no open area to get your own drinks?  The food itself ranged from marginal at best (lobster bisque, pasta) to forgettable but decent (poultry dishes, other seafood) to fairly good (green beans, fried rice, beef dishes).  The desserts were hit and miss as well.  In the end, for $25 a person, this was right on the edge of tolerable.  One could fill up on pretty decent food, and that was the saving grace.  However, I'm sure it far from the best buffet or best deal available on the strip.  It was essentially the hand we were dealt, and at least we didn't lose our shirts.

_Ys3xXbVhqzMl5ZrhL_jcQ.text: The salad was great...pasta was nasty...slim pickings on variety but the desserts makes up for eveything...love the view of gardens and wildlife...very clean and reasonably priced...I went around 2 in the afternoon on a friday...Iwould go again.

iyHcHs-8WIY4qyDte60DuA.text: I have been to this buffet twice and have enjoyed it both times.  The first time I visited was with my family and we had more of the breakfast items.  Service was fast and friendly.    The second time I visited this buffet was for the champagne buffet and this experience was fantastic.  There were four of us there and the service was impeccable.  Before we had even gotten halfway through our champagne, someone was back to refill us right away!  The food was wonderful and we all left full and happy.  We certainly got our money's worth.  Ask for seats near the windows so that you can see the flamingos outside.

4Gv_z3BLsd88VTl4kSm4dQ.text: Although it was 3:30pm, we had to wait 40 minutes. By the time we came out at 5pm, the line looked like it was probably at a 2-hr wait. When we were finally let in, we saw that despite the huge line outside, there were plenty of unoccupied tables that were simply waiting to be cleared/bussed. The messy tables were filled with dirty plates, dirty glasses, napkins, etc. Maybe they were short on waitstaff (it was during the week of Christmas), but It definitely detracted from the atmosphere.   They have crab legs, shrimp, mussels on ice. Those seemed to be a big hit, though I personally don't love raw seafood. They also have an extensive salad bar -- it's not a whole foods salad bar, but it has all the basic salad fixins and some premade salads. It was a pretty average salad bar. The sushi area was poor: they had a cucumber-seaweed salad, some california rolls, and a tuna roll. The hot foods area had something for everyone, but nothing was superb. A lot of dishes erred on the sweet side (roasted winter vegetables, prime rib, some fish dish), which I found annoying.   Desserts include bread pudding, blueberry crisp, made-to-order crepes, and lots of cakes. They also had some sugarfree options!  I left feeling full and happy. We had 5$ off coupons, so the buffet was $19.99.  For the price, the food was okay: nothing superb, nothing awful.

bobkv9yOdVzDeJnWwPskBw.text: We bought the 24 hour buffet passes here and used it for Sunday brunch.  I liked it.  There wasn't as much lunch time food as you would usually get at other brunch buffets.  It was definitely more breakfast focused.  However, I was able to find more than enough food to leave myself full.  Our waitress was attentive at continually refilling the champagne glasses and they were handing out mini bottles of vodka to make your own bloody mary.  I was nice and tanked by the time I had finished brunch.  I can see a lot of people not enjoying this buffet but I go into all buffets the same way.  I will find some things I really enjoy and some things I do not enjoy.

k-OACJrcU5zfKBNY4Tyxfw.text: Decent buffet. Didn't have much but had a lot of what they did have. I like this buffet because they offer grapefruit juice. Also I like seeing the flamingos outside the window.

BG9GeSLaxd2BpqWUfF3mtA.text: First off I hate buffets. I don't even know why I wast my time. I hate gorging myself. Ok a line at 10:30 for breakfast. That makes sense since most in the line probably got to bed after 2am.  Stops serving at 11, unless its a weekend. Do any locals eat at these crappy buffets? I doubt it. So why stop at 11? I'm tired and I want breakfast at noon! Got in 10 min before 11 scrambling to fill up multiple plates before all the breakfast items disappear.  syrup gone arrgh! At least the guy cooking the omelets was fast and very nice. If I had cash on my I would have tipped. I wish I could have transferred our tip from our crappy waitress to him. She was horrible. Two tables down those people in that section were having fun because of the cool waitress they had. More to piss me off. The lunch items that were brought out were foul so that wasn't an option. At least I got 4 plates filled before I missed out on breakfast.   Very not impressed.

Qxewn6FICn4uppYMl_Ud-Q.text: Walk away. Don't let the busy crowds fool you. Not even if it was comped would I return !! Cornelio was our waiter and all he had to do was bring drinks and he couldn't  even do that right. He obviously hates his job bc he couldn't even smile and was mumbling after we asked for refills.  The only thing I enjoyed was the crepes and the crepe maker. She was so sweet and did enjoy her job.  Then have low quality everything else. Sushi is boring, salad bar is sad and the pizza is like dried cheese on tough dough. I loaded up on a kale salad and roasted turkey and broiled Salmon that came out fresh. $30 is robbery.

Bk92oCbjlAIrS0i5SnBfYQ.text: Long line. 30 minutes. Bottomless mimosas with brunch means waiting for 20 minutes for your first one them 20 or more minutes for your second one. Waitresses are invisible. Food is hot and buffet is clean with lots of choices. We bought a groupon (thank goodness) cause no way we could eat enough to justify the price and the non existent drinks.   It's Vegas ans "I don't care" mentality of this hotel.

RVB0eXJqPUO6wl7Qj2Ts_g.text: Was here for brunch during the week.  One of the more 'affordable' brunches on the strip. Service was pretty good, dirty dishes cleared fairly quickly. Food selection was ok. The standout was the omelet station. Nice selection of items & the man doing it kept it moving quickly & efficiently.  Tell him what you want & it gets made, not like a lot of people who ask you each thing because they weren't paying attention the first time.  You can also get eggs made to order quickly & efficiently.    You have to get your own beverages...... no 'fresh' coffee but three coffeemate machines which had a large selection & was overall pretty good as long as you're not a coffee snob.      Didn't eat dinner here.

qGttoD3effsITmyyNP3TKA.text: Absolutely the worst buffet in Vegas! This 8 station buffet is 6 stations short.  Over cooked Roast Beef highlights the carving station, aside sit Korean chicken dried up, must be North Korean Chicken! Head to pizza rock or any restaurant but this dive buffet.

oHU4kS1ZHFb1jXNaQzFGDQ.text: What's the deal with such drastically low rating for the Flamingos Buffet? It's much more affordable than most buffets in Las Vegas and they have decent food for its price. Maybe people go here with the unrealistic expectation that they will get the quality of Bacchanal.

WC_jtPO4rhqDbXXfuO89kw.text: excellent atmosphere!! Definitely worth stopping by and eating at! Loved seeing the flamingos outside! It was super beautiful Loved the crab legs and ooooohhh how can I forget the scrumptious roast that was being served! The guy cutting the roast was really nice and not stingy on the slices! Haha... he even fried it up a little for me it was super delicious! Really not a fan of wine buuut I tried a little and it was super good! The Paradise Garden Buffett has my 5 stars and they deserve it!! Thank you for serving me!

mI57LRq-JVhzdRUtD_YmEA.text: I've been to Vegas on a few occasions and usually make a stop into the Paradise Garden Buffet because it's one of the least expensive options for food (and unlimited food at that) in Vegas. They do offer a great variety of options, but not as much as some other buffets. The quality is a bit inconsistent - sometimes the food is amazing and cooked just right, and sometimes it is dry and over cooked and not that palatable - hence the reason for only 3 stars. Otherwise, when the food is good, it is on point; just a bit hit or miss there. Also love that they serve tacos and nachos and all the fixings during their breakfast hours - no shame in early morning tacos after a night of drinking.   The views of this buffet are definitely what makes this place. It overlooks the Flamingo hotels flamingo enclosure complete with, you guessed it, real flamingoes (as well as other interesting species of birds).  There are some waterfalls and greenery mixed in, and coupled with the huge floor to ceiling windows, it really sets a nice atmosphere for the restaurant. Otherwise the rest of the place is mediocre in terms of decor, nothing high end, just plain and casual.

1kb0VArVtFuyAMv535219g.text: Really nice views into the garden, the brunch is decent. They have a lot of lunch & dinner options for breakfast not sure if they're leftovers from the previous day. Everything I had was good there's a crepe station and omelet te station lots of fruits and you have they salad bar available. Come try it for yourself it's your tradicional brunch buffet with a nice garden view.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RjjScJ7hO4QL-yN-y52mXQ.text: Great price, and view! Your eating next to pretty pink Flamingos! All you can eat with some mimosas!  I recommend the staff were friendly. They have a crepe station! An a great salad bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desert bar! Yum

jwFFb5j26gr6G8wVkwGcBg.text: Terrible. The seafood is so gross, the sushi tasted like ice cream and the salmon and roast beef was nasty. Maybe it's cause I'm from New Orleans and KNOW good food, but just no.

CtMg3ZxYCFZX0bF_7ljYXQ.text: I wish I could give this buffet zero stars. My family and I went to the Paradise Garden buffet for a late breakfast and it sucked. There was very little variety of food and it was bland. The only food that had any flavor were the drinks and kimchi. The rice on the sushi was super hard and the hot food was cold by the time we sat down to eat. Luckily we purchased the 24 hour passes for the 5 Caesars buffets so our money did not go to waste.

jSI-rta95TZ3xagi6vlDYw.text: The food is disgusting.  Lobster Mac n Cheese tastes like chalk n cheese. Crab legs look malnourished. One bite of this greasy nasty shrimp  had me ready to toss my cookies. Salad was the only decent thing on my plate. Should have checked out their food selection prior to paying my $$. Most horrible buffet I have ever been to and I would not recommend to anyone. Complete waste of $24.99 + tax.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y5G5-qb_znuCz4Y99yP7Dw.text: This is a really good buffet! Every time we go there is such a long line. (Thankfully we are diamond members) so we get to cut the line. You pay for you and whoever you're with go stand in a line to be seated. We were sat right along the glass where you can see the flamingos, fish, ducks and swan. It's so nice to look at while eating your meal. They added a new area where you go and serve yourself a drink. They have a lot of great selections. Making sandwiches, breakfast items, salad bar, taco bar as week as all you can eat dessert! This is a must go to if you enjoy a buffet! It is a little pricey but if you're in Vegas for awhile I highly recommend getting the 24 hr buffet pass!!

W0ZehJZ5nr8IUw_14uu0xA.text: Another leg of Vegas' buffet of buffets, this is a gorgeous room, with sun and trees and flamingos and just a great, big, warm, round room that says "sit down, get comfy, and munch some grindage." This is also some of the most attentive service I've ever had at a buffet, which is intermittently off-putting and inviting. The food has definitely improved since our first visit, long before my Yelping years. This time, I had a crepe with strawberries and chocolate and whipped cream and it was super-decadent as expected.
