The lunch items looked good, but I forwent. I had mostly breakfast, which was all just great, and washed down nicely with the bottomless carafes of mimosa!!!  At the end, I revisited the one high-point of our initial trek: between the taco and salad bars are all the ingredients necessary to make a killer, elevated, guacamole fiesta!!!

1pMKW9JiEMoCH8iQLcdYgQ.text: In my opinion one of the better buffet in Las Vegas because of the ambiance. If you tip the lady she will give you a window seat so you can enjoy the garden while eating. The food is the same as the others.

NBHU5nIJ8w2IeMjRBSo2GQ.text: November 11, 2017 Saturday - 8:45 AM for breakfast 4 Adults  Atmosphere - 2 stars Food - 2 stars Service - 2 stars  Background - Visiting family that is staying at the Flamingo and this was the place they picked for breakfast.  Amazing how few places were actually open at this time.  Atmosphere - Outdated.  Plain and simple this place needs an overhaul.  The food was easy to get to, so that was a good thing.   Food   Drinks - The weekend "brunch" comes with bottomless mimosas or Bloody Mary's.  I had the Bloody Mary's.  Served in a small cheap plastic cup filled to the top with ice, maybe an 8 ounce cup.  No garnishes.  I could not feel the alcohol in my drink.  My wife did say her mimosas was heavy on the booze.  I also had black coffee.  Both were left empty during most of the meal.    "Brunch" - This was my breakfast for the day, well it later turned into lunch too.  So it was really brunch.  That was not my plan.  Not a single item stood out for me.  As my father in law said the pastries are cold like they just took them out of the freezer, which I agree with.  I was really wanted the pastries to be good.  The French toast was soggy and bland.  The gravy for the biscuits was bland with no sausage in it.  I was able to pull a couple of slices of bacon from the heap of molded bacon slab.  I wish I would have gotten a picture of that heap of a mess.  The sausage links they had were large and in a casings, again bland.  They did have a carving station but nothing caught my eye.  They do a have a cereal station, perhaps that is for the little kids that a picky eaters.    Service - Slow.  Thanks for the free meal for my father in law on veteran's day.  He served in the US Air Force proudly!   Future - I hope not.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. same pastries just in a different case
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. typical booth
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pastries

Zw1YYwC15NdYY_7URj0Vsw.text: The staff here were nice & my server kept refills on my drink but along with the view there aren't many other positives. The food was just ok. I was convinced to buy the buffet of buffets so I had brunch here but if you are looking more for quality instead of quantity I wouldn't recommend this. Wynn had such a GREAT buffet that Paradise couldn't compete. I wanted to be wowed & delighted but this is just mass produced food.

K_coqvpx_NdzEz9CsfrQVg.text: Trash. Came here at 5 when they opened and grabbed a comp meal for 2. Was just here because it was free but then saw the couple next to us jump up as they saw 3 roaches jumping around their table. It was pretty disgusting but we were to wasted to care. They comped them but didn't care about us so yea, screw them. Should've comped everyone since cock roaches are pretty fucking sick. #donteathere. #Managerwas2stepping

FOPmopVprFPM3NzfbAb0Tw.text: Raspberry had mold in it. Told the manager and she did not seem too concerned. Now I have a tummy ache. Do not recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aVTWbQEFl_QHo3j-2_3AFw.text: Hands down the Worst Buffet I've ever had in Las Vegas! Eat here if you love basic mass produced food prepared without any Love  I paid $25 bucks for plates of defrosted Chinese chicken,Bland salad bar,Nasty meats and a poor desert bar. I would fire the head chef immediately!! Sorry but it's True !! I wonder if this is he same buffet that came out in the movie "Vegas Vacation" ? Oh and the worst part is the place was empty and they kept a long line outside for no reason!!! It made it seem like people were clamoring to get in.... wrong !!! They do that for appearances only

yLjgmYsCcZJ7xVLrTnXp1A.text: This has to be one of the most disappointing Vegas buffets I've ever been to... no, rather one of the most disappointing buffets I've been to. Period. When you hear your friends rave about how great the Vegas buffets are and how "there are so many great ones to choose from", they will never be referring to this one.  The buffet is average, at best, with nothing really original or unique that left me wanting more. On that same note - food doesn't have to be original or unique, just really good, which this food failed to be. Of the number of items ranging from breakfast to seafood to sushi to salad to dessert, the dish that rose to the top for me was probably the Salmon with Dijon Dill sauce. The fish was well-prepared, delicate in texture and had a nice balance of flavors.  The food was tolerable, but the bigger issue is that the service was way below average for any dining experience. Drink refills were nonexistent and attention to our table was equally nonexistent... which took disregard to a whole new level because I was at a table with 6 other guys. It took around 10 minutes just to get the server's attention to get one refill of iced tea. Just unacceptable.  Overall, the food needs improvement and the service needs a big face-lift. Nothing about this place makes me want to plan a return visit. It's not the worst buffet I've been to, but it's faaaar from good.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. General Tso Chicken
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fruit Tart
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Rice

20M73UcUXeyO0SDnUgvlBw.text: This definitely wasn't the worst brunch buffet but wasn't the best either. They were extremely generous with the champagne to orange juice ratio on the mimosas and the bloody mary bar had quite the variety. The station's had mediocre items to offer, with the chef station's almost always having a line. Most of the items offered were pastry, filling, sweet dishes that filled you up quickly so take your time and pace yourself if you're going to try it all.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella crepe was the best part of the meal!
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6pITYED7Wk6LCKS8w-IZfQ.text: Pretty good Bloody Marys!! A good breakfast buffet. Easy to find, fast line, and clean table. Fun view of flamingos!!!! Good value for basic breakfast buffet. Oooh, the donuts are delicious!!! Perfect with coffee!!!

4Lonbj96Qtka14hcY_hHqg.text: I was really nervous to try this place out after reading reviews but we honestly had an excellent experience! Arrived around 8am on a Tuesday and there was no line (which made me even more nervous!). We were seated immediately and our waitress came to take our drink orders. She kept the coffee and mimosas coming the whole time we were there- both of which were really good! And I'm super picky about coffee. The food selection was very good - great selection of hot and cold breakfast and lunch items. Boyfriend loved the omelet station. Make sure to go around the corner to the pastry and crepe making station as well! We spent 2 hours sipping mimosas watching the flamingos and snacking on tons of great food!

mIdUhddeW1pAKcbBD8Fy8Q.text: I arrived around 9am, the line was long but it went quick! That's the only positive view of the buffet.   It took the waitress long to get my drink. I ordered a Bloody Mary, since it was limitless of Bloody Mary's and Mimosas. I regretted it. The drink came in a 12oz cup with no garnishments.   The section of the food was small and cold. What a waste of money! They've your basic breakfast food; pancakes  (no syrup unless I couldn't find it). The bread wad hard!  The only positive thing would be the remarkable view of the flamingos.   Food: 1/5 (Small section & cold) Service: 2/5 (what waiter? Didn't see him at all) Price: 3/5 (reasonable) Atmosphere: 2/5 (out dated]

XQFq1_30IsgBY0IPP1UPjw.text: Disappointed at the offerings for this price $26.95.  No bagels to go with the smoked salmon, empty trays and lukewarm food.  Never again!  Go to the Palms for a fraction of the price.

kYf_e5886CHLXfYCwlHZDw.text: It's been awhile since I ate here... food okay, excellent customer service, my guys enjoyed it.

BvN2jpYsALAOARznLeq8fw.text: Sigh...where do I even start. Buffets make me very happy. I am usually excited to go to one and I find that it is usually an attraction in itself. This buffet however was not the case. There was a nice little array of desserts and the salad bar was my go to. The temperature for all main items seemed off. I'm not sure if everything had been sitting out for a long time but my food was at room temperature (a big peeve for me). The breads were stale. I only rate this 2 stars due to decent desserts and salad bar. Our waitress and hostess were fabulous but other than that this place needs some improvement foodwise. The view was beautiful as we were sitting with views overlooking the Koi ponds, flamingo,  ducks, and little waterfalls.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The array of desserts
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The highlight of my meal

RshYsc8lBd8uOSlxzM4Kvg.text: I was not too impressed by the selection at this buffet. It looked pretty small and nothing that appetizing.  The only things I tried were a couple of desserts and salad. I had the mini cheesecakes in a square container, one with strawberry crumble and the other, chocolate. The salads I got were caesar and crab salad. Everything was just whatever. Nothing good, nothing bad.  However, what was awesome was that unlimited mimosas and bloody mary's that came with the morning buffet, until 2. And the guy serving the drinks was super friendly and very generous. Great! If we came back, it would only be for that.

iWUp62TB9HbrP80gCBWDxA.text: Guess what, if you don't start with a tip, you are not getting a seat with a view. Without the view, the rest means nothing. Why? because everything here tasted like leftover from yesterday. The health department really need to check this place out. Besides, who would pay $20 for leftovers. After half a plate, all I wanted was the drinks and guess what? The servers disappeared from the face of this earth.

HovB8PyFtOgkcOMiU4isag.text: We came here with a Groupon on Sunday morning and really enjoyed our brunch! So what if the fruit isn't the freshest, the rest of the buffet was great for the price we paid. We would definitely go back!

0ZLj27MU-M0NqKcW5d-onw.text: I give it 2 stars just because it was comped. Other than that, the worse Buffett. Not as bad as Mandalay bay buffet, but geez... Some of the food were cold, maybe because it's not as popular so they have bee sitting under heat lamps for some time.   Desert bar, were plain and nothing special. My top pick was their fried rice. That was the only decent food available.   Again, if it wasn't comped I would have not come here. My first initial walk through the day before for their dinner service didn't fair that well either, so I figured maybe for a brunch it would be better, but as their dinner service the night before nothing looked as pleasing as it should.   The bacons were greasy and eggs were scrambled and runny. :/  I would have posted a picture, but one of the worker gave me the stink eye when I pulled my phone to take a pic so I respected their redirections.   Ps. I came at 12pm on a Sunday.

7BHm8klGt5FgVP47suJ7jA.text: Food was average buffet quality. Very limited variety, which is fine if you like the main offering that day. Prime Rib was pretty good, the sushi and desserts were disappointing.

3Af620HZjZaJp6GOWzzQYA.text: Not a lot of variety. Wish I could have checked out the food selection before paying. Would have definitely choose else where. Just an average buffet. Not up to standards for a buffet in such a beautiful hotel.

FuiF54BwfYaPxidvqgtYiA.text: This buffet is not the worst buffet, but far from the best. It's a very basic, scaled back buffet. The one thing I love about coming here is eating their salad bar with all the fixings and the crawfish.  The crawfish are on the cold bar next to the shrimp and crab. I bring a few plates over to the kitchen crew and they drop them in a hot pot of boiling water to get them just the way I like em, nice and hot. The prime rib is very tender. They do have dessert crepes, but they are pre-made and are not fresh like the Paris buffet. The chocolate fountain is great for dipping your fresh fruit, brownie pieces and marshmallows.  They also make cotton candy for the dinner time crowd.  Overall, the buffet here is very basic and simple and try do a great job for what it is. If you want something top notch, visit Caesar's Palace buffet, (The Bacchanal).

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flamingos at the Flamingo
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Of course the flamingos at the Flamingo.
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Real chocolate fountain for dipping marshmallows and fresh fruit

Oo5wAl5-N4OxxOXDNp4Zxg.text: Everything was delicious. Got an end cut rare piece of the prime rib. Peel and eat shrimp was excellent and finally enjoyed crab legs for the first time (I'm a lobster guy...). The waitress was very attentive and the rest of the meal was very well rounded out. Ribs were some of the best I've had.

EkRJ8aY88TPIrgEioUndUA.text: Probably one of the worst buffets I've ever been to. Upon entering you can see that it almost looks like a dated Hometown Buffet. For a $25 brunch I was expecting fresh and delicious offerings, and it was very disappointing. The potatoes were greasy, the pizza was dry and barely edible, the ham was too salty, the omelet needed more time and heat on the pan, the orange juice had added sugar, most of the fruit was of canned quality, and the eggs Benedict was overcooked and does not mention that it has salmon. The only foods that were good were the desserts, including the French toast and pancakes. For $25 I can get better quality food at a Brazilian steakhouse buffet during lunch. And even Golden Corral has better food quality than this place. Next time, I'll just go to another buffet.

hwevY8bwb8zqQkQuKfz0wg.text: 1. Verdict/Value: Tough to recommend with so many better options on the Strip.  Look at other buffets first.  2. Food: Arguably the smallest buffet on the Strip, it not only has a smaller selection, but nothing special.  3. Service: Our waitress kept mixing up our drink orders and was difficult to find when we needed the bill.  I'm hopeful not all waitresses were like her (especially when there isn't much to deliver and sort out in a buffet); however, she successfully put a further damper on the experience.  4. Atmosphere: Think early 90's decor with a view.  Restaurants across the nation (and buffets in Vegas) continued to revitalize themselves in the last 10 years; it may be time for the Paradise Garden to do the same as well.

Uup1kp802QAUT9iZKrvweQ.text: Horrible beyond words. $30 for some of the worst food I've even seen and tasted. One star only for the friendly staff. Save your money and go elsewhere.

DLYnu3_b7UPskJloHfpJfQ.text: Lacks a lot of variety, I guess if you like sea food come here. But I am not a big fan of seafood, so your options become limited fast. Spanish and Asian food are extremely mediocre. They pretty much rinse and repeat their desert, so the selection isn't as large as it looks.   They have really vague labels on some of their food. (I.e pizza, fish, no-sugar)  I guess you can say the view is nice if you get a seat next to the window, drinks are unlimited.  Obviously overpriced at $30 a person.

O9LejwjoQKf4cmPZEqvOsA.text: My husband and I got the 24hr buffet. This buffet at flamingo sucks food was not tasty and it looked nasty..we ended up walking  out and head to another buffet at pH..don't recommend it at all

H1k58eIQr_HSLDN4OJnXug.text: I don't care what the other reviewers said, I like this buffet. I've eaten here several times.   On this occasion, I came for the Brunch Buffet. It had everything I wanted and then some. Salmon, omelets, snow crab legs, shrimp, bacon, clams, mussels, seafood pasta, fruit.... I could go on.   I also like the view of The Habitat. It's calming to see koi, carp, ducks and swans swimming by.   I would eat here again.

hd4XYAG87P3LipjhtliIPQ.text: Ugh. I arrive at The Flamingo after traveling for what felt like 12 hours starving my ass off and decide to eat here because my buddy and I were just too exhausted to look elsewhere. Wish we took the 20 minutes to find another place...  Their sign said that their lunch buffet ends at 3pm and at 3:01pm the lady behind the desk gave us the lunch price. Kudos. Walking to our table I immediately noticed a Vegas hotel style restaurant with appealing outside views of a small walkway and a pretty water fountain. Cool. And then it goes downhill...  The only thing that was really good from this buffet were the crab legs. I had a fair share of them but they didn't have an crab leg crackers --- just a small utensil to pick out your crab meat. My task to stuff my face was very difficult. There was a small section open for sushi but the sushi there appeared to have been out for a few hours. All the cooked food appeared and tasted overcooked. They had a build your own nachos section but no chips. I was hoping that I would get at least something decent from the dessert aisle but the cookies were rock hard!  I suppose if you were to come here you should come during peak hours since food is always being shuffled. Looks like we were in the middle of a shift change or menu change from lunch to dinner. This is Las Vegas --- the world's number one tourist attraction. Step it up.

4eiBSvt4k5e-4XWDHPMwlQ.text: It's bearable (if you're too tired to go somewhere else)....something not too expensive, yet something not too cheap either.  Very convenient if you're staying in the hotel and need a big brunch meal.  Breakfast is so-so and if you're lucky enough to get in before they start switching to lunch then you get to try other food aside from breakfast....   If you have enough time to look for other places to eat then take that time as you will definitely have more bang for your buck off the strip.

q4v89yxJVJofBa5FMrB1Zg.text: This wasn't bad at all. The GF and I came here for breakfast after a long night of walking on the strip and collecting all those escort cards.  I say the food here was average with all the other buffet. Not the greatest but not the worse either. The breakfast wasn't bad at all. The turnover for food was fast enough where you got something almost fresh most the time.  Tried to eat healthy while I was there. The donuts were not very good, dry. I did take a few apples which were really small. Smaller than my GF fist.   I thought the service wasn't to bad at all. The decor of the place was a little dated but overall it wasn't bad at all.

aFWR3GNZR5nXsFnb0LpiHA.text: This place is as average of a buffet as it gets.   There are many different places where you can get better food for the same price.

YkmzW8IiRt6huFg4G9ls4g.text: *Review only for the breakfast buffet* 2.5  When you're comparing (and that's the unfortunate thing about Vegas - always comparing) this breakfast to Paris' buffet breakfast, it is no match. But with that being said, as others have mentioned, this buffet is geared toward breakfast. They have a good selection of decent food that will fill you up. I also like the views of the pool. We used the 24 pass here, and was satisfied with my breakfast here.

2VQCVDi5uYE2GN-pDsIHbA.text: SAVE YOUR MONEY AND TIME! This place used to be great. Service was horrible to non existent this time. The food was very bland and selections were limited (especially for a Sunday morning). The guy cooking the omelets could not keep track of who ordered what. He even put the wrong one on someones plate. Out of the five ingredients I asked for I got one. No more Crepe station. This was very disappointing and we will not be returning to the Flamingo Paradise Garden Buffet.

rgrLa1unZMahfk_LH0RWDQ.text: I don't like the Flamingo, or many of Harrah's properties (now Caesar's) for that matter... I think they are seedy and have been allowed to run down. HAVING SAID THAT...This buffet with it's menu, at the price, is really good.  Yes they have all the breakfast goodies including bagels and lox, and some of the lunch items (we didn't go at the change over hour... we were there at 9:00am).  There were shrimp and lots of other lunch time selections.  Caution... if you are driving, with the twists and turns, it is very difficult to get to the valet, and then it's a long walk to the buffet!

QLwCfv3FyjZHTFGwhhZePw.text: Service was slow and it wasn't busy at all. Food was not so good. Only good food was the seafood.

BKjlzorezS-FceEWhUkpqA.text: This buffet is smaller compared to it's Vegas counter parts, if we weren't staying here I'm not sure if we would have bothered. The food itself was good, made to order eggs, corned beef hash, real hash browns, bagels & bread for toasting,  and a carving station, but nothing that really stands out.  If you are staying at Flamingo or the Quad and it is within stumbling distance, and you are just looking for breakfast, it's worth the try... otherwise there are many other suitable choices that will bring you more quality.

lktnk5-FCPC_w1OUu5q_7A.text: I had dinner here and was satisfied with the overall experience. I purchased a Groupon which gave our group the ability to skip the long line to get in and also save $5.00 on the buffet price. There was a nice salad and fruit bar with 2 soup options. The entrees were good as well. The tacos were very good and I enjoyed lots of the side dishes. I am a seafood lover so the peel and eat shrimp were good and there were piles of crab legs. I enjoy the hot steamed crab legs which were a bit over cooked but just like any buffet when the crab legs sit out a long time they dry up. Our server wasn't the best but we were able to work around that. The unlimited drinks both alcoholic and non alcoholic were also a plus. The scenery was nice but it started getting dark while we were there so we didn't get to enjoy it as much as I would have liked. Desserts were good and they had my fav soft serve ice cream. I would go back again!

YhfbUj1Bg2Kg-QIBj59P4w.text: What I have to give it at least one star?  It took them 30 minutes to refund our money. Still waiting to see how many of us get sick.

HRGszEYow7KtCGiCQBBiMw.text: I had the 24 hour pass for the seven buffets, and since I was staying at this hotel, it was convenient that I ate here for breakfast.  It's a typical breakfast buffet, with all your regular breakfast food. Nothing struck me as out of the ordinary. If you want decent, endless breakfast food to start off the day, go here!

rV0lqUujUFRV_Ts54Vl-gA.text: The dinner buffet was absolutely horrible. Very little choice for dinner and the food was never replaced in a timely manner. The service was, otherwise fantastic.

IndqcpUmKkJEfsrymntHRw.text: Horrible. I saw little flies hovering over a bowl of fuit!!! Eat at your own peril!

P8bkdZD4cqtPZlx3Xvf5Xg.text: Food was mediocre at best and the service was non-existent after we were seated. It wasn't busy, so that wasn't the reason. We even tipped 20% BEFORE we were seated when we paid; an idiotic mistake that I won't make again. Staff doesn't really seem to care. We came here because we were staying here, but we should have gone to any other place, as there are many nearby. Garden window seat was nice though.

C9hDfqPTU7w6d7Xc09Dr-g.text: We are "clueless" where to dine & were pretty tired from our drive from Colorado and a stop over in Salina, UT... we decided just to go with the flow.  We were all hungry, at that point, so on that faithful Sunday July 20 we gave Paradise Garden Buffet a try.  With the price for the buffet, we ARE Indeed Disappointed.  The only thumbs up is the dessert spread.  The only thing I can think of.  The rest of the food is pretty much ok, not so great.  Some food that is supposed to be hot was cold and just plain bland.  Nevertheless, we will try to visit Vegas and explore other places in the future.  Save your money on some where else ... just DO NOT GO here... I rest my case.

plyhUL4c1OHJbtZqHRBUdA.text: It's not a good place at all.$30...if I new I wouldn't even pay 10.the worst food ever.i wouldn't recommend anyone

TV5tDTL8_m5pdJ2AL7Udsw.text: Seriously, out of all the Buffet of Buffet's, only Flamingo & Rio get 5-stars.  Maybe PH (Planet Hollywood), but last time they didn't have a line for Platinum/Diamond members [which means waiting in that extravagant line], so that might keep them at a 4-star rating.  But let's focus on the task at hand.  And keep it simple.  You're probably reading this on your iPhone hoping to find a quick tip before you go out & get trashed & bet a black on zero's.  Location:  back of Flamingo.  Still trying to figure out the parking structure that's right outside the doors of it, but can't navigate it.  Either way, not too far into the casino (unlike Caesar's) that you and you drunk buddies can easily find your way to it.  Ambiance inside is still a little dated, but you can ask for a view next to the windows which circle around the flamingo gardens and koi ponds.  Once watched a turtle couple hook up while sun bathing.  Not too shabby.  Service:  Awesome.  Playing has it perks, and that includes getting upgrade to Platinum/Diamond level.  Those have its perks, like not waiting in line.  Plus the servers tend to treat you better hoping to squeeze out an extra few bucks hoping that you're really rolling like your card 'says' you are.  Luckily for me, "na aawa ako sa mga kababayan" so everytime I get a Filipino server, there's always a guaranteed extra few bucks.  Parking:  It's inside the hotel, so valet or self, your choice.  Walk to take the monorail as well.  Food:  Honestly, I love the breakfast here.  The BF loves the Chinese & he and my dad killed it during our most recent New Years trip here, so although I can't say personally, they clearly enjoyed.  They have some basic dimsum items, xio mai & sticky rice, chicken feet (and please, don't get grossed out, our at least not out loud.  To be more clear, don't be the girl this weekend that walked past it and yelled out as loud as she could, "EWWW GROSSS CHIIIIIICKEN FEEET" - seriously, have some respect).  Widest variety I've seen where ALL the food tastes good.  Plus, cotton candy!  You can get crepes made and there's a carving station.  Crabs & mussels always taste fresh.  No reason for you to not give this a shot!  Overall:  No complaints.  Members get treated well and at least it's not in a super-overpriced casino so I don't regret playing some money after I get out.  And this one is definitely more kid-friendly than some of the other buffets/hotels.  Also, located in the middle of the strip, so you're definitely not walking the Daytona 500 back to your hotel if you ran out of money for the taxi.  Happy Eating!

kMDfsFqxVUSJ0Pms5V9JWg.text: Don't waste your time or money.  Went there on my last morning in LV only because I didn't have time to get to the Paris buffet.  Completely regret that decision and wished I had gone to McDonald's instead.  To make matters worse, they charged $21.99 for "brunch" due to the holiday (it was the day after Thanksgiving) yet outside of a few  SAD salad items, I didn't see any  "brunch" like items.  Coffee was horrible, waiter was mediocre at best, and food was pretty bad (almost as bad as the Sahara's).  If you're not particular about your food, it may be ok for you, but as for me---I'll go to the Paris buffet.  It is by far the best quality for the buck.

9yakTl48g_Jz6a1h8bVIfQ.text: My husband and I got 150 dollars in free dining vouchers from going to a timeshare presentation.  Since we are locals we decided to take a friend out to dinner at All Amercian Bar & Grill in the Rio.  And the rest of it we decided to go out for lunch at on of the buffets.  Since I have never been to the Flamingo, I thought that I would give it a try.  Also I thought that will the garden and birds outside it would keep my 2 year old happy while we ate.  While I would not have given this place one star but yelp doesn't allow zero stars.  First off the service was slow.  There was about 10 people in front of us in line to pay and it took like 20 minutes.  The lady at the register was as slow as molasses.  Then we get seated and I go get food for my daughter.  This place had like no food options.  I could have fit the buffet in my living room.  The food was also terrible.  There was old sushi, hard dumplings and crepes that tasted like soap.  Even though I didn't pay, I still feel like I didn't get my money's worth.  This was unacceptable for a strip buffet.  I had better buffets near my house for way less money.  Never never again.

AW3yeK9V_9X_OWJz9fIowg.text: Champagne brunch at the Flamingo - Great  buffet for the money. We've eaten here on 2 different vacations. Every July David and I make our trip up to Vegas for a show or two, a little gambling, shopping and of course some food! We came upon this place in 09 after receiving a coupon and decided to try it out. We went for the Champagne brunch, not bad for the price. About $20 pp. (reg brunch no coupon is about $36 for 2) They had everything I personally could ask for. Salad bar, biscuits & gravy, crab, prawns, stainless steel warming trays with poultry, beef and fish with someone to serve you in there little white coats and chef hats on the other side of the buffet table. THEEE best part is they served fresh crepes made right before your eyes!!! My fav!!! I had a fresh crepe with strawberries, whip cream and a Little syrup. Yeeeeeeeum! Then, once you have filled your plate full of goodies and get back to your modest table to dig in, you will find yourself surrounded by wall to wall windows facing beautiful landscaping with a equally as beautiful waterfall in the middle of it all. Your waitress is pleasant and always there for that refill, even with the champagne. We came back again this passed July and nothing's changed, still very pleased. As far as buffets go, this is one of my favorites and you can't beat the view!

n0jXgMxK1hIYPuAG3MltaA.text: My mom and I went here this morning (weekday). Paid $19 each (used our players card for a bit of a discount). The only thing decent on the buffet is the toast. Food was cold, gravy was salty, donuts were hard, etc etc. If it wasn't for the omelet and crepe bar we would have left still hungry. Don't waste your time. Too many good places to eat in Vegas for around the same price.

svxb7hS_s-wAFakF37PCrA.text: Considering the price of $20 it had a variety of breakfast items and lunch items. They had a well stocked dessert bar area to include pies, crepes, cookies, donuts, breakfast pastries, and cotton candy. This was my favorite part. We came here because the Mirage cravings breakfast was $35 and the night before we had a bad experience. We would definitely come here again.

f4u3h60-s7N5Eocz1LswdA.text: Don't waste your money. Very disappointing and at the bottom of the Vegas buffet spectrum. Minimal food choices, I expected more from a dinner buffet. The best part about this buffet is the build your own salad, but I can do that at home, it seemed like everything was excessively salty. Just not worth it.

AbL2uc-cGFBg6lfple4HnA.text: I would highly advise staying away from Flamingos Paradise Garden Buffet unless you have a real hankering for food poisoning. Within a couple of hours I was spending my time hovering over the toilet.  Biscuits & gravy, bacon and/or the eggs Benedict were the culprits.  Since we were due to leave at checkout time that same day and I couldn't leave the bathroom, it cost an extra night stay, resort fee and a couple hundred to change the airline flights for two people. When extending our stay for another night my friend explained the need due to something being bad at the buffet causing my temporary sickness. Her words were never acknowledged by the front desk clerk.  Also not acknowledged by the hotel when written up in the survey.

2IxLq8AWe9tRs33tvZ1eXQ.text: Had a very good breakfast for a low price.  The omelette man had four frying pans going and also making big fluffy pancakes.  I had omelettes at three different buffets and theirs was the best - in fact, I had two.  They had tasty flavored coffee (hazelnut, cinnamon, and vanilla).  Fremont was better than Main Street.

iPM_LYyE95zexRBaY2CZBA.text: Quite possibly one of the worst buffets in Vegas. Seriously, they're not even trying anymore.   The food was all bland and uninspired. We only went here because those timeshare people gave us 2-for-1 coupons. There isn't much of a crowd there, either, as people recognize it is crap.  They hide the buffet section - you have to walk further to the back to see it. Some people miss it completely. Save yourself $15-20 and just go eat some stuff off the dollar menu at McDonalds nearby. I'm serious.

dMNMFibbYtcd7JbLLlxCPw.text: Ohmygoodness! I just had to write a review about this place....it's a real diamond in the rough that needs to be acknowledged. While the hotel itself leaves MUCH to be desired, I'm REALLY glad we took a chance with their buffet. It was my Aunt's birthday & I have absolutely no regret for taking her & her 4 sisters here that day. For least than $20 these women had a blast! Everyone found something to please their palate, the variety was endless, endless cocktails were included & their dessert section & fresh crepe station sealed the deal! Everything tasted fresh, not generic at all, the ambience was pleasant, not noisy or congested, just right! Not to mention a great bang for your buck. I would definitely go back here to dine & totally recommend it to anyone, especially after trying several other buffets at many other high end & newer hotels in Vegas. Keep up the good work!

3VMma2eu7fEq0HNfyVB8BA.text: We had the breakfast buffet here on a Saturday morning and it was excellent. The ambiance was beautiful and the view of the gardens was beautiful. The food was wonderful and a large variety of different types. The servers were very nice. We have been going to the same buffets and so glad we tried this one.

UfEv0e-G3-bhGdvQHX-4TQ.text: I would recommend go somewhere else, even if you're tired and have to walk. Went for dinner and didn't get a view of the flamingo habitat. The food was o-kay, but the selection was poor. The guy carving the roast beef hates his job and it shows. The restaurant is nice, but could use some detailed cleaning. Too bad.... it has such great potential.

SHbhQW-btWESZMQb8TbiBA.text: The food was the standard american breakfast--since We went there for breakfast. I noticed that the strawberries that I took was obviously "unwashed" so I took to the  waitress but she just yelled at me saying" they are washed!".

Jp8JnK_vVpfioNzZIqqlwg.text: Skip this buffet.  Total waste of money!  The food here tastes like Home Town Buffet - bland, tasteless, and yucky.  Also, the food looks like it sits out a while...not fresh...not good!

Yf6CB1r-2W86KJtYlN-kzg.text: The only reason why I an giving this place 1 star is because the steak was good. We went here for "brunch" but there were absolutely no breakfast items. How does a brunch not include BReakfast?! The food was horrible, the fruit was molded, I really don't have anything good to say. The manager offered free breakfast to 2ppl in our group of five and we were left to decide which 2 it would be. Huh??? How is that ok? Never again! I beg you to go anywhere but here

-kfB9FBoeqtcjNnMQuSNrQ.text: We went to this buffet for Sunday brunch and it was terrible! Service was bad, food was bad, overall experience was bad. The only good part of this buffet was the chocolate fountain. I wanted to dip some banana pieces in the fountain, but even those were brown! Save your money...eat somewhere else.

5IoVoJQoGX3wrrwrAbXWSg.text: We went here for brunch. There is quite a selection and unlimited mimosa you say???  Might as well get your party started at breakfast ha! You get a view of the flamingos from inside the dining area (their habitat is outside where there are also a variety of geese, ducks and a decent size koi fish pond). The service was great, our waitress was friendly and great with checking that our glasses were always full and cleaned up our finished plates frequently. The omelet chef was also hilarious (he really wanted to make me some). The overall taste and quality of the buffet selection I feel were better than what this place is being given, I'd recommend it. Another thing to note, when we went on our Grand Canyon tour bus ride, our guide gave specific facts as well as suggestions to what each casino was good or known for and she said that flamingo had the best buffet. Who knows, maybe she was being biased but we enjoyed it here. Another thing to note, the cashier was nice and pointed out if we had a rewards card that there was a discount which is pretty awesome and that came up to about $22 per person.

4YCBlLmvyGQJunOrqYR1qQ.text: Ok, let me start out by saying that the staff here is friendly, and if you get a decent seat, the views of the Flamingo Habitat are very nice.  However, the food at the buffet isn't good and the selection that they offer for a buffet could be a lot better (very small selection of items compared to all the other buffets I've been to in Vegas).  They don't even serve regular pancakes or french toast for Breakfast.  Waffles only.  Really??  If they offered more items I'd be willing to try it again and hopefully give it a better rating.

vwlT7HocnhXwS8C5U4GPDA.text: SKIP IT!! It is bad. It is NOT good by any means. The gals at the front are nothing but rude as are the servers. The gal at the front actually scolded me for standing in the "Platinum Line" when I was not a platinum member. HILARIOUS! I didn't even know I was standing the wrong line since my hubby and I were the only ones in line!! Seriously??? We had waited at least 10 minutes while the two cashiers figured out some problem with another guest. As I was being scolded, another couple walked up in line. The gal told me I had to stand in line like everyone else. What a joke. We should have left then. The couple who just got in line behind us where nice enough to explain to the cashier that we were there first. The food is horrible!!! Service is just as stale as the food. Not as much as a crack of smile from our Ms. Sunshine. NO WONDER NO ONE WAS IN LINE- THE PLATINUM LINE OR THE PEON LINE!

FzFOdL7Icc7vUZDaqWFaVA.text: So it's a random Buffett that me and my fiance went to cause she heard good things about this place. I thought it wasn't bad myself when we ate here. The line to get in wasn't bad at all an we got on pretty quick.    The servers are super nice. They gave us an extra plate for our crab shells, bones, and ect. My fiance ask for hot sauce and she got 4 different ones which was cool. My drinks got refilled fast.   For the food that I would say was okay but got me full which was point. Everything tasted decent and nothing really wowed me which I didn't expect since it a buffett. What I didn't like was there steak was almost cooked on the outside and almost rare( bloody ) on the inside.  All the other foods I eaten I have no complains about.   I didn't see all the desert til the end which was on the other far comer of the place. I got me a crepe that's tasted okay.   For $20 you will get your moneys worth if your not picky about what you eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rare in the middle! Yuck!
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_hM2pES-w5BaF7j8N744Pw.text: I used to go here a lot in the past, but recently as of March it has gone downhill. Their crab legs are not sliced in half and their shrimp are not pre-peeled anymore. The legs are smaller now as well. I guess that explains why the price went down to 19.99 from 24.99. It's still a decent buffet to go to for seafood lovers, but I'd recommend the Village Seafood Buffet at the Rio if you want to eat some serious seafood.   Service is great and fast, and desert bar is awesome.

wCdjp_Lc6wIcC7k3eKhaSg.text: Ugh.  No way, no how, or in between will I be back again.  Been here before and they used to be somewhat decent for a quick bite.  Comped or not it's just terrible now.  From the food descriptions poorly handwritten in sharpie to the stale and grey assortment of dishes, nothing is appetizing.   About the only thing here worthwhile is the dessert area.  I ended up having a banana crepe and a bit of some corned beef hash (and no white rice!).  Servers are nice enough, but the food is just too bad to compensate.

YVkaMAvahKVlQjNdzyTU_A.text: The Paradise Buffet at the Flamingo hotel and casino is reasonably priced. They have several different types of food ranging from salads, seafood, sushi, and meats. The food is well prepared and is very good. The dessert bar is outstanding and also has a variety of items such as cakes , ice cream and sweets. The prices range from $27.00 per person. If you find a tickets for half price booth on the strip you can buy tickets for a few dollars off the meal.

W8FOgkR4s6fnZDK7H_dCew.text: Next buffet stop, the Flamingo. I was bummed for lack of a better word. The food was cold and there was no flavor in most of the food I tasted. The only memorable thing about this place was the view of the birds (Flamingoes, Black Swan, Ducks) and the Koi Fish.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flamingoes!!!
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Black Swan!
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Koi Fish!

0Qvihjmc2PiQQVVpxUDW4Q.text: Ate at this buffet last night.  29.99 per person, four of us.  Buffet was out of meats, pasta, and several main dishes. Seafood enchiladas had no seafood, just an empty tortilla in sauce.  I've never seen a buffet in Vegas out of food. People were standing and waiting on food.  We asked for refills several times and no one ever came back.  Very poor service and poorly planned.

JIHNN_qrPn86geGwP2OW3Q.text: We liked the buffet so much we ate here two days in a row! The second day was the best...we sat at the window admiring coy fish, flamingos, and several different ducks. The buffet has everything from salad varieties, breakfast foods, hot southern foods, hot meat section, fresh fruit, sandwich section with coldcuts, pizza, and the chefs can also make you something like an omelette. Our server PON was such a sweetheart and took very good care of us. I would recommend it especially if you're closeby.

mwAi_FssiWHXsOPstw77cg.text: I've never written a yelp review, but I felt that it was necessary given that this was the worst service I have ever experienced at a restaurant. After a few visits from our waitress, Julie, we decided to ask about the mimosas, and she angrily demanded our IDs and said "we don't just GIVE you the mimosas, you have to ask for them". Well sorry, we didn't really have a chance to ask since you rushed away from our table all the time. When the drinks arrived, she slammed them down on the table and left without saying a word. The rest of our visit was full of passive aggressive attitude towards us. The mimosas were also served in plastic cups with ice cubes and didn't taste at all like they contained champagne. The food was lack luster at best, and left a lot to be desired. If I wanted a rude waitress, I would have gone to Dicks Last Resort, not a "family-friendly" buffet like Paradise Garden Buffet. Good luck if you end up with Julie as a server on your visit.

d-UoNYxlkp_BahM8FJbXPw.text: Food was terrible. The only upside was unlimited sangria. Decor felt like 1982. Wait staff was attentive and refilled the food quickly.

r1lgRs2qxzkiI3J-r6l3Wg.text: Great value! And I even had a Merlot with my buffet meal and Elvira out waitress was also very attentive in asking us how we are doing..the prime rib was excellent and more..also the deserts we the best..We will be back.

-ILxyZeqNESp-wIXziIK4A.text: Loved this place for the price! Truth be told it's not very elegant but it's well worth the price! And if you love the flamingo then you will love the atmosphere in this place. And if you have the total rewards card then you get a weekday brunch discount! Loved the brunch here. If your lucky enough to get seated by the window the scene is beautiful. The bird sanctuary is right outside. Overall I loved my experience here and we will be back when we come play in Vegas again!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View outside the buffet

D8YZfU3P1RlU8NjboDDypw.text: For a cheaper buffet this is good enough. There wasn't a lot to choose from, if you're comparing buffet's, but it did the trick for something quick and to keep you full all day.   They have bottomless mimosas and Bloody Mary's but they were way too strong. I couldn't even drink mine! The desserts were less than average.

KZ-jH30HxctdAJlsmcadqQ.text: Our server was friendly with every other table but ours. She would not say a word to us the entire time, but had no problem chatting with every other table. Food is just ok. Do not recommend.

lxrwH84VzER8yswIhGrJvg.text: The ONLY way this Buffet is worth it is if you get a Groupon. If I would have paid full price I would have been extremely disappointed. The crab legs were the most bizarre thing ever because there was literally no meat inside and it was difficult to get the shell off. Not sure where they get the crab from but definitely subpar. Unless it's the way that they are cooking the crab or overcooking it. The prime rib was flavorless.The sushi rolls were like day old grocery store sushi.The best thing on the buffet was the dim sum style steamed shrimp in rice paper. Which is the only reason I would give this buffet 2 stars.The deserts looked good but, tasted mehhh...not worth the calories. I've been to other Casino buffets and never seen any Buffet this horrible. They really need to get new cooks and better food purveyors. Our server was okay although we ended up having to bus our own plates to an adjacent table. Needless to say life is too short we won't be back.

XyUpWLnbe1Sm_Vw1aV2vnA.text: For a buffet this place is great. Everyone is warm and friendly. The lines are very long at breakfast but if you arrive for an off peak dinner you will be guaranteed a table very quickly and you can dine without hassle. The price is worth it for the crab legs alone. If you saw some crazy crab leg obsessed lady that was just cracking crabs like a machine and creating herself a lovely plate of succulent crab meat... *waves* that was me! That was my main objective for coming to this spot. I am a seafood addict. I seriously od'ed on the crab legs and no one not even the employees or my waiter judged me at all or gave me any dirty looks. In fact the waiter was very accomodating. He kept taking my shell plates away and bringing me more butter. Dear waiter, you sure know how to keep this lady happy. After I had sufficiently filled up on crab I had a small sample of some of the other buffet offerings to get a good idea of what's good here. Everything else was pretty average. Not amazing but definitely not bad and certainly edible. Best of all this place was right in the lobby of the hotel where I was staying so it was pretty convenient. Not only that but if you use your total rewards card to gamble you can use your points to get a free lunch or dinner voucher. That's right I had all that crab for FREE! Awesome huh? Be warned... I will be back in February so keep those crab legs stocked up for me :)

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zxzs09n_jqpVb7eadFDb8w.text: Yes, I agree, hit and miss, been here lots of times, sometimes, it is wonderful and sometimes it is awful. You just dont know! You need to use your ESP on this one. I guess they are just banking on the view of the bird gardens outside.

tMe6_XoOm60I9wygnoU8wg.text: The hrs and food are a disappointment !!!! the flamingo casino has no good food venues.

T4oSWwNiCBEfJUntJIQOXA.text: From the other reviews I was a bit worried about trying the buffet, but all four of us were more than happy with the Friday night offerings.   More choices than I could find room to try, the carving station asked to make sure I had the prime rib cut and quantity I wanted.  More seafood choices would be nice, but I still enjoyed what was there.  Free beer and wine.   Good dessert selection with custom crepes as an option. Service was pretty good.

EDmTxPqDXPehZ5UG2lY5zA.text: Nothing special but it could be worse. First plate at a buffet I just kind of try a little of a lot and I was left not really wanting more of anything I grabbed. Got a bloody Mary and swear it was vodka with red food coloring. Everything was just okay. We got a $20 dining credit which is why we went aor $23 for 2 people, after the credit, we would go again but would never go at full price. Waitress was soo nice!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A little of a lot to try

7ddShQwXwxgZFQTEk0_-MQ.text: They have a groupon so it was worth it. Good wasn't bad and they had crepes. The waitresses were nice.

20QpwseQsOj00jz3m3T74Q.text: The only reason why i am giving this place two stars is because the hostess and the cashier were super nice. The food choices is very limited. Good thing i got it from groupon because $30 for what i ate and the service of the waiters and the people behind the carving station and taquitos station were the worst. They obviously do not want to be at work. The lady behind the taquitos station was only nice to the hispanic people, but when it was my turn her face changed to the grinch.

S4DpeFyIeAdAqGrlk9IhTQ.text: We went to this buffet a couple of mornings during our stay at the Flamingo (we could not go to the dinner buffet because it is only on the weekends, which should be changed since the breakfast is very good).  Overall it was a very nice experience, my fiance had never been to a breakfast buffet and I thought she was going to explode! She was so overwhelmed with all the good food they have here.  I really like the custom omelet station, that was delicious. The country fried steak and bacon was also very good. Its nice they have other things other than breakfast food like chicken and pizza that was good.  I had some ice cream for dessert that was pretty standard but it looked like they had some other treats that I would like to try next time. Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My girlfriends plate lol

ivaOWPNAzEQV8FvmPq066w.text: The wait is long compared to what you actually get. The food was okay but not great. The service was not bad but once again not great.

iLD9T63bW0VteMJu7jpWpA.text: My group of 4 came on a Friday morning around 10:30Am, after walking around Vegas and no lunch places open yet (we were all 2 hours ahead CT). So we settled on this buffet bc we stayed the night at flamingo and noting there was a groupon for 2 people $30 and you get to skip the line. Really nothing to say about this place besides a small selection and below average food. The service was good though, we had a nice waitress. Just wish we would have waited for lunch somewhere else. I would only come back if I got comped.

YxFPMbO_MExg_MCbrbxyaA.text: It was OK. The food was OK the mimosas were OK it was just OK. Nothing exciting for a brunch

h-f6nZrFRh3blUc-_y-yRw.text: Good food Lots of choices Great Groupon Deal Wasn't a fan of Drinking Mimosas out of the plastic cup

aki3yICx1CKa9yGPVYss_A.text: The only reason I gave this 2 stars was because I got a great view work all the cute birds, without having to smell them! The food, eh. The crepe was "fresh", but chewy. The omelet was good... But the guy making them couldn't understand what anyone was saying and didn't make anyone's right. We paid for unlimited drinks but out waitress was MIA most the time.  Never again

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0PgrA-uoP2-eKr5ho5SeOA.text: Oh no, of so many places to eat good in Las Vegas I crave to go here, just to see how.  Starting with the line of people to enter and then for the buffet price per person, when we finally entered the buffet was really like being in a Golden Corral.  The only thing that I really thought was a little good was the flavors of the soft drinks and Crepes.  I definitely would not go back.

k3ZLknHxcxUXWNh3ljlvrw.text: Small but fierce, Paradise Garden can be a great brunch spot when you want to dine at a Strip buffet without a huge bill. That being said, PG does offer fewer options than nearby buffets. At the time of my visit, they were offering the usual fruit/salad station, a basic breakfast staples area with chefs preparing omelets as requested, a Chinese kitchen next to some questionable sushi, pasta and the commonplace hot ham area. You would think such a small place would also skimp out on the quality of food they serve but they were offering lobster mac and cheese which I wasn't expecting but certainly didn't mind eating.   My main motivation for coming wasn't the food but the bottomless mimosas. They were served via premixed pitchers but still had a good juice to champagne ratio, not strong but definitely not watered down. Table service was a bit slow but the servers were quick with refills once you actually got their attention.

63Ia_fO-An4sPpq1K3oK9w.text: The price was reasonable considering we are in the middle of Vegas and it was a buffet. The bottomless mimosas was a good deal as well. The food was a bit above average. What sucked was the  service. They never picked up our plates u til the end. However, I recommend giving this place a shot while you're in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-6N8oErEhSLeny0rk-xmOw.text: Strolling Groupon and came up on an amazing brunch deal, unlimited mimosas or Bloody Mary and buffet for two $35, who can complain. We get there on a Saturday around 11:30, the line was crazy long and it sounds like everyone had the same amazing Groupon. We waited in line for about 30-40 min, but the dining area wasn't crowded. I asked for a table by the window because that was another reason I wanted to eat here for the great view.  I hit the omelette line first. There were 2 people in front of me. The first person ordered 2 omelette, the next 1 and then he took my order. So he had 4 omelettes going, and I don't know what happened but he started getting confused about who's omelette was who's. He gave the first person 1of hers then the next person he gave her the first persons other omelette, then he tried giving me someone else's but I told him which one was mine, so he gave me mine but the first person was still standing there waiting for her other omelette but he gave it away. Lol it started to get a little comical. My next stop was the fresh made crapes. They had chocolate, strawberry, and banana. The food was pretty good and fresh for a buffet. They also had a carving station, I'm not sure exactly what they were carving I didn't stop there.  The reason I gave 3 stars is because it didn't have a lot of options. I think this buffet is one of the smaller ones on the strip. The unlimited mimosas come in a little plastic cup and they come around with a pitcher and refill it.  The views are amazing, it opens up to the Flamingo garden.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dFEpJzaRoQc2YVF9I3QYSg.text: Beautiful garden views with pretty pink flamingos to gaze at!  The cashier who rang us up at the front was warm and welcoming.  The rest of the service was OK.  After we were seated we waited a while to be greeted and for our drinks to arrive.  I had one sip, maybe two of my premixed mimosa with not so good OJ in it.  A little disappointing since I bought the "ALL you can eat and drink" buffet package.  The cherry cobbler made up for it though.

uJn8Nslgem5O9j2UrhQzFQ.text: Don't come here just for bottomless mimosas. You will be very disappointed. If you decide to come here, get the Groupon!  Food - 2/5 .. if you just want some cheap food after a night of drinking, it does the job. Nothing fancy. Waffles, eggs, bagels, French toast, etc. Good variety of foods and they all tasted like they should.  Mimosas - 0/5 .. all sugar no champagne.   You get what you pay for. It's cheap for a reason.

xu3LPkMTCPjijzH-bl1pJw.text: This buffet reminds me of a Chinese buffet - bleh decor, cut up fruit (where's the Jello?), ice cream machine, etc. The decor needs updating, the furniture needs updating - wait, I think they were in the middle of a remodel because we were seated right next to some curtains that were blocking off an area in the middle of the buffet.   Anyway, I didn't see any flamingos cause we were facing the food. The food was OK but it was breakfast/brunch when we arrived so there was runny eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. They had a really extensive salad bar, like 3 Chinese dishes, taco/nacho bar, and the other side had a poor spread of fruit and deserts. Other Vegas buffets are worth going to - unfortunately, I don't think we'd come back here unless we had a Groupon or a comp for a free buffet.

2ny_EWHWFb6_jNZK8JtohQ.text: Jimmy best server ever.  Cleaned dishes fast.  Kept  my sangria and my husband's beer flowing. I'm a Salad eater so they had great choices of greens, vegetables.  Crab legs served cold which was found.  The chefs were cast pleasant,  host moved us 3 times due to me wanting to sit by the window and she was grateful to to it. I got the groupon. More due to unlimited wine and  beer.  Food was good.  I've had crappy buffets and I don't think this is one of them.  Had hot clam chowder very yummy.  Carved ham, snow crab, tacos, fruits, desserts.  Something's I didn't like but that is at every buffet. Some things could but over all this was a nice buffet.  Even sat at the window.  Can see fish and flamingos and ducks. I'd come back here when I'm back in the state and with a groupon. This is not the worst buffet in my opinion. I'd give it an A-/B+. Service A++

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My salad, cranberry,  water and sangria.  Don&#39;t forget the water
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hubby and I enjoying dinner
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Us at the buffet

fTJaSI3ubSQ5nfB62QrSrA.text: Giving it only one star because the employees were nice and funny. From the cashier to the cooks at meat station and crab legs. The other star for the prime rib however the rest of the food was disappointing. The crab legs tasted old and were weak. That was our main reason for going. The baked potatoes were overly done. Same with the pork rib. I didn't enjoy it. In fact, no one in my family did. Bad quality. Didn't even bother with desserts. Why get disappointed again.

cBRyGgddQAIOy-0T9vtgSw.text: Food was good ! Very diverse ranging from breakfast Chinese and Mexican ! Also lots of dessert and ice cream ! They had unlimited mimosas for 5 dollars extra ! I thought It was worth the 30 dollars and the view of the topical landscape and flamingos was cool

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View

Vjy4JEIGq8CmPbaRTf5njA.text: Great buffet for starters. A bit too much seasoning, prolly need these chefs at Morels lol but good price, friendly staff and a lot of good options.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D76-eWjap_WFQ05KxMUU4Q.text: We went here because there was a groupon for 4 buffet meals. Around 10a on a Monday,  the line wasn't too bad. But the food was nothing special, those working seemed overly annoyed and the booth we were sat at was straight outta 1992. The cushion was so worn out, we sunk way below the table. If you're looking for cheap food, nothing special,  this is your place! Only cool thing about this buffet were the flamingos outside of it.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Yh-LYHXdzKER98fYibkwVg.text: To be honest, I asked around before trying out a groupon here and heard that no one had been talking about this buffet, so I was a bit nervous going in.  But it was uncalled for, we had a very nice time and I totally recommend it.  The view of the live flamingos outside the window is pretty neat and the food was satisfying.  I could nearly have been rolled out of there, which is a win in my book.  The line to get in looked pretty long when we got there but it moved quickly and in no time we were stuffing our faces.  Don't expect this place to be somewhere over the top and I feel like your expectations will be easy for it to meet.

xp5mRw7rAduFqQ_5GNSjSQ.text: Terrible service line took forever to get seated then waitress was rude toward me n my girlfriend. Wouldn't expect my expired DL and DMV papers. Wouldn't recommend this buffet to my worst enemy. Any buffet is better then this one. I never been so disrespected in my life. Will never be comin back here. Seats and tables r so close together i kept gettin bumped by people walking by. This is the worst buffet i ever been to in my life. STAY AWAY FROM HERE!!!! Don't waste ur money! Food isn't upscale but the prices to dine are. Good luck if ur choosing this buffet to eat at because ur gonna need it. :(

CYh4_CXwIIXYTB-Wvt9p7w.text: Came on a Sunday for breakfast (around 8) and there were lunch options already. There isn't a large selection of food. The view is nice with all the different birds. One perk is that there's an omelet making section. No dairy free or gluten free options for lactose intolerance. Very old fashion and needs an update. Kinda reminds me of an old college cafeteria. guacamole was extremely salty.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c1RfPjzpxTasQ8FyW2harw.text: My husband and I enjoyed the brunch. It had endless mimosas, the biggest was fresh and the staff kept the area clean. Our server Eddy was awesome. His personality and recommendations from the buffet was spot on. The scenery and the pink flamingos were gorgeous. We are there twice because we had amazing service and food. Highly recommend

v8VsamEqsNyecfLdJTcEpQ.text: The food was great! Not a huge selection but otherwise great! The service was wonderful and they didn't kick us out so we were here hours just talking

kvQoj_d7iu6yax5AWikHeg.text: Golden Corral has better Quality food.

rSK2e1SP8CWeTSaFEzGZCQ.text: This buffet had no line when we arrived at 6:30pm for dinner. There was quite a good variety including the Asian bar in the back (as the hostess reminded us).  The Asian bar had excellent variety - sushi, soups, noodles (vermicelli, pho). Even a create your own soup bowl bar (gather ingredients and hand to staff to add hot water). Dim sum items - pot stickers, shrimp balls - were readily available.  Shrimp was already peeled and cocktail sauce readily available.  Lamb was pretty good in the middle. If you get an end piece, it is possible that it may be too hard or burnt.  Lots of desserts - cookies, sugar free cookies, crepes, pies, chocolate fondu fountain with marshmallows.  Liked the fact that all hot items on counter were in individual pots to keep them warm. Sadly, most patrons didn't understand to leave the spoon on the plate and close the lids when done.  Slow service from staff. At this location, servers have too many tables to adequately maintain a decent level of service.  Would much prefer this for lunch than dinner.

5GJNjckTbagzsLwJaP8CGA.text: They have a good variety of food and dessert. There are better buffett in Vegas but this one is good if you get all you can eat in a day price. The desserts are the best here they have about 20 options.

bdudMqbpohyHFG0B85z3Mw.text: Paradise Garden Buffet in the Flamingo hotel is one of the 7 buffets that you can eat at with the 24 hour buffet pass in Vegas. My family and I went to this buffet the most times.  Overall, I love this place! Out of all the buffets I ate at (not including Harrah's because I didn't get the chance to eat there..) I think this place had the most food, and it was also roomy too. Very spacious, lots of place s to sit and wasn't too crowded when I went. The first time I went, there was a very long line..but several minutes later, one of the hosts moved my me and my fam up to a different line and were served right away, because had the 24 hour buffet bracelet on. Woohoo!  My only complaint about this place is that sometimes, they are slow to get your drink orders.  I was also enjoyed by the fact that they have cotton candy as one of their desserts, haha. I didn't get it..but it was fun to see. It was a first for me. I also liked the chocolate fountain they had where you can dip strawberries, marshmallows, etc.  They also had a ton of desserts. Coming from a health freak family, I like the fact that they are sugar-free as well.  I am definitely coming back to this place!

myzc5NWdvDbb7gFtxvdcSA.text: Went for breakfast and left full and happy. The food is not award winning by any means, in fact a few dishes were not worth eating after one bite, but it was generally tasty and a nice variety for breakfast. I enjoyed an "Elvis" crepe (peanut butter, bananas, and chocolate) along with the usual breakfast buffet items.

dbtbY0jtz9I8E6bwk4Oilw.text: I have heard so many great things about this buffet and needless to say... either they lied or where too trashed to realize how terrible it was. The food was horrible and disorganized. I couldn't tell what was what in the trays and hot holds. Seriously the labels were either gone or wrong.   The salds were ok, but the veggies and sides for choosing did not look to fresh. The meats were stale and flavorless. The chinese food selection was gross.   The only reason I gave this buffet two stars is because the hostess gave us free extra sky vodka mini bottles and the dessert selection was very good. But then again, how can you mess up cakes, ice cream and chocolate??? I especially liked the crepe station where they make it to your order and right in front of you.

KvChSTDfvmUxaEkh72o2gg.text: The quality of the food here was decent, not great.  Long ass lines to get to certain food selections.  The staff was slow.  How long does it take to get drinks to a table.  Now the dessert buffet was good. I was surpised the buffet was dayum near at the back of the hotel.  Highlight for me was seeing the flamingos outside.  This place desparately needs an overhaul like the slot machines they had right out the door.  They need to close for one more reason, to clean the carpets.  If I had to chose, I'd go to the MGM Buffet at least, the staff is faster and it's cleaner.  Besides that, no lines.

wUbFAhCyBfE5kYv3xOPpNA.text: For some reason, the Flamingo's buffet seems to be getting a bad rap.  I've been here a couple times and have enjoyed it very much.  They have a great seafood spread ("pile" is probably more accurate), a nice variety of entrees, a couple good choices at the carving station, and some pretty solid desserts.  It's not the fanciest buffet out there, but they do good work.  +It's easy to find coupons for it, and comps that you get on the Harrah's Total Rewards cards can be used here.

7ZUCO8vjYmDTsLpaQO4tjg.text: Ate lunch here. The food was fine, nothing fancy but enough choices. Really enjoyed watching the koi while I ate. The server was gruff at first but was laughing at my man's jokes by the time we left. Avoid the $3 Bloody Mary. I would not have been able to drink it if they paid me $3.

WopAEjGUaNJ0A54TivhtTQ.text: I'm not sure if I actually wasn't disappointed by the food because of our lunch at the MGM Grand buffet or if this is a real three star rating but either way, I wasn't disappointed =0).  They had shrimp, crab legs, "asian" food like all buffets do, fried food, baked fish, salmon, all kinds of stuff that wasn't too bad, but I'd have to agree with another yelper who said that the food was all lukewarm and not necessarily hot or cold.  I didn't eat too much because since we were doing a turnaround I didn't want to eat and then having the itis driving home.  The food I had was just ok, though.  The crab legs were bottom of the barrel, weren't very fresh, they had made slits in the shells so they could be opened easier, but even when they were broken at the slits the meat stuck to the shells so it was hard to get it all out without completely cracking the legs open lengthwise (yah, I'm kind of a crab leg pro hahaha).  The desserts were ok, nothing to complain about after a long day on my feet.  The only thing that was slightly annoying was the fact that they sat our large group in the back but had ample seating everywhere else.  Other than that, the man who was serving us our drinks was great and quick, missed a few people which was understandable because there were so many in our party.  Overall our experience was nice, the food was decent and didn't disgust me like the MGM buffet did, and the staff was great.

3nWuF7Jf6CLat3R8ZeCrTQ.text: I don't know why people would go to buffets when there are so many unique restaurants out here in Vegas. Anyway, my party decided they wanted a buffet and majority ruled. The food was OK. The selection was poor in comparison to other buffets and the quality was substandard. I got jipped! $20 for OK food? On the bright side, they do have this awesome Koi pond that makes mine look like a cheap fish tank.

Yl6zyXRWfMujltzwiWeXwg.text: Like I said before i WOULD recommend a visit here.  Not as expensive as some of the other buffets but just the right amount of seafood to satisfy.  Check out lunch time prices if you are trying to save a few dollars but still enjoy the benefits.  I enjoyed this place even better this time on my last trip to Las Vegas in June.  Altogether though it was slightly a step  under the Spice Market Buffet.

CkSxd_Xk4FsYeyDTC0qpaQ.text: How do I start this. Just NO! We went and surprised by a minimal choices of food. Not even appealing.i told my friends we shoulda checked the review before we went here.when I checked all I read is complains.mediocre is the right term for this buffet.go to Paris buffet it is much better! Will never come here again.

OZiIhK88KKvAmjY_NReBHQ.text: DO NOT EAT HERE!  A party of three of us ate on Sat 3/24/2012.  We had no waiting for the line which was good, but then we found out why.  First according to them they had no soda/pop in the whole place and every time we wanted a refill they had to go another bar in the casino.    So this means no real refills.   Most of the "hot" food was warm, some just cold.  We went in at dinner time 7:30pm.  After trying to eat the made to order pasta with red sauce tasted like I have no way to describe it but enough to make you puke.   Several items were bad on the buffet.  My whole party got sick, and we all spent night and morning in the bathroom in our hotel.   I think this buffet should be shut down!!!  We will be sending a letter to the hotel, and the state health department.  I will NEVER EAT HERE AGAIN!  WE COULD BE GIVEN FREE PASSES FOR LIFE AND WOULD NOT EAT THERE.  I WOULD NOT EVEN GIVE THEM TO A HOMELESS PERSON!

n2B_uCBj_QgimMNFh2OyFw.text: The Paradise Garden Buffet worked out well for me. You see, I'm on a diet. On my recent visit to Las Vegas, I was too tired to seek out a nice dinner, so I stopped in at the Flamingo's buffet. The chief factor recommending it was its location right by the elevator to my hotel room, and no line. I figured at least I could make myself a healthy salad.  Turns out everything in the buffet is so unappealing there is no temptation to overeat.  The quality is comparable to elementary school cafeterias, although the selection is much broader. I ate until the hunger pangs went away, and left, diet intact. Even if you get a comped meal here, you really might want to consider paying for a nice meal somewhere else.

-k_NWAs7l76sFQP-_yqO7w.text: This buffet is so average.  They dont have a wide variety.  They have an ok breakfast and a really nice view of the pond which saves this from a 2 star.  There are much better buffets out there that cost about the same.  If it was as cheap as a station buffet, maybe good on value, but for $15 bucks, I rather just cook at home!

alAQ2Nht8o_n0f_-x47U6g.text: Lunch was cheap and all I ate was shrimp so it was worth it! Nothing else was memorable but we were so hungry we didn't care and had a good time.

-uDB64oypmBG80BNAw-YEQ.text: This isn't the best buffet I've been to in Las Vegas, nor is it the worst.  It's very much somewhere in between.  We went to the Paradise Garden Buffet despite the so-so reviews because:  A. It was in our hotel, and... B. We had a coupon for $10 off of two meals.  We ended up going for the "champagne and bloody mary brunch" on Saturday morning, and though I didn't partake of the bloody marys I did consume what was probably more champagne than a single person should ever have before noon.    The food was very average on the whole, but we really enjoyed the fresh crepe-making station - the place gets extra points for that.  Also, I could see flamingos from my seat... once again, nice touch.  Also, when we walked in with our receipt and meal ticket we honestly weren't sure which was which, so when my boyfriend asked the awesome lady at the hostess station about it she replied "The LONG one is mine *eyebrow raise, all sultry like*," and it cracked me the hell up.  Would I go back without a coupon?  Probably not.  But if you happen to be staying at the Flamingo, you're hungry, and you're not quite ready to face the light of day, this isn't a bad place to get some breakfast.

lqXZcv_DzZKb_HLdejZQPQ.text: What's with the 1 stars? Are you kidding me? I'm just going to assume those people were so drunk they forgot to chew.   This buffet was GLORIOUS! Part of that is because Gloria is the best waitress ever. She filled my glass of Orange Juice, I chugged it (needing the fluids) and she turned right around and filled it up again! That's great customer service if I ever saw it.   When we checked in to the Flamingo we got a coupon book that gave two people $5 off of the buffet. That was a sign from above because there were 2 of us! Normally I guess the breakfast buffet is $14.99 but we got it for $10. No champagne in this one, but it being our last day, I could live with that.   If you've read any of my other reviews you'll know that I know my way around a breakfast, and this place did too! Bagels with smoked salmon lox and cream cheese, amazing french toast and waffles, a crepe station (ask for banana, they have it!), an omelet station (that will blow your mind! I'll get to that later) and bacon, sausage, an amazing amount of good fruit and everything else.   It was all to die for. Literally, the best omelet I've ever had, the ingredient were fresh and perfect. The crepe was huge and with just bananas and sugar the perfect amount of sweet. The fruit was better then any we had had so far and even the toast was so good I was eating it dry while waiting for them to make my omelet.   We were there during the lunch switch and I saw some people eating ribs, and I would have grabbed some if I thought I could get on a plane with that much food in my stomach.   This buffet is worth coming to even if you're not at the Flamingo. So fantastic. Maybe the best meal we had in the whole vacation!

iMSDOwZIZLl09Ku6Ff7-rg.text: I'm a big fan of buffets.  But this buffet definitely had that "old hotel" feel, and the food was just OK.  The food was similar quality to Old Country Buffet (not to put OCB down, but at least their price is on point with the quality of their food!)  Just having arrived from our morning flight, we were practically starving when we got to the hotel.  After checking in, we immediately went downstairs to the buffet.  Luckily we used our resort credit of $30 that we got when we booked the room, because for free, the food was fine.  We went here around 11ish am, so they were transitioning between breakfast and lunch.    PROS:  I have to disagree with the reviewers that said they had no fruit selection or a good dessert area - since they had both!  They had a nice selection of fresh fruit, and the dessert area was nice!  They had little slices of different cakes and tarts (my fav!) - and they even had a crepes station.  Their bread pudding was delicious, although I've had better elsewhere.  I ate two servings!  :)  They also had a nice selection of cheese, and BBQ ribs were good.  This was the prime location to watch the flamingos from inside, too.  CONS:  It was I think $16 per person, which for the quality of the food it should have been closer to $9.99.  I didn't touch anything on the salad bar, it all looked old and unappetizing.  Even the person sitting next to us we overheard saying the same thing.  I did manage to get some mixed corn from there but it had no flavor.  They also had ceviche, which was questionable since I wasn't sure how long it had been sitting out, but tasted ok and I didn't get sick from it!     In conclusion, this place was ok for free, and for starving people.  Otherwise, there are way better buffets in Vegas than this just a few minutes walk away!

Lmxyyw9thAyv4-PAuSZyZQ.text: This place is a real Paradise. We found a Groupon coupon for two for only $30. Awesome deal for all you can eat buffet. The food was so beautiful and delicious and it makes go woow woow.  Ohhh lala. They have plenty of different type of food and a separate room for dessert and pastry. You can get your crepe made fresh and hot right in front of your eyes. Great place and amazing view of ducks and flamingos. Love it love it.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

syp8h7bm757MUGnpkGBtRw.text: This place is good for brunch!!! Idk about dinner. They have yummy crepes made to your liking and they also have lots of different breakfast options like omelets made to order as well.

mDk32Ee25DhP1dem_tiIDQ.text: Not a very decent seafood buffet. Luckily I was just craving for prime rib so this place fulfilled it. Seafood choices were very limited for what's considered a seafood dinner buffet.
