They were a bit stingy even when I asked to cut me a thicker slice of prime rib but I ended up having to ask for two slices to equal the thick slice I wanted. Desserts were awful. I would not return to this buffet again even if I was that lazy to go out of my hotel.

JMDsXAQNoN80yIjC1heixQ.text: Very good food and huge variety. Also includes beer and wine at no extra charge.  Recommend for sure.

CGP8Z3yF6TXGJ7RZtl4scA.text: Pretty good food. You get what you pay for. Cheap for Vegas. Overall satisfied with the experience. Service was ok.

agsP8zMhm3buVcd1koMl9w.text: Eddie gave great service. Always made sure we had everything we needed. Brunch was great and a great price considering it included unlimited mimosas and bloody mary's. can't wait to go back!

j-vHJfodGqHmHR0ilLWVAg.text: Price range is between $20-$30. Came here for bfast/lunch and it's a typical selection of American and Mexican dishes ranging from omelets, pizza, and deli sandwiches to rolled tacos and and tortilla bar. The rolled tacos were probably my favorite thing there because they're light, crispy, and saucy. They also have a salad and dessert bar but I barely touched them because it's just cookies and little pastries. Crepes were ok and limited in what you can put in them. Our waitress was very friendly!

klB267QT2IPoe6MDwyYaeg.text: It is a buffet. Every time we come to Vegas we come here for breakfast. Probably 10 times over the years. You can get your eggs to order and as much bacon as you can eat. That makes my breakfast along with coffee. They do this well. Servers are usually nice and helpful. Not much else to say.

qlG7lqU5QWQytnDNXGqXMA.text: We stayed here so hit the buffet for breakfast to fill up before a day at Valley of Fire park.  It was $87.00 for 4. I would not go again. Compared to some of the other buffets we tried it is relatively small scale. The food was not bad but very run of the mill cafeteria like almost for breakfast. Free mimosas but the lady only came by once after intially taking our drink orders. I would definitely trot a little farther one way or the other for breakfast unless you just don't have time it is not worth it.  The best part was we were seated by the windows and got to watch the birds in the wildlife habitat while we ate.

a8ZJtWDzG-N00AudUmMLaA.text: Located in the back of the casino great atmosphere many items to choose. Friendly service always asking if everything is great. Sushi was very good, chicken tasty,ribs tinder with enough sauce, we had a little taste of many items and each one was fresh. After reading many reviews I was first apprehended to try it, wasn't bad as I thought. The prices were reasonable. We went close to when it opened so everything was fresh. I would go again great food for the price.

Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clean &amp; fresh

wwqNXhue57zQeWBc6_3yTA.text: I didn't pay for this buffet and I was still disappointed. This place needs a serious upgrade in both food and decor. Having the guy at the carving station seem annoyed when anyone asked him for anything was another nice touch. 2 stars for the complimentary alcohol they serve, although my wife insisted that her Bloody Mary didn't seem to have any alcohol in it. If you're paying for a buffet, probably best to go elsewhere.

JTWGmEvYGaPmi2m_dCkQnw.text: Crisantos made the best omelette I have eaten in ages. They had all the most popular toppings one could want and he made it with just the right everything. Pancakes are cooked to order. The breakfast potatoes are fabulously delicious. The service was very attentive and nice. The bloody Mary's good and spicy. Champagne kept following.

Y639XK40kAJgkTUceK8fIA.text: Paradise Found and Lost. The brunch buffet was buff with choices, and/et the food quality was good, not great but decently good, for the very most part. The view of the garden was nice. The entrance line moved along fairly quickly. The group buying price was an inducement to give the buffet a try, and it was surely a very reasonable cost. That helped to upgrade my stars to four from three, particularly considering the discounted price. My only disappointments were to do with the service (two stars). Firstly, unlike other group buying buffet deals, we were charged tax. . . . There also seemed to be a paucity of staff. The beverages were self serve, which was fine, but the so called free "bottomless" mimosas or Bloody Mary's', included in the deal, were certainly not conspicuous. The removal of used plates was very sporadic, and tables often remained uncleaned for some time. This was less to do with the staff being non-conscientious and seemingly more to do with the limited amount of staff, given the demands at hand. Another example was when I was lining up for a crepe, the attendant suddenly without warning stated that she had to go on her break and someone would replace her (no indication exactly when). The replacement arrived about eight minutes later, when I and two others had already given up waiting. The omelette cook was speedy, and the dollar tip for the tip bowl was deserving. Although his buoyancy and amiability was like a flat balloon. The staff should be given special acknowledgments and photos displays, as well as "extra" appreciations for supplementary friendly and industrious service. One could tell that they were likely underappreciated. They were lacking the upbeat qualities that reflect good spirits -- and this likely also reflected in even the basic tips that they might receive. The host was the only one with a little smile. Not paradise for staff, it appears.

Dc-lO-3wbUxOo50zu112hQ.text: The only redeeming thing about this place was the waitress being absolutely lovely and having a free ticket for staying at the Flamingo. The food was cold and disgusting at late breakfast. We had to ask for milk for the cereal instead of having milk readily available near the cereal station. The ONLY good food at this place is the desserts but I would not pay 20 bucks for that alone. Just skip the buffets in Vegas in general.

4Zqy6STkDPXeU1Da7y6HIg.text: Meets the criteria of a buffet. Nothing "wow" just mass quantities of decent food and cheap wine/champagne. Good price, makes a dookie.

uhv9FDK6oWwYCAqmixmgHQ.text: Food and drinks were very good especially for the price! Definitely worth it for your brunch spot! What really made it great for us was Lucille at the front desk! Super friendly and helpful! She deserves credit!

grFX1FLAvhzXbqVLSkMxZA.text: My family of 7 and cane here in April 28, 2018. Very very bad experience, firstly, the host, Kenny, was very unpleasant I requested a different table and he replied back by saying, "I don't have time right now, and this table is fine and is bigger." This host is not very friendly and needs training on customers etiquette. Secondly, the quality of the food is below average, the crab is very dry and over cooked, the fruits, I.e. watermelon and cantaloupe was not ripe, the desserts had a limited selection. I expect the casino would have some kind of chef would would QA the quality of the food being served. It had very bad representation of the casino to serve such low standard food. The only positive experience is the server, we did not get a name but she was from El Salvador and provided excellent service and was kind and friendly. This was my first and last time eating here, definitely not worth $32 dollars per person.

LOv22O9KIoqHbssgRU0J5g.text: The line moves a little slow, but once inside and seated, the wait is well worth it. The view out side consists of coy fish and colorful trout swimming in pools, beautiful flamingos flocking together, last but not least colorful rare birds and shy reptiles.  To the menu: The made to order omelettes are delicious.  The ham steak, bacon, turkey and other options are tasty. Fresh fruit, a plethora of choices makes this one of my favorite brunch buffets in Vegas.

VSyG6hWlKGpoueJsTKQZEg.text: For a buffet not bad at all,  above average.  Great selection,  loads of flavor.  Service was awesome,  staff attentive and overall a good experience.    A bit pricey,  but we had a coupon.  If it was full price or might not have been worth it.    Would love to try the dinner, but that is only on Friday and Sat nights.

8JqnnWqiOQlbFmnAB9PSAA.text: Unfortunately this was one of the more terrible experiences I've had at a breakfast buffet in Las Vegas.  There wasn't a wait to get into this one and we were in a hurry.  Unfortunately, we paid the price for that in more ways than one.  First, the cost - $25 per person.  Fairly standard, until you realize that they have seating for at least 400 people in the restaurant, which is usually half-filled, and only have one person pouring champagne, one person making omelettes, and then only one place to get hot food like eggs and bacon.  So what happens when the place gets full, is that you wait sometimes up to 10 MINUTES IN LINE to get a spoonful of eggs, or a couple pieces of bacon!  Want a refill on champagne? Gotta wait 5 minutes! Clearly the funding for this buffet has been sharply reduced, or it never had much at all.  Additionally, we decided to sit by the window next to what looked like a nice pond from a distance.  But when we sat down, it looked like the pond hadn't been cleaned in a very long time and there was a dead turtle floating in it!!!  If you are reading this - heed my advice and give this place a miss!  You would be better off going to a Denny's or even McDonald's for that matter!  There is certainly no value here.

KemFUaplgAT_Mp-tuH6aoQ.text: Fantastic! This was a great brunch buffet with all of the fixings! I was able to eat whatever I could have wanted at 11am. There was a fantastic Groupon deal which helped give a discount. Another bonus was bottomless mimosas!!  This was delicious and I'm so happy we got to eat here. Can't wait to come back and enjoy the buffet at the Flamingo again!

uPKoGKoD_UL3zMoz8igmiA.text: The Paradise Garden buffet is a decent mid-quality, mid-price buffet. Pretty standard fare in a no-frills environment (but there is a nice window onto the bird habitat courtyard)  My wife and I went twice, once for dinner, once for a champagne brunch. It's on the lower price-range of Strip casino buffets, and the quality matches. That's not to say it's bad, it's just not exactly fancy.  For dinner, most of everything was okay-to-good, and some of the dishes are even memorably good (the tex-mex taco beef with warmed tortillas did it for me in a childhood taco-tuesday kinda way). We purchased the unlimited drinks package and weren't impressed with the refill frequency on our beer and wine, which we feel may have been an intentional way of controlling costs, preventing guests from getting unruly, or perhaps a bit of both. Regardless, we had maybe 3 drinks in our hour or so at the buffet and felt like maybe it wasn't worth paying for the add-on.   Brunch was another story. The breakfast fare was competently prepared and exactly what you'd expect. Bacon, eggs, hash browns, I think there may have been some dim sum, tasty but nothing special. However, the drink service was a different story. Even with the fact that the mimosas were watered down, we ended up trashed, and fast. We were having to turn down refills to catch our breath. Our server either wanted us to have a really good time, or had some kind of personal vendetta against livers.   There are better buffets on the strip, there are cheaper places to eat on the strip, there are better, cheaper buffets on the strip. But hey, if you're staying at the Flamingo, hungry and just want to go eat a bunch of stuff without a ton of fuss, maybe look at some pink birds, there's nothing wrong with checking out the Paradise Buffet.

iIup5NNjXm6Eizp0XzzNcA.text: The music is super loud. Instead of being background music, it's in your face. Not everyone has the same taste in music.  Ok the food, tasteless. We arrived 20 mins after they opened 7:20am, no hash Browns. Fake eggs Benedict, gummy pancakes, and how the heck do u screwup French toast. Just don't go here. The Flamingos outside the window, however were perfect, very pretty!!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No hash browns on a breakfast buffet? They finally made them and they were awful! Just terrible buffet.

mEeLElwYXNI-3RiBR28t3g.text: It's really sad this place is going downhill fast you cannot just rely on a beautiful interior to be the centerpiece of a buffet you guys really really really truly need to overhaul your buffet,  I came in this morning the bacon was soggy the eggs were stale and dry the beef sliders were cold and robbery and on top of that the only thing that actually tasted good today was the sliced watermelon and pineapple this is not a good buffet to come to you to spend your money if you have a buffet at buffet pass it's doable but I wouldn't make this the focal point of your Vegas trip this place really badly needs an overhaul

IVVQivDgogYz1cfj_N0eDw.text: We went to this Buffet for dinner around 6 pm, they offer dinner buffet from 17-22 and the price for that on Saturday is 36.99 $ . Service was very good.you had a lot of choices for foods and the quality was acceptable but not great. You can see the flamingos in garden while you are eating your food. Totally it's worth to try when you spend your time vegas!

te7fqoFaQ8fOETnncI_DJA.text: This definitely wasn't what i was expected. This buffet needs an upgrade. The decor was so old and dirty. There were flys everywhere! EVERYWHERE!!! I purchased a Groupon for 2 for 49 which included unlimited mimosas. The mimosas aren't hand made. They come already made from a company( as the waitress told us) they gave us small plastic cups which you get at a child's party for mimosas. They have an okay selection for brunch. The usual stuff. Omelet station, a mix of breakfast and lunch. Chinese, fried chicken, taco bar etc. the food was lackluster at best. I'm sure there are better buffets worth it. This one wasn't.

B48Xp1Jrvz27GyswgSjHDA.text: I had not been here in years but I thought that the quality and quantity was just as good. The only thing that had changed was the price for the brunch buffet. It had doubled but then so has everything else in "The Strip" area. It was not crowded at all so we were able to get a nice table by a window and were able to see Pink Flamingos and all the fish and ducks swimming below us.  The variety was good but very simple in selection. Basic at best but satisfying. I did like the communal beverage station where you can get what you want when you want it.  Inside it was very clean and bright and plates were cleared away as soon as they were empty. We had very nice service, better than the average buffet service.

Eq4teijnZPu-t_fV6HrFwg.text: Came here because my friends found it on Groupon and wanted to give it a try. Wasn't really expecting much going in since I had saw some Yelp reviews already haha. Here's the rundown:  -There's a crazy line outside even though there are hella empty tables inside (not sure why) -Omelette station was okay, but the chef was SUPER slow; watching him slowly cook while waiting was painful. He also decided to put a ridiculous amount of cheese on it; didn't try to stop him because I just wanted my food -Bottomless mimosas are okay but you need to flag down a waitress everytime you want a refill -Sushi was super stale - avocado was brown and the fish was a pale colour - avoid if you don't want a stomachache! -Regular hot dishes were okay. -Mac and cheese was surprisingly bad - how can you mess that up?? :( -Desserts were a hit or miss. Some tasted okay, but my friend said the donut was hard -Cute view of the flamingos/waterfall park  Overall, its not super expensive so I'm not salty about it but if you actually want good food, go somewhere else. If you just want to eat and be full, this place is okay.

ESYK8GWyHhoXbqr2pTjc2w.text: We decided to try this buffet out for ourselves before looking at the Yelp reviews!  We came here on a weekday for brunch. There was no line and we were seated immediately. The buffet options were limited, but we knew that going in because it was just brunch items. I do have to say we were actually really impressed with the quality of the food.   We thoroughly enjoyed our brunch and the view of the flamingos. The drinks are self-serve which is kind of neat; you get to try a bunch of different sodas and there's also a cool coffee/latte machine.   I could only imagine that dinner would be just as enjoyable, especially if they keep up with the quality of food and expand options as well.   So we gave it 3 stars. For a buffet on the strip, it was well worth the price we paid for brunch. The food was good, but again, for a buffet on the strip, the decor is a little dated and there aren't a lot of options compared to the newer buffets. If you're in the area, stop by for a quick bite, but don't go out of your way.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another plate. Again, impressed with the quality of food.

EY2asL-QwUxi80NwK3VM0Q.text: I'm not sure why the ratings aren't that good for this place, but our breakfast was great. For $28.99 we loved it (better than paying $50+ anywhere else). There was an omelette station, all the breakfast essentials, snacks, dessert, and even some lunch options. Plus pop, coffee and juice. We enjoyed ourselves and the flamingo view!

LQ6NPP6NUkvo0wJ8_wwzRQ.text: I decided to go here since I had a $10 dollar off coupon. The food was not good at all. This was during their brunch hours. I just couldn't get myself to eat not tasty calories. I only ate the smoked salmon and cantaloupe and left.  Everyone that works here is very nice that is why I am Giving an additional star. They were too kind.   They had a create your own omelette and crepe station but the food here is just blah. With so many other buffets in the area and if you don't mind paying more, then this place isn't for u.

LEQlcCCO64gRBguR4ngSBA.text: Toward the middle in terms of ranking within its tier of buffets. Food good enough with a decent amount of variety. I wouldn't waste my appetite here.

bSXKhvax9HNZJGzzOL8GMg.text: We came in for brunch and the food was ok. You can't mess up breakfast, and the "lunch" offerings were ok. I ended up eating more breakfast items because the other items seem dry, tasted unseasoned, and just wasn't that good. I love sweets, and even their sweet offerings were not up to par. It was only $35 per person with unlimited mimosas, but, I honestly would of preferred to go somewhere else for brunch.

ErXiF0PW4OGJablFR99V-g.text: Years ago i tried the Flamingo Buffet and i was very very disappointed. Now that several years passed (including many hotel updates) i wanted to give it another try.  The buffet kept the same charming atmosphere and it was kind of a nod to Vintage Vegas. You can look outside and still see the pink flamingo's parading about the Garden area outside. It's a rather large venue even though the seating is a little too jammed together...almost as if youre eating with your neighbor.  The buffet line and food is presented very neatly and nicely in my opinion. I went to the brunch buffet so they had a very unique offering to include a live omelette and live crepe station. Everything I had tasted very good, the only complaint I had was the drink service which was slow and spotty.  I feel however the brunch buffet was a little too expensive to call it a good value, but I will reiterate that the food here was of good quality and the selection was adequate. I do plan to come back for dinner to see how that has changed for the better  ....Stay tuned!

OTkkNXrFWqGz31BUZ4Lsqg.text: Took advantage of the groupon and tried the buffet during the week.  Not a bad buffet and one of the cheaper ones on the strip. They do brunch only during the week and bunch & dinner on weekends.  The hot dishes & desserts were good, good selection ranging from pancakes to tacos.  There's usually a long line to get in as you have 2 cashiers and 1 person taking people to their tables.  Great view of the wildlife habitat.

EGYHECR4JBPcXmNQ0_pMsQ.text: For the money it cannot be beaten. Like $27 per person? Yeah that's pretty solid. And it's right in the middle of the strip, so not too far of a walk from either direction.  But they have all your normal American foods. For breakfast, expect a bit of a wait. But unless you want to go to White Castle or Denny's, you're not liable to find a cheaper breakfast on the main portion of the Las Vegas Strip. I'd hit this place up. It's cheap enough to fill your belly. And if that's what you're looking for, then come here.  Oh and the food ain't bad.

QpeTRn-t8eVvv6j52jVZdA.text: Waitress wasn't attentive nor did that have a lot of selections for breakfast.the best part was by far was the omelet that is cooks to order! Wonderful worker!! I suggest hand sanitizer as some of the staff do not wash their hands, which caused me to leave. $10.81 isn't bad for a buffet at all but unsanitary practices is a turn off and I was completely sober

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelet and pancakes and French toast

3mG5NGeUgEPKcA3d1MDYBQ.text: Not sure why the low reviews scores. This place was fantastic especially with the Groupon offer.  A huge variety of delicious and tasty meals for brunch.  I loved the nacho station alongside the pasta.  Would absolutely recommend this place and would recommend looking for the coupon on Groupon.  A real stunner.

nvreAuJ6haGFhLIzBce64A.text: Can't speak for the dinner experience, but the only reason you should come here for brunch is the $36 for 2 bottomless mimosas and bloody Mary's deal on Groupon. Our waitress was very attentive and always had our cup filled, and the mimosas werent bad either. We also had a great view of the garden and the flamingos outside.  As for the food...most of it was pretty bad. The omelette station was pretty good but the line got long later on. The breakfast burritos were also very good but they ran out quickly. Also a good selection of fruits, cheeses, and smoked salmon. What upset me the most was that they ran out of cocktail shrimp very early on, then didnt refill it and just replaced it with salad!  Probably wouldn't come here again, but it was a nice experience for cheap endless mimosas.

HLx6dvRhMaX8zt9RPRBSWg.text: Huge waste of time and money. I tend to write reviews when I am exceptionally impressed or incredibly let down. This place falls under the latter category. The place was filthy, the food was faaaaar below average, drinks were so watered down, and the service was sad. In the hour we were there we got one refill on our "bottomless mimosas". The waitress had about 5 tables full out of ten and she was freaking out and telling all of us she couldn't handle it. All she had to do was bring drinks and clear tables........ Food was stale and flavorless. Even with the Groupon I used I felt I got ripped off.

f50tNJqIHUcrxOKC3Ilrgg.text: AWFUL.  The sushi looked like it had been left out for hours, the crab legs were skimpy, the shrimp was slimy, the salad fixin's were limp, fruit looked like it came out of a can, the desserts were dry and tasted cheap.  We were a table of 6 and ALL of us were disappointed.  To make matters worse, the cashier was SO INCREDIBLY RUDE ((Martha)), and when we asked to speak to a manager ((Kevin)) I had never seen anyone look so annoyed at me in my life.  Horrible customer service, AWFUL food.  AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAGUE.

5NphqbdpVyop4RLTQ786QA.text: Went there for brunch on New Year's Day.  Not bad for a buffet with crab legs and shrimp.  Freshly cooked omelletes is available upon request. Friendly service.

PkRZwedkLrt0f_YoVtS1xA.text: Yea no thanks. Of the buffets I tried on my trip this was the worst. Basically tasted like they went to Costco to buy the food then threw it on the buffet. They have stations where they do some MTO food which sounds neat, but it must means long lines.

FTW-MRck6Nnxo2myyW_CLA.text: If you stay at the Flamingo or the Hilton Vacation suites next door they give you a book of coupons, use this book. They have a decent selection of all things good here, if you're wasted (you're in vegas, you're wasted) make sure you drink a lot of milk and eat a lot of prime rib. This is a 13 dollar buffet that tastes like a 20 dollar buffet. Highly recommended.

b4Pj_KfCn5aJJY37ApyyTQ.text: Line was short, first of all. About 8 ppl in front of us. This was the first meal I ate after a hangover and it didn't make me yak, so I loved it!  The food was pretty good. Good variety. I loved their mountain of seafood though! That was amazing. Crabs, shrimp, crawfish. I gobbled that shiz up. Everyone always talks smack about the shrimp still being in their shell, but I thought it was normal since that's how it goes down in my house.   Staff was a little slow, but not anything too ridiculous. They were very kind and courteous, too.   Dessert variety was awesome! So many little delectable items. But of course, I couldn't resist the strawberry crepes with soft-serve on the side and chocolate syrup, mmmm.   The view of the wildlife is cool, too. I love watching flamingos and ducks while I eat their distant cousins simmered in a fine sauce.  The lighting is a little depressing, tho. It takes mood lighting one step too far.   Go eat here, it's delicious.

bYg9FVCL84XX88nSDSEiuQ.text: $47 dollars for 2 people, you would think the food is good. This crap was nasty. The only foods that were decent was the little fried shrimp and the ice cream. What a waste of money and time. Never again and why was it so much dessert, but hardly anything else?

FQ_aaP0H-YRPoLSjx7vGGg.text: service was by far the best at this buffet then any other we had in vegas, food was ok too but way over priced for a buffet

Y_P2e4O1VwUAHbEaZsp6EQ.text: Very friendly staff greeted us and service was great. We had been to a buffet before so had an idea of what to expect. Initially food looked great however everything was stone cold and tasteless. Over priced compared to other buffets around. Really disappointed as was looking forward to great meal.

CWgdsjfivLpqqDgD9AUzLA.text: I cannot compare it against other buffets in Vegas only, but I can say this for sure that it is the most miserable buffet I have ever been to! The wait time is decent, the choices are very limited and low quality (on lunch). Everything that I tried sucked! It is dated, the seat was almost broken, the service is barely OK though... The entrance through the Flamingo's casino smelled bad... Really low class...

zh55O7xEG78zWUUOM2vFPQ.text: My sister and I had breakfast here on our last day in Vegas. We ended up really lucky because some ladies in front of us were handing out extra coupons for the buffet. For breakfast it was a excellent buffet, a good spread, and even if it wasn't a huge variety, or anything exotic, it was all the fare you would expect at breakfast, as well as a waffle and omlet station. It was very clean, service was a little slow, but decent and the food was all well cooked. If you get the coupon it makes the price much more reasonable.

QTtd0sxTJwCBKoN8aGNcVw.text: For breakfast... Pro's: - it's a buffet - might be near you  Con's: - long lines/lots of people - stressed out waitress service - food might not be to die for  If you go to one of the tix4tonite box offices, you can get discounts on a number of buffets, shows, and other types of entertainment.  In the process, we saved about $100.  My advice: get there early enough to avoid long lines, and to get the best deals available.  The same kinda goes for meal lines and buffets (although, a lot of people like to eat early to be free later).

iD7I8QwlaYpYScLO__NqAw.text: This is my favorite buffet in Vegas for breakfast.  The scenery is great.  Teyu to get a window seat so you cna watch the Koi and birds.  They have crepe and omelet stations where you can get them made to order.  They also have a good variety of fruits.  They have a champagne brunch on Sunday for $25 I think we skip that since we don't drink champange.  For lunch if you can wait until 3:30 you can pay for lunch and get some of the dinner foods.  At 4:00 they start changing over food.  Mmm .. crab legs.

-S56sDInCm7x5XwTDWj6lQ.text: Wow what a horrible buffet, they charge 24.99 to eat here and i felt like i was eating at a local Chinese restaurant buffet in my home state of Maryland, It was really that bad.  I will start off with the service, my waitress was the worst of the worst, i was eating crab legs and my waitress came to me and told me i needed to get another another plate for my shells.....  well do your job and get it. She dropped a plate on my table, brought me like 1 napkin at a time, never filled my drinks etc etc. Now on to the food, EVERYTHING was just bad, the hot food was cold and the cold food was hot. The crab legs were the tiniest little things I have ever seen. I heard the waitress telling the people behind us if they wanted good crab legs go to the Rio hahah.  The waitress telling people to go elsewhere WOW.  It tasted like everything was old. Ok the desert bar was pretty good, everything else sucked. People should NEVER go to this.

GQ1WgLpffbiHF0MEx36qJA.text: Horrible!! Firstly it was way overpriced...kid's price was only 2 dollars cheaper that adult. After paying $75 for me and my 2 kids (8yr and 4yrs) we were sat down at a dirty table. When I asked for a clean table she acted like it was a chore. Then I proceeded to get my son some food. When I picked up the tongs I noticed a bug flying around. Upon closer inspection there were numerous bugs flying around the food! And many more dead in the ice that surrounded the cold food and salad! A couple were crawling on their  sandwiches! I put down the plate and requested the manager for a full refund. Though the manager was courteous, it took him 20 min to issue my refund! And while I was standing there waiting for him to do the refund they continued to take more guests money and seat them. I take the 1 star I gave this place back and give them 0! Do not eat here unless u like unexpected friends in your food!

KAbflPimTw8ctzOHAI6JKQ.text: It was my only buffet experience in Vegas. Went to a 4pm show at the Flamingo and decided to eat right after the show.  There was a line, but the wait was minimal. Food all seemed fresh. We had a view of Flamingos and a waterfall. The price seemed more than reasonable for the quality and selection.

QHXXuw4-sUCGc_GXPv3SWQ.text: I like this buffet--good food, great view of the flamingos and waterfalls.  Line can get long to get in, but the people are friendly and I've always enjoyed my dining experience here.

yBnWd39iMCTIl8tUp-SJpg.text: We came for dinner, mid-week, around 10:00.  The place was packed, yet we only had to wait about 15 mins total to pay and be seated.  All the staff we encountered (cashier, hostess, servers) were extremely friendly.  I even watched the hostess deal with some poorly behaved guests, and she did so in a great way, staying cool and friendly.  VERY impressed with the staff.  The decor was nice, but a bit "plastic."  After visiting the more elegant restaurants, this one felt a bit cheap, but then again, it was 1/2 the price of the other restaurants.  It was about $16 a person to eat dinner; that was the cheapest we've seen yet.  I guess you get what you pay for.  It reminded me of smaller version of Home Town Buffet or Sizzler, but the only food that was really outstanding was the cooked-to-order steak.  I am picky about steak, and this one deserved a 9/10!  It was really good, but nothing else stood out as great/good.  Though I couldn't pin-point any bad items for cleanliness, besides the mess people were making in the bathroom (I skipped it after a cursory glance in), it had a 'dirty vibe.'  (That's probably way too vague, but I can't explain it any other way except to say it didn't look exceptionally clean.)  It seems to me that with a good upholstery clean, and carpet clean, and just upping the presentation, not over-cooking most of the meat dishes, and adding some spice and presentation, they could raise their ratings (and price) a wee bit.

MueaDS9ndZZcMryHq2HwkA.text: This buffet is Not Bad for the buck....Pretty good amount of selection, but nothing special. Everything is together, meats, carving station, seafood and salad area isnt bad. This buffet had 2 areas you can go which has same kind of food...Not as extravagant as Rio, Paris or Mandalay Bay but descent, good service and big area to eat in....

Np1i-c9ZhFfiXTVPTShGEQ.text: definitely not worth it.  i felt the selection was very limited.  dessert section was not impressive.  there weren't even any fruits.  although there is a whole section for salad.  the lamb was very dry when i tried it and the guy that was cutting the meat stares at people up and down.  just a bunch of very mediocre items presented.  i would not go back again.  waste of my money.  the only good thing was the lady that was serving my table.  she was really sweet.

5pp8mT9e5N6w8ugotCHTfA.text: I came here with a party of 18 for dinner. I think it was 22$ a head and I'm glad I didn't pay because it was disappointing. The waitress did not once fill up our drinks until my boyfriend chased her down (funny she didn't fill his). She was probably happy she knew she was getting 18% gratuity since we were a large party. The food was mediocre at best but nothing stood out. At least there's a nice view of the birds :)

lCc-Nz7iWuKYvITsu8XXEQ.text: Stop four on the buffet of buffets journey.  Pretty decent/averagish buffet. The crab legs were kind of sad looking. The Mac and cheese was tasty. The desert bar is the best yet . The desert bar had a chocolate fountain with strawberries and marshmallows to dip in it.

YYiP3pr4xnIgCTu4UOtlVw.text: There are only 2 things I can recommend about this buffet - the view of the flamingos and koi pond which is just gorgeous and our server who was attentive and friendly. And that's the one star.   Sorry folks, usually I try to find positives, but this one pissed me off. The food was just so sub-par, I'm still astonished anyone goes there. Of course there were a few items that were ok... they were making fresh soft tacos to order (but this was the Mother's Day dinner and at $25.95. which I believe is more than their usual...THIS is it for freshly prepared entrees?!) No crab, no fresh shrimp...sigh...ok the chocolate fountain was good, but the neon green cheesecake weirded me out.    I have to mention decor, because it was just so tired and dated. The presentation of the food was straight out of the 70's. Truly, just keep looking at the lovely garden and animals and don't think about the money you've wasted on your meal.

WxGMoBEyK52Ahxo5H-Ej9w.text: The food was alright but the service was terrible. Its a buffet... your job as a waitress waiting on me isn't too complicated. We paid for the All You Care to Drink option & shenever really came back to check on us even though we could only get our drinks through her. My husband said she literally looked right at us once and turned away. I will review the hotel separately.

4PDHehnN1HHHgSPh6-D64w.text: I am giving this 2 1/2 stars as it has goods and bads. Lets start with the positives: Nice scenery as we were seated next to the Flamingo exhibit. Food was good, not great, but good. Large choice of foods and desserts were yummy. Lets finish with the not so good: Our waitress was horrible. Had to ask 5 times for water and still never got it. Had to ask three times for coffee before getting that.  Its a bit expensive for what it has to offer and the service. $20.00 for a brunch buffet that does not include the champagne just doesn't cut it. Don't think I would try here again.

3b4lPe2Kl6ZnUwixEXLg2g.text: It was a decent buffet. It was comped for me and my husband so I can't complain too much. The salad bar and fruit were really fresh with a lot of variety. The Asian food included fried rice, General Tso's-type chicken, and veggie spring roils which were mediocre to good. There was also fried chicken and a tortilla and quesadilla bar that were pretty good. I looked the chocolate fountain, fresh strawberries, and cotton candy on the dessert bar. If I paid my rating would probably be lower, but for a comp or discount meal it wasn't' too bad. Much better than the Stratosphere buffet IMO.

OqJJVls3XIFKZLEQ1v1ZFQ.text: This deserves a zero star. Went for dinner as I got a groupon.   The food was old and cold. Hardly any variety and it should not be called a buffet. It was looking like lunch left overs. Most of the servers  were old men and women( no offense ) meant. The service was very slow and indecent I would say.  The guy comes with the lemonade and bangs it on the table. When a big group came in he arrange the nearby table which is fine. But he asked and moved our table to the otherwise while we were still eating. Ridiculous!!! They seriously need some sense and training.  Food 0 Service 1 Ambience 2 Cleanliness 2  Will never go back .

TJny8-e3tMvJINWkj7Ls5w.text: The quantity of the Paradise Buffet is the same as the others in Vegas, just the quality doesn't live up.  We went there for Brunch.  Standard stations along with an Asian Station and a chocolate fountain at the dessert bar.  The food overall was mediocre.  The salad bar was decent, and everyone knows that is a cardinal rule about buffets - no salad bar to fill up on.  But there wasn't anything else remotely exciting for me to fill up on.  The breakfast station was pretty empty everytime I went up, they weren't refilling it fresh.  And the buffet itself wasn't even crodwed.  There were a ton of weddings in there - either pre or post parties.  I can't remember if the mimosas were included or additional, but it was a pain to try to get them refilled.  We joked with our server to just leave the bottle so she wouldn't have to keep getting flagged down and she looked mortified.    Eh - go to Spice Market or Rio if you want a good buffet.

E2SaBE8la87A5EUhvQFMQQ.text: This is probably my least favorite of the "Buffet of Buffets", but they earn an extra star because they were open 24 hours while everyone else closed at 10 PM during our visit here over a holiday weekend.  Quality of buffet is just so-so, and at lunch, half of their items were leftovers from breakfast (scrambled eggs, bacon).  The dessert was very nice though, and generally there isn't much of a wait to get into this buffet since it's not as popular.

lzRZW-n0YW75Dxp3n7NDqg.text: It's a worst buffet with poor service. We have gone to other buffets in vegas, this is the worst one we had. Not much varieties. As starters and main course disappointed us we waited for dessert but of not satisfied. I don't suggest if are looking for a good food.

ZOXN6Dlb-YZX9OHgiYHvEg.text: Other than taking 15 minutes to pay with only four people ahead of me, this place was excellent. Good quality of food, and tons of choices to pick from. I had not dined here for a few years and was pleasantly surprised at their quality after reading some of the Yelp reviews. Buffet's in Las Vegas have increased in price quite a bit in recent years and if the food quality if good, it is not a problem.

P_3uOrDitH1lCMLrFL51HA.text: Bad food, mediocre service, terrible selection. Avoid this place. My intestines are still upset at having dinner there last night.  You walk in and is like walking into the 80s, the place looks old, no updates, nothing pleasant to look at. Their roast beef is more like rubber beef. The strip has tons of options, this is not a good one.

0BETQL3JaFWRUPe8zbDrCA.text: While not the worst buffet on the strip, they are actively shooting for that goal.  On a busy weekend, they had 1 of 2 possible hot food sections open, causing a huge backup, taking away one of the benefits of a buffet...get your food and go.  Once we got our food, the quality was found lacking, with quality below that of a "Hometown Buffet" or "Golden Corral".  To add to the disappointment, crowd control was poor, with people waiting for their glacial omlette bar holding up the service line, and management shrugging their shoulders at suggestions to start a line just for omelets.  Also management did nothing to disuade people from eating on line, or using their hands to serve themselves from the buffet.  The only reason this is not a 1 star review, is the service at our table was good, keeping our beverages full.  While this used to be one of our favorite places ue to the view...we will not be back unless there is a huge improvement in this place.

vcMh46d4K6qLIKtuBw-AkA.text: I needed this to be a home run after I dragged our merry band of traveling misfits out of their respective beds for a 7AM wake-up.  It was.  The first thing that hit us was the view out the glass wall into the garden.  Flamingos, koi, hummingbirds, ducks, and other creatures in a lush green setting.  The food was wonderful as well.  Crepe and omelet stations, bacon, pancakes and french toast, various pastries.  YUM!!

iY6LUhh1-fzs4seTAjSgMA.text: I paid $17.99 per person for lunch buffet at 11:30AM. There was no line like other buffet  at the Stripe. There were only three people ahead of us.  There were some nice salads, cold shrimps,great for people who avoid oily food, also tow  decent soups. However, there were only four types of sushi, of low quality. About 20 hot dishes, average in quality, roast beef was chewy. A counter for people to make own tacos. Strangely, there were no counter for cake or sweet or ice cream at all. This buffet is the one I have with the least selection. The only way to justify $17.99 is for those foreign tourists who used to expensive price at home. I would not return to this buffet.

qYgcm5SmxKk54e_kjb9pjQ.text: Never, never again!!  First of all... The only reason why I came to this buffet was for convienence I was staying at Bally's and it was just one hotel over.    The food, sucks!  I was there on a Saturday for their lunch brunch and the selections sucked!!  There was not one good thing to eat.  The food was disgusting.    One positive thing... The dessert's were good.    DONT COME HERE.  TOTALLY NOT WORTH THE MONEY!!

fzE7Zphc3xF-pNwoE7iT0A.text: This buffet was disappointing and I feel silly for even attempting to try the breakfast after the dinner was so "so-so."  I am not a picky eater but the pasta salad was not very good, the made to order pasta tasted worse than something from a chain buffet restaurant.  The prime rib wasn't bad and the desserts (chocolate fountain and ice cream) were good.  However, who has a chocolate fountain and has cantaloupe and melon and no strawberries?  The cheese potatoes were cold and not very good.  For breakfast, the eggs were watery, the omelet flavorless, and the bacon was really salty.  The waffles were pretty good.  We had a two-for-one, but even with that, it doesn't seem worth it (I mean I guess if you are desperate but definitely not worth full price!!)...not after you see what other buffets are like.  I guess it was our fault for going back.  The options were just so basic and limited and the price was not that much different from other buffets.  I have been to MGM, Rio, Aria (heck even a buffet in Palm Springs that I went to had more options that this!).  There was only about two rows of food and everything tasted "off" to me.  The waiter at dinner was also not very friendly and would stand around and do nothing while we had dirty plates on our table.  We went there because we were staying at the hotel and it seemed like you'd spend just as much money eating at the nearby cafe.  Maybe that would have been smarter, though, because this buffet is definitely not worth the money.  Go right outside and try some place on the Linq if you are starving and want something close by.

M-ctaEx3574kcJwh6mFDNg.text: Don't believe the hype. The bad reviews for the Flamingo buffet are unjustified, at least concerning dinner. I ate at the Paris buffet last night, and despite the latter's fancier atmosphere they are both on the same quality.  The food was good buffet food. There was  a nice vegetarian variety, and tasty desserts. Top marks for the delicious guacamole and strawberries + chocolate fountain!  The service was impeccable. My drink waited for me on the table when I came back from my first buffet round. The empty plates were cleared in good time and I was offered drink refills.  All in all I had a great dinner at this buffet, and would definitely come again.

8IIoG6U3CBtNekEFopoNCQ.text: I came here for one meal because I bought the Buffet of Buffets, was staying at the Flamingo, and was too lazy to go somewhere else.    The food selection was awful and there was a larger selection of desserts than there was of actual food.  There were almost no people in the buffet (which says a lot about whether it is any good).    The food wasn't very good and the service sucked.  If you, like me, are too lazy to go elsewhere, know that you aren't going to get great food.  A better bet is to go to the Paris buffet that is significantly nicer.

1mtvbSUZNjslBY0KlbtE5Q.text: 4 stars for their Champagne brunch, 2 stars for their mid-week breakfast offerings giving a 3 star average for my most recent trip.  The Flamingo is one of the buffet of buffets (24 hour buffet pass at 7 of the 8 Caesar's buffets) options and I think a very smart choice on weekends because they include the champagne in the pass while others charge you an additional fee to add on the champagne.  The offerings on the weekend are vast and change slightly as the morning progresses with breakfast items being replace by lunchier items.  During the week, they close down the back half of the buffet and the selection pretty much sucks.  They've also really cut back on their staffing levels --- servers are acting as bussers in many cases and this has definitely decreased the total level of once very prompt table service.  Bottom line:  buy the pass on the weekend, get yourself tipsy and avoid during the week.

bQJyr1kiHVWCQq0bQttTPw.text: I really wish I didn't wait so long between eating somewhere and writing reviews because now my memory is bad.  'm on vacation for 2 weeks, so I can try to play some catch up.  When my parents are in Las Vegas, we like to visit a different buffet every day.  What can I say?  We like to eat.  The fact that I don't remember anything from this place must mean that it is mediocre, nothing good to remember about it, but nothing terrible to remember about either.  I'm sure I left stuffed, as usual, because that's what buffets tend to do.    Maybe the next time I come back, I can write a review relatively soon after the meal and I can be more detailed.  For now, this will have to do.

vXHqKB_xDh51mIQKo5R5JA.text: The only thing that I enjoyed here was their dessert table.  The food was only so so and being that it is one of the cheaper buffets on the Las Vegas strip, even the price wasn't worth the food that was available.

NvWM8YgUza5kWfedtFpzVQ.text: I had time before their show so decided to try their buffet. It was Thursday night and there was no line, surprisingly. Server showed me my seat and put a play card on table so I can remember was location, thought it was funny because I was the only person in that section. Went straight to roast beef, it was barely tasty, very rare at mid section. Tried sushi, tasted terrible. I do not eat pork and there were many pork dishes. So I tried Asian kitchen and had some Chinese. It was okay. There was seafood section but I skipped it. Also, I had to find my server to get refill. Thankfully she was around when I needed my tea. Best part was dessert. They had no sugar section which I skipped. Mini desserts were delicious. Tried carrot cake, creme brulee, cheese cake, chocolate fountain twice. It was okay for $25. May not repeat.

fLw0V8afWTKvg6mIGTthXA.text: Horrible. We remember it being bad, but we figured it had been a while, we'll try it again. No, our mistake. We had the buffet pass and it was late. We were having a late dinner. It was pretty bare bones for customers. The food was gross, old, picked over. It was sad. It was gross. Never again. Do not waste your money or your time. Also, we are not big people but the booths are small and crammed together. The booths that are made for 2 and tightly jammed in there. Maybe that's why we couldn't eat...we had a table jammed into our stomachs. Yeah, that's it.....

94wKOpdKAqW9s339-8Lrtw.text: I'll make this simple.  NO.  Even though it's part of the Buffet of Buffets, it's just not worth your time or effort to come here.  Come only if you're running out of time (like at the 23rd hour and 55th minute of your BoB pass) and you need to go to one of the buffets and you're stuck in the area.  The food selection is VERY limited.  The food quality is mediocre.  The only edible hot item was the roasted chicken.  Tasty and soft.  DON'T try the "sushi" section.  Hell, it's not even sushi.  It's just lame ass fake crab rolls and stale salmon & tuna rolls.  The service is crap here as well.  Our waitress disappeared for a period of time and we were in a hurry to get to our next buffet so this was a no-no.  One plus, I suppose is that you can look at the flamingo garden from inside the dining area.  Yay.

5Zk6DnXhhVh7XXYaeNyDAw.text: the buffet of buffets for $40 is a good deal for 24hrs of unlimited buffets across 7 different properties, we ate here mainly  what you would expect, prime rib, shrimp, crab legs, etc  good quality and taste for the $$

nusy6MdRZz52GFy3BvuVtw.text: We went to this buffet because we had coupons for a free show ticket  to Nathan Burton's Comedy Magic Show, if we purchased a meal. When we got there the lady said the coupon was wrong and it was actually buy a show ticket and get a free buffet! WTF!!   False advertising I'd say. We walked so far just to get here and were so hungry so we just decided to eat here.  I regret every paying for the buffet... the food was very limited and not good at all! The dessert section was surprisingly bigger than the whole hot foods section, but disgusting desserts!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flamingos outside
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. outdoors
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old Casino

exx_gMIJiSldozvjluZXnA.text: This is the worst buffet I've ever had. We paid $25 per person because we came in around noon. They said its Sunday brunch price. Shrimp needed to be peeled and small, it was terrible! Crab legs were tiny, what a joke of a buffet. Dont eat here unless it under $10. Coffee was really bad. I had better fried chicken at Hometown buffet.

1_ggkDoem9nu-FmRz3Zx8Q.text: Checked out their buffet for breakfast. Made to order omelettes, crepes and french toast. Their waffles were made into playing card symbols. Other than that it's your typical breakfast foods. They had fried chicken which was delicious. Make sure to ask to be seated next to their garden for an amazing view. Their dessert was kind of hidden off to the side. Had to snag a few soft peanut butter cookies myself!

H9GfdEFDafgnwggMcQ_22Q.text: When you're in Vegas, this is an excellent place to start your day.  The breakfast buffet has a wide offering of expected fare and for a really good price.  It's a nice place to relax with your friends, recap the night before & plan your next day.  Keep in mind there are 3 "sections."  Typically the first & third have the same offering, but now always.  Last time I was there, the third actually had was dedicated to Chinese food.  The center section is packed with delicious deserts.   I know, you don't usually think about desert after breakfast, but this is Vegas, so why not?  If you request it, they'll leave a pitcher of soda or coffee at your table (to save you from having to request refills).    Even though it's a buffet, remember to tip take care of your waitress.  If just dropped a few hundred on craps last night, surely you can afford to leave more than a buck.

IWeGcc_c3j7iGofWZFviBg.text: The dinner buffet is $19.99 compared to $35 or so at places such as Wynn or Paris.   You get what you pay for.  Now, it wasn't all bad. They had a better sushi selection than other buffets we have been to on the Strip, including Wynn. Their dessert selection was fabulous, including a chocolate fountain with strawberries, canteloupe, marshmallows, rice krispie treats etc. Plus they had dipped marshmallows, cake pops, apple cobbler, crepes and cakes and pies. And cotton candy. Honestly, the best dessert selection of a buffet that I have been to.  I wasn't impressed with the main selections, though. The mashed potatoes were good and the salad bar was adequate (including a tasty crab salad I had seconds of and peel and eat shrimp), but the Italian and Asian selections weren't too tasty and the prime rib was a little overdone and tough.   I won't go back, simply because there are so many other places to try, but after a long day on our feet and not wanting to stray from our hotel it served its purpose. Also, the service was great. That should get some mention.

EMicqIRzNvXMTMz8HIeqXg.text: Food wasn't even hot...one of the worst buffets I've been to.  The only thing I liked about this buffet was the chocolate fountain where you can make your own chocolate dipped strawberries.  Besides that, the food was eh and below average.  If you have a choice, please do yourself a favor and try a different buffet.    The only good thing is that there's really no wait and you get a nice view of the beautiful flamingos outside.

VPoWExEoKSB_9qPhC8DLQA.text: We ate at this buffet for breakfast and thought it was great. We waited about 15 minutes in line to be seated which wasn't bad.   The spread was pretty good. They had your typical breakfast food but also had some stuff that I wasn't expecting to see like eggs bennedict, which was delicious by the way.   The service was a little shoddy but I wasn't expecting much from a buffet.

pK6VOLBAZHrjIDBQZzK3Uw.text: This buffet was right off the elevators to our hotel so it was very convenient to eat at least once.  The price point was right between the high end Bellagio type buffets and  the cheap circus circus buffets which reflected the type of food quality we got.  They had the usual food choices compared every other buffet around and it was all pretty tasty. The dessert section was impressive with delish made to order crepes. A good place to go once  if your staying here or in a close by hotel.

Svb4rbps0suQarc8e24kCw.text: The food are terrible, and I can find much more better buffet nearby at the same price.  Its only worth $10, but they actually charge $30 + tips for dinner. Try to avoid this place.

wj5RXVdyqbsI7NiJ_n5Uvw.text: I came here for breakfast on the day of departure from my last trip.  I had a Buy One Get One coupon from Las Vegas Perks.  Thankfully I did.  $14.99 for breakfast (Stupid Strip prices.  If I was paying full price I would just drive to Gold Coast for their cheap yet simliar buffet).  The furniture is worn out here, the service lacks and the breakfast selection is on par with most low-tier buffets.  (Cold eggs, greasy bacon that you can put on the soles of your shoes and skate through the lobby in, bad pastries.)  The only things I seemed to like was the view of the Flamingo Habitat and the Rice Crispie Treats they had.    If I could, I'd leave a 2.5.  Unfortunately, I need to round up or down and I'll round up since I paid $14.99 for two people.  Do not pay full price for this buffet or have high expectations.  You will be severely let down.

2bBsZI96hoVKtGAvA3_CaA.text: This buffet just sucks. Who advertises all you can eat crab legs and then only serves them cold with no butter. Says they close at 10 then we arrive at 8:30 and were typed they were closing at 9:30 with a line still out the door. Stupid management move. Then to top it off once inside huge line of people waiting for them to bring the food out. Sometimes the cheap comes out expensive.

iQYLk1W6QzyEV3H--v0dbw.text: This review is for the "Buffet of Buffets" 24 hour, all you can eat, buffet pass. This magical pass allows you to enjoy all day access to the buffets at 7 different Harrah's properties. The price is $39.99 for Rewards Club members and $45.99 for non-members. It is seriously easy to sign up for the pass and worth the $5 savings. The best day to buy the pass is Sunday because the brunch buffets include the booze free of charge. Also, remember to check the operating hours at each buffet because they do vary.  Note: We did all seven locations (actually 8 buffets because we hit one twice) back to back in 11 hours.  The buffets included in the deal are: Le Village Buffet inside Paris, Planet Hollywood's Spice Market Buffet, Flamingo's Paradise Garden Buffet, Flavors at Harrah's, Lago Buffet at Caesars, the Emperor's Buffet at Imperial Palace and Rio's Carnival World Buffet!  We started our 24 hour eating adventure at 7:52 Sunday morning at the Flamingo.  Paradise Garden Buffett- Decent breakfast selection including a carving station with prime rib and ham. Warning, don't piss off the man carving the prime rib because he has sharp knives and a short temper...just sayin'. They also have cotton candy and a chocolate fountain in the dessert section which is fun, even at 8 o'clock in the morning.   We made a second stop here at noon, which is when the Sunday brunch starts and your first bloody mary is free. They give you an airplane bottle of vodka at the cashier and you are able to visit the nicely appointed "make your own bloody mary bar." Note, each additional airplane bottle of vodka will cost you $3. My suggestion is to bring a flask. Also, champagne is included with brunch.  Overall, the food is pretty average here. Breakfast service was robotic, and the psychotic man at the carving station has a short temper and sharp knives so beware. Just don't ask for a more rare piece of prime rib and you should be fine. The service at brunch was awesome!

CthcvYVR_exDMbq8HwTF5Q.text: This buffet is not quite as huge as Rio but it's still is a  pretty big place with three huge sections, two sections with different specialties (i.e. one Italian, Mexican, and the other with Asian, American, etc.), both with an all you can eat Prime Rib and delicious, fresh Crab Legs, Shrimp.  The middle section is filled with all kinds of desserts, cakes, cheesecake, cookies, ice cream with toppings, cotton candy, and make your own crepes.   Taste-wise, this buffet is excellent, they had some Dim Sum when I went a week ago and it was delicious, the Alfredo Pasta was great as well.  Bottom line:  Been going here for years and would come back again, especially since this buffet is part of that 24 hour Buffet Pass Deal.

5aGUSCEFjlALAJHR4iHgDg.text: We went to the champagne buffet. Food was ok, and they kept the champagne flowing so that was nice. But buffet good doesn't really go with buffet food so we didn't have as much as I thought we would. Tip: join their membership for free to get a $1 off the buffet.

NP63x7zgLA1ZJXS85nMAdA.text: OMG! this has to be the worst of the worst buffet I have ever seen and tasted in my entire life! we the ( public) should shut that pathetic, ugly, filthy and horrible place down not wait for the Health Dept. to do so!  we were there yesterday and you can tell that place is dirty from the hostess stand, as I walked to the buffet, right away I knew this was gonna be a very bad experience. first of all you can tell easily the food on display is few days old and not looking fresh at all from the salad bar to the hot food, and there was no food labels for each item and I had a question for the chef who happened to be standing there to find out what kind of soup that was and believe it or not he didn't know and started to guess! so I asked for the manager, when she came she was very unfriendly, so I told her that I wanted to know the ingredients in the soup since I have some allergies to some meat products! so she looked in the soup and then she started to stir it and after that she grabbed a spoon from near by and took a sip right from the soup pot in the middle of the buffet! I was in shock!! and then she came to a conclusion that was a vegetable soup which I doubted and there comes another staff member from the kitchen and said oh this has some chicken breast!! at that moment I just walked away from that spot simply because I didn't want to commit a crime. this place is simply a shame, it shouldn't be in Vegas the city of great food and entertainment! I really believe third world countries have way better quality and cleaner food than that, and imagine what kind of staff they hire if they don't even know what they're preparing for guests! and not to mention that the food has no flavor whatsoever. not only if they invite me there for free but even if they offer me $$$ I will not step into that dump ever again in  my life, and by the way I am a big Vegas fan which I go there at least half a dozen times a year.

bv2a2YmIqU7xgLU_mn1yKw.text: Las Vegas is a town that is known for it's buffets, and I'm sorry to say that just about any of them would be a better choice than the Paradise Garden Dinner Buffet.   Located in the flamingo, the buffet offers most of the standard buffet fare - Crab Legs, Sushi, Prime Rib, Orange Chicken, Fried Rice, etc. It's just that none of these selections are very good.  On 2nd thought, the Crab legs were pretty tasty - unfortunately I spent 20 minutes trying to crack open the meat since they didn't offer shell crackers.   Someone below commented that the food selections were often mis-labeled, and in some cases not labeled at all. This was a pet peeve of mine as well. It's actually sad how many times I had to examine something more closely, only to walk away empty handed because I wasn't exactly sure what it was!  The servers were friendly, but the attitudes of the chefs seemed disgruntled, as if my request to cut a slice of meat was an inconvenience. The whole experience was underwhelming, which would have been understandable if this were a $7.95 buffet at the Palace Station. But for $20/person in a strip casino, I expect a little bit better.   My advice, spend the extra $10 person and go to the Wynn/Bellagio/Mandalay or any of the other awesome buffets located in the vicinity.

hrjKuezIemkckwhsF18HAA.text: At most buffets I at least leave feeling full, unfortunately I can't say the same for this one.  While there is a large quantity of different food options, the quality makes many of those options inedible.  There were a few different things that I was able to eat but for the most part I filled up on the desserts and not the actual food.

kvVFur9E9DPZNUuVv3XABA.text: With all of the other buffets in Vegas you can certainly skip this one. We were just starving and didn't feel like wandering around looking for one so we settled for the Paradise Garden Buffet. It was much more expensive than some other buffets... probably because they offer king crab legs and other seafood items. I tried so much at this buffet and ended up with horrible stomach pains. I don't know if the food was sitting out there too long or what.   I am a dessert fanatic and I did enjoy the dessert buffet. But other than that, hit up the Bellagio or Paris buffet instead!

bmNpM_cJJsh6xKrB5NsyCw.text: Stayed at the Flamingo, and the Wife and I ate breakfast here every morning, mostly because we were too starving/lazy to haul our butts elsewhere.  The breakfast buffet was fine. All the usual suspects were offered, and it was all fresh and tasty. The made to order omlettes were nice. We used 2-for-1 coupons everyday, but we still thought it was a bit pricey for breakfast. Of course, you can get your money's worth by stuffing yourself silly. I think I set a bacon consumption record while I was there.  Two less than thrilling points:   * Sitting by the windows gives you a great view of the flamingo habitat. Unfortunately, we  were told they were reserved for "Gold Members". WTF? They were empty! You still have an okay view though.  * My BIG tip: When a server comes to offer drinks, order a couple! They don't swing by too often.  I'm sure there are better buffets around town, but as I said, we were lazy.

CVOtGqhIYP3sFo6UJkSPmw.text: I had brunch here, and it had all the same food as the other buffets still. One thing to note, they did have a chocolate fountain that you could make your own fondue out of, which was really pretty cool. I would probably visit them just for that, but the rest of the food was despite too. However, they had the least variety out of all the other buffets that I went to on the strip.

f2x0gcbUyCIpwG2ozymREw.text: I hate buffets. Why do I start that as my first sentence? Why do I even bother writing a review on a type of restaurant I do not care for? Well, it's BECAUSE of buffets like this that I hate them. Limited selection, mediocre and cheap. Paid $15.99 for lunch and I had no idea what I was eating. Why? Nothing was labeled. I spent most my time opening the heat containers and figuring what was what than eating. Egg rolls weren't bad and they had cotton candy. What I liked most was sitting at my table and watching the Chilean Flamingo area and Koi fish. Oh and the ducks and swans were pretty entertaining, too.

6t8hxKhKKYWRWwtGjhnY7g.text: 2.5 stars.  The sushi here is actually better than at the Bellagio Buffet, if you can believe that.  Food's so-so. We got in for cheap because we had tickets to a comedy/magic show that included the buffet all for $25. They normally charge $22 alone for the buffet at dinner.   There was crab legs (by the beef, not where I expected to find it), crayfish, shrimp, salad bar, fruit.  The entrees were not so great, but the fried shrimp was pretty good. They were pretty nice about giving me a huge pot of water for my tea bag, better than the Bellagio in that respect.  Desserts were not as good as the Bellagio, but they do have someone making you fresh fruit crepes which hubby says the strawberries in his didn't taste good.  The coconut macaroons were very good.  If you don't mind splurging and waiting an hour in line, the Bellagio is better but if you're on a budget, the Flamingo will suffice just to keep your tummy fed.

_CeJ_PKBRIhbpIE-MpOyog.text: Richard Pro here with another review.  I enjoy coming to Flamingo for brunch. This is the only buffet on the strip with enormous windows, and the interior is very bright and welcoming. Ceilings are high, tables and booths are clean. Service is not fantastic--a bunch of tired old ladies serve you.   As breakfast goes, Flamingo is mediocre but it'll do the job. Prices here are lower compared to, say, Mandalay Bay or Bellagio.  3 stars. If you want a breakfast buffet in Vegas that tastes okay and has a great view, I recommend Flamingo. I do make a stop here for brunch every year when I come to Vegas. Afterwards you can take a stroll out back to look at the flamingoes and the fish in a very natural and beautiful habitat. They used to have penguins too, an exhibit I would watch for hours.

EovnpKj81on3GKDTQugSpg.text: Very laid back place. My wife and I went for breakfast very good and continental. Great views and very great customer service.

C0M-xQPcf0KAC3co7DsapA.text: Ive been here for breakfast and I've been here for dinner. It was OK Nothing memorable

EJBWmVQ7gLTPARoeSZqtog.text: This was our 3rd and final stop on our buffet of buffets adventure. We dined here for dinner and definitely won't be back. I have eaten here once before and did not remember the buffet being so boring and the food so tasteless. The best part was the service and sitting by the window near the water and flamingos.   I don't really feel I need to get specific but the food was all just okay. I took just one bite of many items because nothing was worth finishing. The desserts I tried however were good. The apple crisp was especially nice. They also have a chocolate fountain but it is kind of difficult to use since there is a large plastic guard around it with one tiny area for access to coat your dessert with chocolate. Bananas were virtually impossible to dip. They did have a crepe station but we did not try it.   We went here because we heard they had a Chinese station but it was closed when we dined on a Monday night.   This place is only worth dessert as far as I'm concerned.  Ask if you can look at what they have available before you pay to dine.

Da3GlGosc9YyeYhQmg_43w.text: So my boyfriend and I went to Vegas and decided to eat at the Paradise Garden Buffet because I heard they had great crab legs.  There's only 3 registers so it takes awhile to be able to pay and then you need to wait in another line to be sat.  Most employees here are a bit older, but are really sweet. The service was pretty good, I always had my drinks refilled. When I asked for hot sauce, the lady came out with 4 which I really appreciate. The food was definitely Americanized, and I don't think it was that great but for 20 bucks, I got ribs, orange chicken, and crab legs. They also split the crab legs for you so it's easier to eat. I liked the dessert mainly because they had chocolate fondue and my boyfriend got himself a crepe which was great. I just didn't enjoy the food all that much. The pad thai was very much americanized and the rice wasn't cooked well enough. But for $20, I left very full and satisfied!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e66eFFUWzEHZ13k9HOYDtw.text: Yes, I ate here only because I wanted to watch the flamingos outside the window.  The food was NOT GOOD.  One of the worst buffets ever.  Not even that cheap, actually overpriced for what it is.  Food was luke warm, not very many choices, and just tasted bad (I went for lunch).  The buffet at Orleans is cheaper, larger, and SIGNIFICANTLY better.

5L9Zc4BtINzA2ayb-FE4Eg.text: My husband and I recently went to this buffet while in Vegas on vacation.  I wouldn't recommend this buffet to anyone - most of the food looked dried out and like it had been sitting out for too long, although the desserts looked okay and the crepes bar was a nice touch.  The food was was average at best, but the worst part of our meal was when my husband bit into a piece of chicken and it was still raw in the middle.  Not just pink, but literally oozing bloody chicken juice!  We complained to the server and she removed the plate and then returned to our table to say that they checked the temperature on the chicken and decided to remove the tray.  Not that we were expecting any compensation, but an apology or a visit from a manager would have been nice, considering how sick a person can get from uncooked chicken.  My husband spent the rest of the night feeling ill, and it really put a damper on our last evening of vacation.  My advice? Steer clear of this buffet, there are many better places to eat in Vegas.

krGqSJ3Ynz70DVnM71jQzQ.text: I feel like the Flamingo could do better, much better, with their buffet.  The whole dining area could use an upgrade.  It just seems kind of worn out and tired.  The food is bland, the staff seems bored, and it's just...well, it's tired like I said.  Nonetheless, I felt like a majority of their effort goes into the dessert selections.  Either that or I just get excited seeing a whole bunch of desserts since I try not to indulge that often.  Pretty standard issue foods otherwise: a few sushi selections (including veggie rolls?), some Asian fair, taco bar, a variety of meat and seafood, potatoes, and rolls.  Lunch buffet was $16.99 and you can tack on $9.99 for unlimited mimosas, wine, Bloody Mary's, and beer if you'd like.  Service isn't bad and drinks are refilled often and quickly.  I would probably rather enjoy a different buffet next time but as I usually always stay at the Flamingo, I had to try it out at least once.

8RaPE6nE1HwT1-n-Y_BBVA.text: Total and complete dump.  Bad food and bad surroundings.  The decent servers and chefs are what make me feel bad about the rating, but I'm all about the food.

VtSwT9B4WWOBvD9_TYHQYQ.text: It was eh ok.  The food could be better... I will be going to the Wynn now.

NoOHs2ZjmBK3NdCnTAImNw.text: Oh boy, I have had some pretty bad buffets in Las Vegas, but this one is without a doubt, the worst. That includes Sahara, Imperial Palace and Cirucs circus. This buffet's claim to fame is that "every night is crab and prime rib night!" It's True, but they forgot to put that the crab meat is salty and cold and served without butter and that the prime rib is fatty and gross. Usually at a buffet I try just a tiny bit of anything that intrigues me, and that absolutely gorge on whatever I liked. Here, there was NOTHING that I wanted any more of. Hell, I didn't even finish the tiny bits I put on my plate. To top it off, it costs $23 plus tax. On the low average for dinner buffets in vegas, but not even close to being worth it. You couldn't pay me to eat here again. By the way, I didn't like it and everything was gross.

ykPFD4Z0Qdm7h0kg5p_qDQ.text: i should have listened to the people who gave reviews here.i thought they were just bitching.made a huge mistake.went there sunday night before the christmas.the worst buffet i have ever eaten and the worst looking buffet place in vegas strip.it looks like a ghetto buffet located in ghetto area.the cost just simply doesnt justify this place at all no matter how u compute it.this buffet place is nothing more than old country buffet plus little bit of sea food.*note that i said little.paid little over $80 total for 3people.i wouldnt even eat there for free of charge had i known this place was this bad. anybody who said they liked this place need to have their heads examined.they barely had any food left,much less they barely had any variety of food to begin with.trust me on this n save your money.take your chance on other buffet place in vegas strip because this one should not even exist in vegas.

8h1iThBAhfgaAOSoDnxRlg.text: No. Do not eat here. Probably the worst buffet ever at a Las Vegas hotel for the money you pay. They don't even have a buffet worth selection of foods. Just a couple things here and there. This wasn't a buffet, it was food already chosen for your meal that you get up and go get yourself. Avoid the Donnie and Marie dolls in the gift shop on your way there because I think they're cursed.

sU3IFNxx049RFyWHQIHJew.text: Old yet classy. This is a good buffet if you're hungry.   The last time I was here I damn near kicked the bucket as I didn't realize that the horseradish was extremely spicy and I had plopped it into my prime rib...   The service was good as I sat in the diamond lounge and enjoyed the complimentary champagne.  However there wasn't much selection.   I noticed that after consolidation of the Caesars Branded hotels, most of the buffets started to offer the same selection at the same prices. So nothing was ever again amazing.  With the 25 hour deals where you pay up front you can enjoy any of their buffets- which seems like a deal but seriously isn't worth it when the lines get busy.   I never had to wait though based on my player status but still, I felt bad for those who did.  What was great though was I was able to pay for my meals and my wife's via comps, so this was a great option instead of fine dining lol.

07OEDWhIgWRQ6xwAul7L9w.text: Paradise Garden Buffet was OK. It's not the freshest out of the bunch. Some examples are the cantaloupe, peaches, pears, cucumbers, and tomatoes. Poor little things. =( I did enjoy the rack of bananas and dried fruit. Loved the chickpeas at the salad bar! Not too shabby, to be honest. It's just not the best. It'll keep your belly full at least without spending too much.   What I liked about this buffet were the employees. They were kind and nice. Our waiter was helpful and oh-so-adorable! She kept asking how we were doing and refilled our waters when possible. She was very attentive. I even dropped my water bottle cap on the floor, and she asked me if I wanted it washed. I just want to give her a hug. She's too sweet. :)   Sooo, the service was pleasant. I'm not sure if I would come back here anytime soon, since there are so many food places to explore in Vegas!

Apzb2BuoDHdSA1X0tJO-Ew.text: Came here with a groupon and definitely worth it! However if paying full price I'm not sure I would've enjoyed it! Food was ok, crepe station was nice!

TEgEiaNkkh_ZJzCJWbG4Cw.text: We went for both Breakfast and Friday night "seafood"  Breakfast was ok waitress only came to table when we flagged her down repeatedly.  Food was acceptable but have had much better.  Much of the food was warm at best.   Friday night Seafood buffet = cold crab legs, lobster mac and cheese (no lobster meat).  All food was tasteless and warm at best.  Dessert was nothing special.  Had groupon for $44.00 for two I am glad I did not pay more.  Waitress was a little better still had to flag her down to get anything.  FYI beer glass must be empty for them to bring a refill. Sangria served in a plastic cup. Bottom line much better places in Vegas and most likely in your home town.

D1mg0WhhrhovTVHhH38MoA.text: We stayed at Fremont on our last trip and ended up eating at paradise buffet twice while we were there.  The couple we went with wanted to eat cheap so we agreed to go to paradise with them.  All in all it wasn't terrible.  Both times there was no line the food was ok and it seemed clean.  It doesn't come close to the other buffets in Vegas but it's also half the price.  I'd recommend it if you are starving and want just basic food.  We may return...

9Ir0XnB1fvxeMvAr-ezUnw.text: The food was hit or miss.. tacos, sopas, prime rib were bomb. the seafood was getting eaten up like crazy so must've been good. The dessert was like any other buffet, mediocre.   but the SERVICE WAS BAD. overheard a couple customers complaining to the manager about the waitresses taking forever to refill drinks. ( dinner had unlimited beer, wine, sangria. they only had coors light beer.) probably why they were taking so long so people don't go crazy.   Our waitress was already cleaning up our table telling us bye before we even left and she never came back to refill drinks or check on us.   ** if you're using a groupon voucher with line pass, get in the short line to pay. looks just its just for VIP members but you can go there. save you about 20 min wait in line.**

Pyes5fiyMmtuDtrJSnrVdg.text: Scenic view only if you are fortunate enough to get a table near the window. Wait time can be very long - the Flamingo has done nothing to organize the line so it obstructs the lobby walkway. Average buffet food quality at an elevated price. Overall cleanliness is okay. Don't go unless you get a great deal.  Filling a to-go box gets you more bang for your buck.

n7R44NFVH13YNQMi4cxoIQ.text: Came here with visiting family, 5 in our party for the brunch on a Monday afternoon.  No lines, no wait.  They charged me 21.99 plus tax for my 11 yr old son who was considered adult price, 9 and under is kids price.  The best thing was the garden area that you could visit right outside the dining area, lots of light from the glass windows too, however beware that once you go outside, the doors lock and you cannot get back inside without going all the way around to the front of the buffet again.  The food was OK, but the selection was limited and not impressive.  Desserts were attractive and photo worthy.  Servers were nice, but you're paying for the ambience, not the food quality.
