K46dMHm1N4jrulQQh4fiYw.text: This buffet did not live up to the quality food like other buffet in Vegas.   When you come in... you already see, they don't have much variety of option. It's the basic. The environment doesn't feel cozy like you are about to eat something good.   Sushi was not handmade. Salad was over dressed. Meat was under cooked. Dessert was alright.   I wouldn't want to come back.   Staff was helpful.

8l1oWtEfUpULwlx8-LHgQw.text: INSIDE THE FLAMINGO HOTEL. BREAKFAST BUFFET REVIEW ONLY.   Breakfast buffet after a long sleepless night of being up (and not for gambling, the clubs, or partying), why not? Customers and patrons of the Flamingo hotel and player's card members get a discount and shorter lines.   Breakfast buffet was average. Wasn't bad wasn't exceptional either. It hit the spot and wasn't too expensive. I liked the omelet bar and corned beef hash (the two items that left a lasting memory). :)  Good service and free mimosas with the players card on Sundays!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meats.
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood for breakfast? Why not!

fBFhoQQhtdq6xm6WOcPP4Q.text: The food is decent, but I've been there twice and the service isn't great with the "bottomless" drinks. Both times, we felt like we were being pushed out the door after 2 8 oz weak drinks.

WV0w56blNwUMlRC2eht2tw.text: Yesterday I gave this buffet a five star because the food was excellent! Today 2 stars is what they get. undercooked omelets and the chef making them didn't care. Manager refunded my check.   Will not be coming back.

AZHT8GajbsQyqSO3TXVMJQ.text: Being an occasional poker player, I was in need of a way to waste my rewards and I thought I should take a friend to this buffet. The bad reviews are surprising because this buffet is actually one of the cheapest on the strip with the best atmosphere.  This buffet is located inside the Flamingo hotel on the strip and you can park at their parking lot for a fee.   The greatest thing about this place is definitely the view. You can sit right by the flamingos, ducks, etc... making your dining experience pretty unique on the strip. Also, this buffet comes with alcohol included which is pretty rare. That only makes it worth the price whether you plan on drinking champagne in the morning or wine at night.  The food is good for a buffet without being exceptional but you do have the option of ordering burritos, quesadillas and crepes which is a nice addition.  In conclusion, I would say that this place is one of the best buffets on the strip mainly because of the views and because of its great quality/price ratio when you compare it to other buffets such as the Bellagio's or the one at Caesar's. Feel free to message me for any additional details that you may need!

8lMdUrpTMnPR2_V23i_LDw.text: I came her for breakfast on a Friday morning and paid $19.99 per. I was a little hesitant due to the reviews and the ratings on Yelp, but I got my money's worth.  Their eggs Benedict were warm, not cold. Maybe it's because I went super early, but idk why people were complaining that theirs were cold. The only thing is that the hollandaise sauce was sour.  Overall they met all my breakfast cravings from toast, pancakes, French toast, sausage, bacon, and omelettes and other yummy items.  The $19.99 comes with all you can drink mimosa and other drinks, so I mean it's pretty great.  Overall, service was great.

KkXOVETVza_BKKrA_nsSrg.text: I was very excited to try this place  Then I saw  the selection,was not satisfied. Please don't come to work and single out the gay couple.  It just shows  how much of an ass you are * I'm referencing to our waiter, she was nice to the whole dam world except us.*    The mimosas where served in a solo cup .   The food was good don't get me wrong, the selection was just underwhelming  ..

20VETEJ0WnYNJ4_ljj78CQ.text: Paradise Buffet very outdated really need to update and remodel! Quality of food on a scale of 1 to 10 I would give them a 5 service also at 5, will not be back definitely do not recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Champagne and orange juice should be in a champagne glass not a plastic cup
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Need to clean out the pond very dirty and filthy

TefIbHveQneifguHMCYHvA.text: I was really happy with this buffet.  They have a Groupon for $16 each and you get unlimited mimosas & the buffet. I thought the food was really good and they had a great variety.

pwl3WvDjKlibHu9gJ_Yhgw.text: I am not a buffet person but we were in a hurry and gave it a shot.    There is a nice variety of food, but as in most buffets, everything is cold.    Unless you had eggs made to order, all was cold.   I love eggs Benedict, but the English muffin was so hard I couldn't cut it with a knife. I ended up eating wings and pizza and they were actually warm and good.   Not the healthiest breakfast, but it worked for me.  There are loads of desserts and they make crepes fresh.  I had the cherry pie and it was very good.  Service was very attentive and atmosphere was nice and clean.  Unlimited bloody Mary's and mimosas made this a popular place for many people.  We didn't indulge.   Not likely to return, but only because buffets serve cold food and I am a hot food fanatic.

zdo4W44vzlDf9BPNdOTjIg.text: The wait at this place is ridiculous. Honestly, the place was only half full but we ended up waiting for 30 minutes because the cashiers are a major bottleneck. Even the hosts agreed with us because they were waiting to sit people down.  The food is below average at best. There are so many other places on the Strip you could go to for better options.

h4SCphsrl_UtDf1zGL3M9w.text: We waited about 30 minutes to be seated. The food seriously isn't good. We paid 25 dollars a person for the brunch here. The selection is pretty small. Nothing that makes a Las Vegas buffet. I wouldn't come back, there are so many better places to try in Las Vegas.

8hnEemCLdCrna58k3aKFlg.text: Plenty of desert options. Food is average but the ambience is amazing! Service is quick and friendly.

lLSyU6ld5i4IdUjN16l-hA.text: This buffet was our first stop on our buffet of buffets pass. I was impressed with the selection though small. The food was fresh and delicious and the service was great. I would definitely eat here again.

6re19svDEZ1DldI3a1kzKQ.text: There must be trouble in paradise. The setting is nice. The view of the birds and tropical plants outside is nice. But, not all of the staff is nice. Attended a conference at Flamingo and ate breakfast two times at Paradise. Monday morning had male table attendant who failed. Did not listen to requests for drinks. Offered no refills. Appeared very distracted. Tuesday was worse. Female attendant argued with us about our drink orders and then proceeded to reprimand us for suggesting that she had made a mistake. Claimed 29 years of experience and went on and on and on.......major attitude.    The food was just okay. Lots to choose from but nothing very appealing. Very overpriced for the quality of the selections. This is unfortunate because the setting is nice and the Flamingo is obviously alive and well in its old age -- fix this fast. It would be a shame to lose it.

vK36rMngvnZcLamxvP2lxw.text: Was there Tuesday cost was $45.00 not including the tip  which I did not leave    ,,, they got a great racket going on you pay then they ask you if you want a photo (said it is free)  NOT ,,, you get seated 5 minutes later pressure point sales person comes to your table (captive audience ) and pressure you to buy the photo in front  of your friends and other guest around you ,, Then the quality of the food was subpar at best , not to mention the service or lack there of ,,,,if I could rate this in the negative  I would do so only giving 1 star for the live flamingos

qae3JXcTg9I_4lV3cM1ZFg.text: Seriously awful. The food isn't even worth the price. But that's not why they get a bad review... The service was AWFUL. And we're even diamond status! Normally I can understand being busy and taking a little extra time to grab drinks but I can't believe it would take 20 mins to get a coffee not to mention never getting refills and having to tack down a manager to get the refills!. OH. Did I mention it's TUESDAY morning? Riddle me that one.

f-QCe78l1fN0IcMCjKFmQQ.text: Wouldn't come back here even if they pay me. Their food selection was pitiful. Actually tried couple of entree and it was pretty disgusting. Do not eat here! The service was blah. The hostess didn't know where to sit us. Never even came back to check on us. This place screams 70's, very outdated. The only thing going for this place is the view of the Koi fishes outside the garden.

rE6qjeQfFn61sPDVU2141g.text: Solid 3-star. Could be so much better, but "A-OK" for what it is. There are three sections: Asian, Dessert and regular Buffet-style.   Asian section had a small selection of sushi (which I didn't try), various hot items like pot stickers, pork buns, etc., fried and steamed rice, various noodle dishes, typical chinese items like beef w/veggie and Gen'l Chang's chicken. Large section of build-your-own-soup where you select the items you want in your soup and give it to someone (I didn't try this, either) to make the soup for you. A lot of people were getting this, so I'm guessing it's decent. Of the items from this section that I had the pork buns were mostly bun and very little pork .. but the pork that was in there was good. Pan fried dumplings were fine as were samosas.   In the regular buffet section, the prime rib was a bit disappointing. Not enough flavor. The fried chicken looked pretty good, but I didn't go back for it. Mashed potatoes w/gravy were good as was the mac & cheese (although it needed to have richer flavor, IMO). There were a lot of choices, but I wasn't in the mood for most of them, so I passed.   See .. I needed to save room for dessert. The dessert section is in the middle, so as I went to check out the Asian section, I saw what was waiting there and I knew I would not want to miss dessert.   Pineapple upside down cake? Ok. Chocolate fountain with marshmallows, macaroons and fruit for dipping? Certainly! Cotton damn candy .. wrapped? I'll take one to go. thankyouverymuch.  Sure. I feel like I need to boot after over-indulging, but it was worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Built my own soup. Delicious!
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate dipped Marshmallow and Macaroon
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Fountain

GzRQ5HeUXVC7xFYbalv1tQ.text: This buffet is in the Flamingo hotel and has a beautiful location with large windows viewing the habitat area.  It's cheaper than most others too: about $20 for an adult dinner.  There were long line waiting to pay, and long lines waiting to get seated.  The cashier was really nice.  The hostess was less nice, seating my family next to a large table of loud "frat boys".  At least all they were was loud since I was expecting them to get rude and vulgar... but they appear to have been well-bred frat boys since that never happened.  They left eventually.  The selection is varied but considerably smaller than most other Vegas buffets.  What was notable, though, was the clear inferiority of the food.  Much of it just didn't look good.  Some didn't look like was being described.  For example, there was a sign for "chicken and cheese pierogie" but what I tasted was a previously frozen, breaded chicken stuffed with cheese.  Nothing at all like a pierogie!  Crab legs were not split, making eating them messy.  One interesting item not seen on some of the other budget buffets was crawfish.   Even the salad bar offerings was sparse.  Oddly, only goopy salad dressings and not an oil/vinegar option.  Wierd.  Best items: the bread rolls (really), and the plain horseradish.  Worst item: the gelatinous brown gravy.  Recommended items: the slightly tough rib roast and baked potato (how can they screw that up... except to mark them as baked SWEET potato).  If you insist on sour cream for the baked potato... I couln't find any so substituted the creamed horseradish instead.    Weirdest item:  an entire area full of Middle Eastern and Italian "mezze", but practically empty.  We didn't really eat much, and enjoyed even less.  Dessert selection didn't dissapoint in quantity.  As expected, some items looked better than others.  The kids just LOVED dipping marshmallows and fruit in the chocolate fountain.  I opted for a fresh-made crepe.  the guy making the crepe did a nice job making it.  then offered a choice of four or five fruit fillings (canned pie filling kids of stuff).  Then, in one amazing motion, folded the crepe into a apple-filled football-like configuration, and flopped it onto the plate.  Could have been more dainty, I suppose, but it never changed the taste... which was just OK.  The waiter, though, almost drove this review into the 1-star category.  He was an nice older man who was tired and seems to have had no aptitude or interest in being a waiter.  He was never there when we needed him, and when he did show up never looked at us and took off so fast we couldn't ask him for anything... like beverage refills.  Throughout our meal he took care of refills of my wife and kids, once, but seemed to avoid me like I had the mark of Satan on my forehead.  Of course, when we were leaving, he cuddled up and made nice-nice  to "Satan"... presumably  in hopes of a tip.

ECb-fVkJ64_VEac_MQbClg.text: I always come to this Buffet when I am in Las Vegas.   They have a relaxing atmosphere which is nice when you spent all day with the hustle and bustle of the strip.   They always have a wide range of food to chose from as well.   I highly recommend this Buffet.

29mZP8P77OE5v_K3sciekw.text: ATTENTION this place taste like crap. And even by crap standard it's too crappy for other craps to like it. Spend your extra dollars in McDonald's instead, because that's more of a 'paradise'

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This thing is a pack of low grade sugar.

On_lzzqKCCaPG1viCLYqDA.text: Waited in a long line of people.   This line moves one foot every ten minutes and I'm so hungry.    Service wasn't up to par.    Oooh my gosh!  All these people passing up our long line have silver cards.      These big spenders just fly right in, escorted by a manager.  Then after I git to the register, I find out I coulda went ta the front of the line too. I had a gold card.       Escorts / hostess look for empty tables for us    Plate of Shrimp, a plate of prime rib, a plate of dried up lamb, off I go to pig out.       Our left over dishes were piled high on the table..    Overall....food is average.       They need more cash register booths, so the lines move quicker.  .

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birds next to waiting line.  You guys were almost my dinner.
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waterfalls from the buffet room
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Closeup of fish

NzNeUj1hC0qkcGheI8v5yA.text: There's a very small selection of food and it's not appealing. I added a star because of the view that our seats had(VIP seats)

Ulm-8wdz78Ep9tGBmh58mw.text: Wait. I don't get why so many people don't like this place. Everyone in my family loved Paradise .__.  Seafood, check. HUGE SELECTION, check. Clean and spacious, check.   It's been a while since I've been there but last time I only paid $13(or maybe 15?) for myself. Really, not bad!

yjN41fs_UxlYH-ANq3U65A.text: So the award for the worst buffet goes to.... (silence)  PARADISE GARDEN BUFFET! Lol.. (if there was an award)  Came here and the food was horrid. The pastas were cold and bland.  Worse than chef boyarde. The lettuce for the salads we're looking old and about to brown. The dressing were messy and it looked like the area needed to be cleaned up. Can we say, heath department! The mexican food tasted like dog food, if I ever would have tried dog food i'd assume thats what it would taste like, lol. and the deserts were hard and tasteless.   The waitress could barely speak english and hardly came over to clear our table. But she was handling ten tables and was still friendly and smiled so i knew she was trying.  next after we left we found out the buffet had to be closed because a rat ran across the buffet floor! gross! don't come here!

Vhqo1eMIRu756LmsNaagXA.text: This review is for 11/13/2010.  I lost majority of my receipts and I managed to just get this out of my bag. As many of you know, I am a Vegas lover. Who isn't?! I got a BOGO offer from Harrah's to tryout any of their properties buffet. I wanted to try something different. With my mom's birthday at hand, I decided to go to Flamingo's Paradise Garden Buffet for the breakfast buffet.   When we arrived at the restaurant area, there was a lot of people lined up. However, it was for the Tropical Breeze Cafe. When we walked a little bit to Paradise Garden Buffet, there was another line, but it was for special guests...lol. I guess Special Guests were treated like normal customers. So, I went to the regular line and in seconds I was at a cashier while the others waited in line for minutes.   I was greeted by Brenda. I gave her my Total Rewards Card, my coupon, my ID, and my credit card. Wow...that's a lot to give for food. Apparently, we came in during Champagne Brunch. Since it was just my mom and me, the total would have been $52.00. Whoa...$52 for two...Don't forget my coupon. My total would be $27.01. It would be $24.99 per person for Champagne Brunch.  When you do pay, they ask what you would like to drink. Its not extra charge, but its just a way to get servers tips since there is no soda fountain. We were seated by Marilou or Mary Lou and OFF TO GET FOOD!!! OMG, they had shrimp and mussels. I knew I had to fill me up. I got my eggs, sausage, this weird looking egg muffin that had no bread on top, but bread on the bottom, salmon, and hash browns. I got another plate and filled it with shrimp and mussels. YUMMO!!!  Best meal of the day. Unfortunately, my mother and I didn't take advantage of the free champagne since we don't drink. The shrimp and the mussels were the best part of the meal. It was like I was a whale and just ate the whole Pacific Ocean. Meal is a little pricey, but we are nowhere near the ocean and there was life here at a casino that seems like it was falling apart. Plus, the coupon help pay for my Mom's Birthday...lol.  The Yelp Universe. Where are you traveling today?

zAlrhIJqODi2tUMdndAQeQ.text: For the SAME PRICE you pay FLAVORS at Harrah's was 5x BETTER FOOD AND SERVICE. it's the last time I'm first and last time we are eating here.

N5MdNaOo0x2uJQBvGzPxGA.text: The best part of eating breakfast here was there was no line at 7:30 AM. It was down hill from there. Coffee was extremely bitter.  Omelet was bland and was tasteless. The only thing edible was bagel,  doughnuts,  and toast. Ok the cereal was individual packing. Getting wervice from the servers were painful. They cannot be blamed. our server was taking care of half the floor. I requested milk from a woman in a suit and was directed to request it from the server. The second time i saw the woman in the suit, i informed her that i have not seen the server and i would like a glass of milk. She then yelled across the floor to our server to get us a glass of milk. Poorly handled and demeaning to the server. I certainly will not come here again.

Y9EM7tARJTLxL-46Ir6H8w.text: Gross. Paid $68 for 2 adults and 1 11 yo child.... What a waste of money! Barely any food selection and what they do have is just plain nasty. I tried to play it safe and have a salad... The dressing tasted funny... I wish I could have gotten my money back!

SySvOYlRTlnX-SixX8PXQA.text: I love this buffet, a lot of great choices and their cotton candy desert and the chocolate fountain  However there are some things that they can do better: 1. a regular vegetarian sushi choices / California roll I only eat the vegetarian sushi and I wish there was just a regular vegetarian sushi with only cucumber then I would go there more often they have something like it but there's some things in it that make it not taste good  2. cut the crab legs in half because they just leave it whole and it makes it difficult to eat it and it's wasteful since people are throwing most of it out

67GQDVvrlZT5clYgpQukUA.text: january 3, 2015 paradise garden buffet @ the FLAMINGO hotel on the strip - las vegas...shame on you! skip it & go somewhere else...anywhere else, even fast food!   worst lunch buffet i've been to in vegas!  stations were bare!  salad bar was slim pickins!   chicken noodle soup was bland i needed hotsauce & lemon just to give it some flavor.    food on buffet was dried out.  roast beef in carving station too rare.  i had to ask the chef to grill it up.    turkey was dried out.    its a small buffet not very much to choose from.  slim pickins!  no baked potatoes.  only 1 soup available.    dining room was too cold.  wifi connect in dining area very slow.  $21.99 per person.    flamingo buffet use to be one of the best on the strip...disappointing, we wont be back!

i5S2EPHST7Kv_eUW5QG1JQ.text: This buffet is smaller than most in Vegas and had an incredibly long entrance line. It cost $25 and didn't seem worth it. Went early in the morning and the buffet had very little breakfast food. Most of the food options seemed lunch oriented, like Spanish rice, pasta, sliced turkey breast, etc. Despite this, the food I did try was of good quality and the bottomless mimosas definitely took the edge off of my hangover. I recommend it if you're looking for something within the Flamingo itself.

2EmqO-XXzGVxMAown0TvYg.text: Do not - I repeat - Do Not eat here.  We came for dinner Labor Day weekend.  Waited in a 2 person line that turned into a 20 minute wait because their system went down.  Although there was one register helping the diamond line only, not cool.  We should've asked to look at the food before deciding to purchase.  Everything was cold, bland, not appealing, and gave me bathroom problems afterwards.  The cold crab legs were completely liquefied and milky.  I'm shivering just remembering it to type this review.  Worst food experience we had in Vegas for sure.

v5xQ0voGF5Rd2i9u8dP-Zw.text: Will not return! I've been to several buffets in Vegas and I have to say this is the worst thus far. The best thing about it is the view of the flamingos in the exhibit, if you get a good seat. Other than that, it is a cheap buffet with cheap food. The selection is smaller than an average buffet. You could tell that the food was sitting a while without being replenished. I took a few items on my plate and only one thing was good enough to eat. The ravioli. Other than that, there was a horrible tasing gravy and mash potatoes and Mac and cheese that I couldn't have more than one bite of. Horrible. Thankfully we didn't pay or I would be asking for my money back as all I ate today was two pieces of ravioli. We had the buffet pass so we decided to check it out. I would probably say this buffet tastes like a cheap hotel buffet at any hotel around America. It does not hold up to any Vegas standards.

x8JeVGVMT-aZc8CWvvdVuA.text: One of worst buffet... ive experienced. Hometown buffet is better... if you are not too oicky then this one might be passable...

s2qiJHs4cS8undA2SuPIBQ.text: This is a pretty decent old school buffet. Dont compare it to aria, bellagio, or baccanal buffets as it is not the same caliber or price point. We came here because of a fantastic groupon two brunch buffets for $30. Which on the strip is almost unheard of. The fresh omelet statio was superb. Janet gets an A+ for service. The tri tip was very tasty , and the crepe station is a winner as well. The setting is a little old school .....but it was very clean and the staff attentive. I will definatly be back

WBZqkx6fIYpw5H1QQF2xrw.text: Great hotel, horrible buffet. There were far more wrongs then rights at this low end buffet. My girlfriend and I did the 24 hour buffet pass for $55.00 each and this one was number one on our. Lets start with the good and end with the bad.  The desserts were actually pretty good. Red velvet cupcakes moist with creamy frosting, and very tasty cream cheese danishes. The whole place had a very open feeling with extra high ceilings, large windows and bright sunlight. The windows offer a good view of the Flamingo wild life including, different types of ducks, coy fish, cat fish, flamingos, and some other birds. They do have a large amount of seats which I can not ever imagine them filling. The food was decent, about a 3 stars. Desserts and pizza were my favorite. Now on to the disappointing part.  We came for breakfast at about 10:30 so there was a good amount of people in line just to get in. The way they have set up the buffet makes it inconvenient to get to the food. They have the carving and omelet stations right in the middle so the lines that form for those block all the other food. Some things I could only get one of because people in line for an omelet were blocking the way. Selection was not that good either, they claimed to have a Mexican food section, but that was simply a joke. A bucket of jalapenos, peppers, sour cream, and onions is not a Mexican station.  The service here was hit and miss at best. Our first server spoke almost no English and gave us half of the drinks we ordered two coffees, two orange juices, and a tomato juice. We asked for some hot sauce and he never came back. He just seamed a little disoriented and not very alert, a complete disconnect from the customers. A lady came up to us and asked us how we were doing and we let her know that we needed some hot sauce and shortly after she came back with some hot sauce. So one did almost nothing for us and the other one was nice and accommodating. The other servers were a bit rude and seamed to expect us to move out of their way when we went to the buffet.  We tested out three buffets during this trip, all associated with Caesar's entertainment group and this one was by far the worst. They seam to not pay attention to the details and tried to cut some corners. With just a few tweaks they could be so much better, but for now if you are in the area seek a cure for your hunger elsewhere.

R-8Mp8lLJ28KvUYIwN8BKA.text: Went here for dinner on a Friday night as part of the buffet of buffet pass. They had unlimited beer, wine, and sangria included. The staff was so friendly, especially Lucille who rang us up. We really enjoyed our dinner here.

r4c0lVHuguasv7lHfqqj6w.text: It's food....That's about what I'd describe it as. For $30/person, I'd be mad. Granted, there are crab legs, salad bar, spaghetti and meatballs, some kind of roast beef, fried chicken, maybe a couple sushi rolls and more, but the it's not that large when it comes to dinner and the food is really pretty blah. We went because we had a buy one get one free, and it was barely worth that, but food isn't cheap in Vegas when you're eating out.  The best part was the cotton candy on the dessert bar, hubby liked the soft serve ice cream. They even had this very strange white chocolate skull filled with a nasty flavored cinnamon pudding. I wouldn't eat there again unless it was free.

PhDcsaNP2LnFHKjx2MEzNA.text: Lots of food selections (including sugar-free desserts for those requiring that). Tastes pretty good. Service was very attentive for our group of 8.      NOTE: Since we were paying separately, but wanted to sit together, each couple or single person had to pay the 18% gratuity. The buffet area is a bit run down, though. The scenery, if seated by the garden area, has very nice views of the palms, water features, koi, flamingo, etc.  Visited October 2016

HgazUPDmb_fYL3lJm28Hyg.text: I very rarely complain about the food at restaurants, but I was shocked by how much I disliked the buffet at the Flamingo. Usually I've got to the pricier buffets when I've been in Vegas, and always liked them, but we decided to look at something a little cheaper to make up for our other expensive meals of the weekend, and found ourselves at Flamingo.   The food wasn't very fresh. Nothing was warm or cold - just a lukewarm temperature. We tried the spring rolls, several of the vegetable dishes, fried rice, shrimp, cocktail sauce, crab legs, salads, desserts... basically gave everything a try. The spring rolls and crackers were chewy, while all the sauces were inedible. The cocktail sauce had such a strong horseradish taste that I nearly choked on it, and I'm not sure what was in the Caesar dressing but it was awful and had a weird, gritty texture (almost like sand). My dining partner said the desserts were very good.   The saving grace for dinner was the make your own pasta bar. It was something that I easily could have made at home, but it was fresh, tasty, and the only reason that I left feeling full.   The service was also very friendly and helpful, but with food like that I'd rather spend the extra money to go to the Buffet at the Aria.

k6ZIv38_F75Lk4hXUheZpg.text: More like a soup kitchen with bad service. Too bad because you'd think being located near the pool this place would be at least decent but no. Never again. The staff seem so unhappy and the food is home town buffet quality at best!

xf1W43GcO2pNqKeqTlmDVQ.text: An average Buffet, had breakfast here on the morning of my last day in Las Vegas, nice selection of average dishes, they have a nice dessert bar with a crepe station where they are made to order and other tasty treats for your enjoyment, unfortunately the breakfast selection are nothing special, the eggs Benedict was over cooked, so you had a hardboiled egg on an English muffin with sauce. Chicken fried steak and gravy was better, but the sausages were dry and tasteless. The waitress was exceptional and provided ample refills and cleared our plates quickly.  One of the nice parts of eating here is that you have a view of the Habitat and get to watch the birds walking around their enclosure. 2 for the food and +1 for the friendly server that brought our drinks and cleared the dishes, Join the toal rewards program to get a dollar of each person's buffet.

g4tRCLuvLeLvLx1z4mOgPQ.text: Went there for the breakfast buffet. It is like any standard breakfast buffet (with a few lunch items intertwined, like pizza). Nothing stood out and it was there for a quick meal if you are staying at the Flamingo. I got a better breakfast from the food court for a 1/4 of the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast buffet

b5eMn7ReMhStDq_PRaFSsw.text: The buffet seemed reasonably priced for Las Vegas. There was a wide variety of foods which were nicely prepared. Seating was comfortable and the server assigned to our table was very accessible. The only wait was for a custom made omelet. Perhaps they could have used an additional chef.

YR_0rX3iLmTaiHwvSlBvYA.text: Their food selection was good. We went here for brunch for our last day on the strip. Which was $19.99. They had a crepe station, omelette station, carving Stanton that had ham slab bacon, smoke sausage and turkey, a salad bar and a dessert bar. Our server was quick and had a good sense of humor. I loved that we were able to see the pond with the koi fish and flamingos where we were sitting.

M0jOq1rizKgpUfbXf3rzPw.text: The food was just alright. There was ya huge selection of items to choose from. I will say, however, the macaroni and the greens were actually pretty good!

2ar27ARsUk0X0-agefJYHg.text: After reading all of the negative Yelp reviews, I had pretty low expectations.  We had the Buffet of Buffets pass, so this was our third buffet with the pass.  Honestly, I was pleasantly surprised with the awesome view of the flamingo garden and the plentiful seafood.    I mainly ate the crab legs, shrimp cocktail, guacamole, sushi, and salmon.  The sushi mainly consisted of crab and tuna rolls.  Nothing special, but decent with some soy sauce.  They also had cooked salmon and raw salmon dishes, both of which were delicious!    Since we were there for a late lunch (around 4 p.m.) we also got to enjoy some of the dinner specialties.  I iked the chocolate fondue fountain, dipping strawberries and macaroons, and my husband liked the cookie bar.

616lxNkm3e-aaDmR_x2B_A.text: This buffet is poof that Caesars Entertainment (owner of the Flamingo) has officially given up. There's not a more pathetic attempt at a buffet on the Strip. I usually don't post negative reviews, but I feel that I need to protect people from this place. First, don't be fooled by the promise of free bloody Mary and mimosas.  You wait in line for a tiny glass.  Gross. I couldnt take more than a sip of the bloody Mary. And I don't know where to start in my criticism of the buffet food. Brunch was poorly stocked. Nearly every item was empty when we arrived, and nobody was in any hurry to refill anything. The salad bar was a mess and didn't even have the proper items.  No soup. The dessert bar is as big as the food bar but it was only stocked with dozens of the same items. The piece of cake I took was literally rock hard. Please don't stand in line to eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sandwich,  anyone
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum... Dim sum.
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If you hoped sushi, forget it. I asked if they had more, and the guy just smiled and walked away.

reu7rsma3XJf_RpHgFbmAg.text: Skip this Buffett!! Don't even let the 2 for 1 whisper to you! You've been warned!  I was not impressed by the buffett at all. They have a small selection. All food of the food is not properly heated. Waitress service was lacking. Not friendly at all.  The best was the views of the habitat while eating.  Not much to say

5sQ1t4ZgjQQ38ZXJT9uc6w.text: I've been to this buffet a couple times because it was easy when I was staying in the Flamingo but I do not imagine that I will go back. They recently decreased their hours to mornings and weekend nights.  The food is okay but sometimes looks like it has been sitting their awhile. We went their on christmas and all the desserts were missing and the ice cream machines were broken. There was also a huge line waiting for meat causing you to wait 30 minutes to get your food. The staff didnt really seem like they were working together to improve the situation. If they were a little more organized trying to come to a solution to make the process more efficient, maybe the buffet would be better...

kgyZbiYUhK7M0X4-nGTGzg.text: This review is purely based on a dish that has the wrong description!!! The Salsa Verde doesn't even look like salsa verde because duh????? it isn't even green. It's actually a delicious pork stew but Asian style. To me it looks like chunks of pork shoulder or pork belly braised in a sweet soy sauce base with ginger and scallions. It kinda taste like teriyaki pork if it was like pulled pork or a Hawaiian Kaulua pork but even better! There is steamed rice next to it. This is my suggestion, get s Soup bowl, scoop some rice, then scoop the "salsa verde" aka pork stew, try not to get the fatty pieces and don't forget to scoop some sauce. Next go to the sushi section and squirt some sriracha sauce if you don't like things too sweet. Some broccolini and roasted yams compliment the stew. Please trust me. I know this buffet isn't stellar but if you gotta eat here, you will be saved. I was about to talk a ton of smack about this place until my hubby found the delicious pork stew dish. If you are home sick and just want to taste Asian comfort, this will be your next go to. You will be like holy crap... damn I was hella missing out!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OwrrqAZrk6FBkzQhYrgKDQ.text: This is my first time at this buffet and the variety in this buffet is minimalist to say the least. I say this because of the poor food quality that this place delivers, the sushi must have been one of the driest sushi I have eaten with the rice literally stealing saliva out of my mouth. Instead of the crepes melting in my mouth they were crunchier than week old used Kleenex tissues. Although I did enjoy the desserts I wouldn't expect the rest of the brunch stations to deliver a great meal.  GET THE GROUPON FOR CHEAP ENTRY otherwise you're getting robbed. #cruchycrepe

X3IQqQa7w443bcEjREF5zg.text: Run don't walk ... away from this buffet! We bought a Groupon for dinner with bottomless beer and wine and the only beer they have is coors light. Plus all the food was cold or looked terrible. Even white rice -- which is hard to mess up -- looked inedible. The salad tasted gross, and the decor was laughably sad and dated. As we left we wanted to warn people away from this disgusting mess. Either save some money and go to the food court or spend a few extra bucks for a better buffet.

GxHM0PPn30b4XgEGIpDXiA.text: I went for breakfast or I guess well call it brunch and I have to say the Atmosphere is nothing like you see in the pictures here. 1st it was all older people .. many seemed depressed ..quiet..just thinking all down.. it was depressing. You feel weird and uncomfortable.. when you're getting food it just seems like when you would get food in your high school cafeteria.. as for the food..nothing special.. it's like a golden Corral brunch .. the food was ok.. the only cool thing was my omelet the chef made for me..I think I ate 2.. I drank orange juice and it tasted oily ..anyways.. 2 stars

bjl2s20aqOdcFv41f1Te6Q.text: Our group was extremely excited for the unlimited crab legs. However, be warned, the majority of our group ended our night with FOOD POISONING!!! The food really wasn't anything special, the selection was less than most other buffets, there were hardly any deserts, service was okay at best, and the atmosphere needs some maintenance. Just like the rest of the Flamingo resort, someone needs to give it some much needed TLC and thorough cleaning. For roughly the same price as many other Vegas buffets, GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!

tMcwAbszuzjWQ3iiGJLMJA.text: The buffet is great! It is not as elaborate as the Wicked Spoon, but it still offers a lot of variety. The best part is the view of the flamingoes from the restaurant! I just loved the ambience! Desserts are pretty amazing! Their crepes are delicious!!

RJNr4AAM1shHP3pqgp1SrQ.text: This buffet is exceptionally good. You have to try their smoked salmon with condiments.  When I was there it was to die for and great with their great salad bar and fresh fruits. Great breakfast.  Great nacho bar.  Crepes and desserts are great.  Fried chicken and French toast were kind of bland and soggy but not bad.  Corn dogs! Chicken fried steak, spicy broccoli beef, $1 aycd mimosas (total rewards members only) and a lot more.  This is one of the better spacious buffets. Will have to come back for dinner next time and see how it is.  Any recommendations?

wFnDXcsOB5HLfCltZc3j4w.text: We paid 35 dollars for 2 for a brunch buffet. There was no line at around 1pm. There is a decent variety of food that they provide. The food was good but not spectacular. There is a desserts section that can be easy to miss if you do not go around the corner of the room. The best was the crepe that we had with fresh strawberries and chocolate sauce. I don't know why people put down this place so much. You finally get what you pay for. For the price I felt I got a good deal and it was worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Freshest Chocolate and strawberry crepe with whipped cream.
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts at the Flamingo Paradise buffet.

Hr9qvLW_fhnNweSAU_8vxA.text: There was no line during thanksgiving weekend Saturday dinner time. Price is reasonable considering there are unlimited crab legs and prime ribs. Other than the crab legs and prime ribs there isn't much variety. In addition there was also a crepe station which had delicious crepes. The rest of the desserts were decent. Only a few selection of fruit.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XpuGw840YiERnPauWqTf0w.text: Went for brunch and they served bottomless mimosas and the food was yummy and fresh! Affordable with the groupon and the best part is the ambiance! Sat next to the view of the outdoors where the live flamingos from the hotel are at! Dessert was super yummy and for brunch they have fresh omelettes!

4tjdm55Ql5-ibV03MDBIJA.text: The buffet did not WOW us like the Wynn's buffet but it offered several breakfast and lunch options at 8am. We enjoyed the made to order omelette, the wide assortment of veggie lovers options, and the desserts. At a glance, the desserts didn't look to be anything special however they were all very tasty. Definitely the best tasting desserts of the three we tried (mirage buffet and Harrahs). This buffet needs to step up there game and offer the drink stations like the others and it would probably rank higher. I probably wouldn't visit again unless I were to receive a deal.

MUBPbRv8UjvmG5djfW0yQQ.text: Good for brunch. The crepe station was disappointing but the omelet station was great. The bacon was okay, which is about all you can ask under the circumstances, and the baked goods were probably the best I've had at a buffet. If you do the buffet pass, you should plan breakfast here.

n6NLl2ncLzB-pW1FvbdyGQ.text: Waste of hard earned money. You could get so much better for $30 in Vegas. This was pitiful at best. Eat a pizza instead or better yet don't eat at all. Garbage.

X44N0cNvhqsRwKsjhyAmBQ.text: Crepes for days!  We went to the Paradise Garden Buffet on a Sunday afternoon at 12pm for brunch. The line was about 45 minutes long, which I was not happy about. However, once inside I got my first mimosa down and my first plate of food and I was feeling good!   The food selection was pretty good, I enjoyed the lunch foods more than the breakfast foods. However, on my second round I waited for a freshly made crepe and was thoroughly pleased. I asked the crepe guy if he could put strawberries and "lots of nutella" in my crepe. He definitely came through for me! It was delicious.   We stayed in the buffet for 1.5 hours and we each gulped down 3 mimosas, so we made sure to make the money count. The desserts were fun too!

6_U9hGFb9RC2c8eptxDSkQ.text: For starters it's about zero degrees in this buffet. Even with a jacket on and jeans, it was unpleasant. After being seated we were ignored for I'd say ten minutes before someone asked what we wanted to drink. (It wasn't that packed). As for the buffet, i felt it was lacking breakfast food. Is taco meat necessary at 8 am? It's pretty  basic, pancakes, waffles, runny scrambled eggs. I think for the amount of money, you could totally find a better place it eat and spend money.

YBXbFMGmujbnaZi9xfo_FA.text: Omelets were bad and runny. Turkey was surprisingly moist and had good flavor. Chicken was extremely dry and tasted HORRIBLE! OMG. Ham was moist and had somewhat decent flavor but not much intensity to it. Pork loin had wonderful flavor but was sadly dry. Desserts were bad!! Real bad. Most had the texture of medical grade rubber. Ya, no.   ***Remember the champagne is free!!! But they won't offer it to you, you have to ask. It's bad though. Very cheap and way too sweet. Gives you a stomachache.   Ambiance was spacious and well lit but looked like a retirement center in Florida. Overall disappointed on the variety of items offered compared to other buffets.   Worst buffet overall I've been to on the strip.

jQMApAhGtJ6HiOBgRLULxw.text: Service is hit or miss. Our first server we had to track down. Our second was super attentive and courteous. The breakfast eggs Benedict is a must try. But honestly all The food is all delicious. Check Groupon for deals! The desserts are probably the best part of the buffet. Must try the strawberry shortcake!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6C-8eC680aeApWIfNYCnpA.text: I have had better buffets at $2.99 circus circus than this over inflated priced processed yuk .We got there about 1pm $50 for my 12 year old and me . We were warned we had a hour and they closed should of passed .Mixture of mainly breakfast nasty greasy bacon dry pancakes and cold eggs . Sandwich bar was boring and uninviting . Apparently they had crepes but the person making them was nowhere around . Desserts were gross and few . Very disappointed in quality of food and quite frankly lack of choices .

i4bEpUPy7KX074o9UOoWMQ.text: Staying at the Flamingo and saw a brunch deal on Groupon... 37.00 for two people plus bottomless mimosas and bloody marys. This price cannot be beat for a meal in Vegas. My husband and I both thought the food was great! Drinks were good as well. Employees were so friendly. We would absolutely do this again. Well done, Flamingo!

__8eKeFxvkqevOLtuaxn3w.text: Wow this was great! I feel like I can't move after eating! This buffet has offers breakfast, brunch, lunch all day and dinner on Friday and Saturdays. It's a tad pricey but it's totally worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Many choices of food. Great selection
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wH94NZSGbQMFY2Lf7BUYVQ.text: Food was great. We did a Groupon deal which saved us about 60% of the bill. Normally adults are $45 a person but with the Groupon we paid that same amount but for 4 of us. Food was great, I had the Mac and cheese, French toast, sausage, bacon, bagels.. idk what else but i can go on lol because i ate so much. Honestly the only reason why I'm giving it a 4 star is because the chocolate muffin tasted like fish- like tilapia fish. It was so strange and gross. I also did not like the way we "had to make it aware we wanted alcohol before seating". We've never been here before and knew about the bottomless mimosas so we went to get food and realized a server never came after 30 minutes so I went to ask a hostess. She said "u need to wait for ur server". I said "we've been waiting for 30 minutes". She said "u wanted liquor?" I said "yes we did, we're sitting right here" she said "u had to tell us this before hand let me handle seating people and I'll help you". 10 minutes later a server came and told us the same thing and was rude about it too. "You all had to of had tell someone it was liquor u wanted because most folks don't want mimosas or Bloody Mary". We apologized for not knowing but I almost feel like this is a tourist resort. Like the whole strip is! And this should be on a sign somewhere or on the Groupon perhaps. We will come back for the food, not for the service. I'll just ignore the shit out of it and avoid the fishy muffins

m6YYoYD5gxNebnTjqmwLgw.text: Was one of the best brunch I've been too very clean the food was great loved the variety. The cleaners were always filling my mimosa glass

OCbUixUqCRwtcmz7W-HyIQ.text: The buffet is a bit pricey and busy. The food was quite good. If you choose to not get maid service every night of your stay you get a $10 off coupon (it can be used other areas in the Flamingo hotel). Also I paid $5 for bottomless mimosas and it was NOT worth it. The waitress rarely came to refill it. And honestly it had a weird chlorine taste? The orange juice was real. It was just strange...

2L0lB3-9mO6P5d144pk_VQ.text: Deceptive marketing - HORRIBLE service.  They charge you an extra $5 for the mimosa or Bloody Mary that they do a good job of leading you to believe is included.  Then the service  is SOOOOO bad you will  have 2 cups of coffee down and 2 plates before they even take your drink order and then You can only order 1 at a time. My recommendation is skip the crappy service drama and buy a nice drink at the mirage Buffett or another place that actually cares about their customers.

pFZkgjhKpLBisFgZaUPMyQ.text: Food was decent, but nothing special. I don't usually comment on price because eating out is just going to be more costly than eating at home. However this is definitely over priced. I did enjoy the garden setting and lovely views from my window table.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flamingos
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garden view
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Koi

FPkn0A5of6nqrrNtdKMx-g.text: Came to get the amazing burgers we saw on YouTube :( sadddddd 1:00 pm and they are still serving only breakfast

oBkdlCL6jXjpjSdZJy5OdA.text: I'll keep this short and sweet. This place sucks! Worst buffet i have ever eaten at. I would give it zero stars if I could. Golden Corral is better than this place and i swore i would never go back to one of those. Save your money and time waiting in line. What a disappointment !

bFPs6svKzJt00vEE2Hu4YQ.text: I purchased a Groupon for this buffet and I went here on 9/22/18 and thought I would give it a try. The staff and food was excellent and I would recommend this buffet to friends and family visiting the Las Vegas strip!

AHEXm3k4n9cgKH05fPwCZA.text: So we have a VIP Buffet for 9 people that we acquire from groupon today. We waited to be seated after we went through the cashier. This lady, Fe, took us to our table and this table is in a center of the atrium and we noticed that there is not enough lighting on it. It was almost dark. So my sister went to talk to her about the situation and she was saying that she can't do anything about it since there is a party going on. My sister insisted that we purchased a VIP buffet and she said that it was only for the line. Really now? We have a senior and a toddler with us for her to think that it is okay. It is not. We pay the amount required to get the pass so we should receive the service as required. Our server, Maria, was the only reason why we stayed because we were about to walk out of this place. So kudos to her. Food rating is 1.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The table where they planned to sit us with no enough lighting...

2QfuUvozjJlJ1C4C549HsQ.text: Food quality and drinks have gone down hill since last year.  Avoid this place... Groupons are welcome with good reason. Place is old, service horrible and food nasty. Will not be back and do not recommend... go elsewhere for the same price point.

8AbMcSDib_k1wytU7ksDMw.text: Super long wait in line, about 1.25 hours. They were only letting people in once 15 groups at a time left. I counted. If I hadn't bought a Groupon for this meal, is have been much less enthusiastic. I got in about an hour and a half before they closed. At this point they were already cutting back on the dishes. Most of the food was executed well and fresh though. The Groupons I bought were supposed to include bottomless Bloody Mary's or mimosas but that was a joke. Nobody ever came to the table to serve us. We ended up just drinking diet Pepsi and don't our best to try things before they disappeared

MmpJfSkRCD50F8w8cySPWw.text: My husband and I bought a groupon to the Paradise Garden Buffet because we wanted to try something new on our trip this week. I would warn people to stay away!!! The seafood was disgusting as if it had been sitting out for hours. Nothing was fresh (CRAB LEGS LEFT A RANCID SMELL ON OUR HANDS) and within several hrs we were both feeling ill. We literally did not even get through one plate of food before we got up and walked out. We spent less than 15 mins there. The serving staff that is in charge of serving alcoholic beverages were all just standing around while numerous patrons tried to get their attention. We weren't even able to order the drinks that came with the dinner package we purchased. $50 wasted as we can no longer get a refund from groupon. We will stick to the buffet at Harrah's.  went there for the seafood brunch before we left the following day and it was so much better and FRESH.

Uc661f1JlUJcNm-5Syqd1w.text: Used the Groupon that was bought before our trip to Las Vegas. Got there about 11AM on a Tuesday morning and waited in a long line for over 30 minutes! This is due to having only one cashier and one hostess for seating. The weekday selections were limited for a Las Vegas buffet but since this is one of the cheaper buffets on the strip I guess you get what you pay for. The only real standout was the omelet bar otherwise nothing special. The service was great and dirty dishes were removed from the table in a timely manner. Overall the restaurant was clean and the cold items seemed cold and the warmer treys were at an good temperature. I will also mention that the unlimited mimosas had plenty of champagne in them and are worth the up charge. If you are staying at the Flamingo then this is a good place for brunch but definitely not worth the visit if staying elsewhere on the strip as there are better choices.

iJUaDhoVZYY9qeDa2GpF8g.text: Huge buffet, decent price for Vegas, tons of food options. Service was good and the food was a step above regular buffet food. I would go back next time I'm in town.

0pMLPDMNHuTqk3GSeZlRjw.text: We are staying at the flamingo and decided to come eat at the buffet since it's conveniently in our hotel. Worst service ever. We complained because all the food was cold and inedible. When we complained the chef came out and screamed at us and when we explained our complaint the Chef became belligerent and rude. To add insult to injury, the manager, after apologizing for her chefs rudeness, asked us if we wanted more food (mind you the food was inedible) she only offered platitudes with no real resolution. I had to call my credit card provider to dispute charges because we were not able to eat... oh yeah don't pay the extra dollar for the mimosas, they Sever them in plastic cups and it's pretty much watered down orange juice. As a consumer this was the worst experience I've ever had!

LfssDHN8NplDSNqerI6aUg.text: Great service here from beginning to the end. Food can be a little more hotter. I enjoyed it here though with my Beautiful Wifey for her Birthday.

3ASiYzM_on4maKZFB70W-A.text: This buffet had a good variety of options for most people. The food seemed to be fresh and the omelette station is great. There were several dessert options available. I would suggest to be there before 10am due to long lines.

l7gIEYW_RU7EWlRgtgA-HQ.text: Food was not great. I was disappointed after waiting for a custom omelet to find it was not cooked AT ALL on the inside. Fruit was very fresh, but the oatmeal tasted like water and the soggy bacon was colder than room temperature. 1 of the 2 stars is for service and hot coffee. We will likely not be back.

FmAThdFSdjuvInfMeSPaJQ.text: One of the most underrated buffets in Las Vegas.  My breakfast here was fantastic.  There was no wait on line for a table and the variety of food was not only diverse but on point in terms of taste.  Not to mention but their potato salad was so tasty I went back for thirds.  Their crepes were delicious and quickly made on the spot.  The desserts were very delicious and I appreciated the no sugar options.  Another key factor was their amazing customer service that goes above and over to make sure you feel invited and comfortable.  There isn't much to say about this place but that it's amazing. You all have to go and show this place some love.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Wg2Wek1V78QpeYaMRGd_5w.text: Be prepared to wait an hour for a seat. The food isn't very good.  Go to Groupon and you can at least get a coupon. The only saving grace was the "unlimited" mimosas. The servers watch you though to be sure you don't get too unlimited.

0PumdwfjqomrEuCOwkku_w.text: This buffet was NEVER on my list of possible Vegas buffets. But since we had the Buffet of Buffets, we found ourselves here on Saturday night.  From the moment we arrived all the way up to getting my food, I had a feeling of dread. I was prepared for some awful food...There was no line when we walked up. We were quickly seated. The place was practically deserted aside from a handful of guests.  I got a couple of tortilla chips with some pico de gallo (I don't recommend) and filled the rest of my plate with hot (temperature-wise) crab legs. And let me tell you, SWEETEST crab legs/claws I have eaten in a long time! This was better than Bacchanal's crabs! So for the remainder of my meal there, I got plate after plate of them delicious crab legs/claws!  I finally had to move on to dessert since everyone else at my table was done, haha! I got the crepe. It's made to order and completely customizable; so I was able to add whatever I wanted instead of selecting #1 or #2 like Paris' buffet. Pretty tasty :D  So yes, I am giving this place the full 5 Stars! The crab claws are to die for~

1vspXsHIerdCLr7GgNz5Fw.text: A buffet with a view, that's the extent of Paradise Garden. That view is strictly a daytime thing, so it seems a majority of the patrons are here for lunch/brunch. It's a run of the mill Vegas buffet, with some interesting items, but is an overall lackluster experience.  First timers here might find the space impressive because it is. There aren't many midstrip lower end properties that will offer a spread like this, let alone with views of a vibrant garden. That's essentially the bread and butter of the experience because the options and quality of the food are subpar enough to have folks second guessing their visit.  During the brunch hour, there is a bottomless mimosa option, which is an attractive option for the weekend warriors looking to continue their Saturday hangover. Another thing I didn't expect was the "Asian noodle" station, where one can customize their bowl of noodle soup. I made a killer wonton noodle soup - I'm still shocked. Their crepes station is also a semi-thumbs up, but it really depends on who's making them.  The rest of the buffet is a tough to swallow. Literally. Anything fried is instant fail. The pizza is almost always a sure bet for a no-thank-you, most of the seafood is bland city, and if you're shooting for any of the BBQ or Mexican fare, then bless your appetite.  Prices aren't backbreaking for a strip property at $24 for dinner and brunch. Other than that it's $15-20 for everything else. If you happen to be rockin the 24 hour pass, then consider passing on the Flamingo version of buffetland.

uLxi26KoxbLI-46twjeVqw.text: This is the worst buffet ever , don't spend your $30+tips on this unprofessional place , most unprofessional and poorest service in Las Vegas ...the prime rib was so dry what ever you asking it's coming well done and dry you would not try more than one bite , sushi wasn't sushi ...crab legs the worst worst worst dry old crab legs in the whole world ...in ceviche was only cpl shrimps , very disappointed.... Don't waste your time and your money

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MEEo9LyE4ThLG-ycTVhiSQ.text: This is literally the worst buffet in Vegas. I probably ate the worst shrimp taco of my life. There prime rib was ok but their hot veggies were cold. The desserts were disgusting as well. Don't come here! Trust me! If I could have given negative stars I would have.

7H4G6EqWjI9IWVH2VzqduA.text: While the price was fair at 19 bucks, the food just wasnt worth it. I would have rather of eaten at Subway honestly. I was near Ballys where we were staying so we tried it. I wouldnt go back. Service was outstanding that kept them out of the 1 star zone

veLeRu9fJuNLaaibU5Y4sw.text: Not the highest end buffet in Vegas, but the bottomless champagne, mimosas, and bloodys were good, and I enjoyed the bloody Mary bar.  Food was okay, but with enough visits to the drink bar (one person pouring and the line did get long at some points), you won't care so much about the mediocre food.

Xa96WsPT8KLETDQuJ_PjJA.text: This place sucks. Overpriced for what you get: cold, bland food. We showed up right when they opened. How were they able to get their food cold so quickly? It's all gross.

qVENLfQekbWD_DG3A7lLjA.text: Absolutely horrible I wouldn't pay $5 to eat at this buffet and it was $30!!!!!! Do yourself a favor and go ANYWHERE else!!!

2RuviwLIa1P-Korm2w58uQ.text: We came here for brunch. Sandy waited on us when we payed. She was so nice and personable. We were seated near the flamingos so we had a great view. Our server was Maria. She was very prompt and friendly. The selection and quality was great for the price. They had various breakfast and lunch items. We will definitely return soon.

T0ubnMMGlXGWbVRZywtVXg.text: I'm just really sad right now. Sad that I'm here, sad for anyone else who spent 30 bucks to come here. Sad for all the flamingos inside. The only happy people in this place are the amazing, friendly staff.  Don't be sad, don't be me, don't come here, your friendly Las Vegas version of hometown buffet.

j5itB3Q8BEXuZiJKQAdGWQ.text: Hmmmmm.... yeah not good.  Nothing looked particularly fresh.  We ate here because we had a Flamingo hotel deal that included two free breakfast buffets.    I think normally it costs about $20+?  That is a rip off I tell you.

StgzGUrymLAmLRnOweoFRA.text: Used our holiday buffet pass here for breakfast ($70/pp buffet pass).  The holiday breakfast was only $18.99 ... the holiday buffet pass sucks. Do not get the buffet pass during the holidays.  I like that you can place your drink orders with the cashier. The orange juice tasted really good ... so much better than paris buffet's orange juice.   The view of the pool/water fountain made breakfast so much more enjoyable.   The eggs benedict tasted the same as bellagio eggs benedict. The donuts/muffins came out of a pink box.... The crepe station was yummy Waffles were yummy.. crunchy on outside and soft on the inside.  Had the usual breakfast items: muffins, donuts, cereal, salmon, vegetables, salad bar, fruits, sausages, omelette station, and its worth the breakfast price. (Worth it just without the buffet pass) i wouldn't pay more than $18.99/pp here.   The staff was super quick and attentive. Great breakfast ambiance.

G7p0PIQMgmrKkutb3b9LBg.text: Just okay, but had some interesting features: 1. Chocolate fountain. YUM. Comes with rice krispies, strawberries, and marshmallows for dipping. 2. Turkey bacon and sausage (we went for breakfast). I hate regular bacon but love turkey bacon so this was an unexpected treat. 3. Crepes station - looked good though I didn't try it. 4. Lots of variety  The food was your typical  breakfast fare but there was a lot of it. Ask for a seat near the window and you can see the flamingos as you eat.

Bj5YltVHlR4qe0NTnyRxHQ.text: Bleh, me and the family only went here because it was free in the show package that we bought. Needless to say, this package only existed because this sad excuse of a Vegas buffet needed the business boost.  There's only two stations, the main course and dessert. The crab legs were awful and smelly. The steak was dry. The chicken was not juicy. The dessert was all old cookies and cupcakes, and the fruits were gone by the time I got there. One saving grace is the novelty of the fondue fountain, which is enjoyable.   If you've come all the way to Vegas from wherever else in the world for an awesome buffet, there are plenty of alternatives. If it's too cold outside or you're too drunk to walk away from the Flamingo, give this place a shot. If they reduced their prices to match their quality, maybe it wouldn't be so bad. Get your stuff, together, Flamingo!

qHODrtSiNJIVbutexvPGKQ.text: Ugh.  Low food selection.  Everything was pretty mediocre for $20 for lunch.  Only thing I liked was the shrimp cocktail.  I wanted a seat nearby the windows (since i was on b.o.b.) but those were full =\  Service was nice.  Cotton candy was also cool.  All the hot items were gross though.

ZBtt7bNN5mXwVh5icEGRSA.text: Located in The Flamingo Hotel Casino on the Famous Las Vegas Strip. Ok $20 for lunch really?!? The bellagio is a couple of bucks more and 100000000000 times better. Make the walk over there instead, it's right across the street and let's be honest before and after filling your face with a Las Vegas Buffet, the stroll will do you good. Also the service sucks here, the waiter walked by my empty drink no less than 8 times before offering to refill it. Life is too short for overpriced tourist trap buffets, skip this one and hit up Bellagio. You will thank me later. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

d--MGypw90ZVAYuh5COzVw.text: Endless mimosas make it worth it, though there is not a lot of champagne in them. Mostly OJ. Food is good but not a lot of options. It says that they have Asian, Mexican, Italian, (etc)stations but it's like 3-4 menu options as a 'station'. For the $ you get what you pay for. It's good but not particularly memorable.

j87EVRUEm0oTTLi6s1EIzA.text: This is he most horrendous buffet I have ever had. Hands down. Eggs Benedict was COLD. not even a bit of heat to it. Not to mention egg white slimy. I almost retched all over the table on first bite! Pizza-cold and crust doughy. No flavor. Bacon- transparent and over done. Guacamole- from a bag and tangy. Burger to order- thinner than a paddy on a McDoubble. Way too much bun. Pasta salad- way salty! Best thing I had here was a salad and to be honest, wasn't impressed there either. Ingredients in center of salad bar were quite difficult to reach. Didn't dare make a sandwich with their unidentifiable "lunch meat". I will say they had complimentary alcoholic beverages. Before he filled my glass I saw an inch of water in the bottom on my glass. He proceeded to fill my glass 3/4 the way full. I was confused by the whole interaction.  Please do yourself the favor and save the $21.61 for a LUNCH buffet and go elsewhere. I would have preferred McDonalds at this point.

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiny alcoholic beverage filled 3/4 the way. 1 inch of water in the bottom of my glass before he filled. Just why??

Hv8Q8j5utuT-yq8o8O17cw.text: Buffet was great. Server was HORRIFIC. We wanted to be by the windows to see the water and flamingos and the host was kind and placed us there. The server had a terrible attitude but we decided to try and look past it considering we are on vacation and want to have a good time. She BLATANTLY avoided us the ENTIRE time. We had to beg her for our mimosas that are unlimited with the buffet we paid for! I don't understand what the issue was. I understand bad days but when we see you being friendly and kind and giving to other customers and then barely answering us with an annoyed nod or "you need to give me more time" to get a simple mimosa? That's after the fifth time she walked around to see if everyone else was "ok" and never seeing if we needed anything. Like I said I understand busy and maybe having a bad day but this seems a little obvious we were being singled out on purpose. I'd come back for sure but definitely never with this waitress.

bZUbVWb1R-hLBlp0mkrkow.text: As I entered into the hotel to make my way to the buffet, there was an aroma unpleasing to the senses that made you want to vomit.  The air was filled with cigarettes, mold, Bengay and heavy Jean Nate cologne.  I believe Jean Nate actually lived there.  What I absolutely forgot about this place is, there is an actual Flamingo sanctuary in the hotel's atrium.  That is a sight to see on it's own.  Who wouldn't want to take pictures with a cute pink flamingo?  We arrive at the counter.  There is no wait at 330pm for our lunch buffet.  Friendly lady in a wheelchair helps check us in.  We ask to be seated next to the Flamingo windows.  And first the hostess said those seats are reserved for Diamond members... but because it's 330pm and it was so empty, she went ahead and seated us there.  That was very nice.  But what I noticed was, instead of cloth napkins, we got cheap paper napkins.  But that's fine, I was able to use my extra's to sneak off 5 cookies from the dessert bar - shhhhhhh...  I would have never made it into Flamingo if it wasn't for this Buffet of Buffets thing I bought.  Since we stayed at Ballys and had no car, our legs were our fastest transportation to the next buffet.    I scanned the room for food.  I grabbed a foiled wrapped hamburger.  Fresh prime rib slice (the dude cutting the meat looked stoned out his mind and confirmed it when he dropped my slice off the side of my dish),  buttery mash potatoes, mac n cheese, and a bowl of clam chowder.  I ate everything.  It's okay, not bad at all.  I ended up at the dessert section for my 2nd round.  I grabbed 5 tasty cookies ;), a chocolate mousse cake and strawberries.  Then i went to the salad section and grabbed lettuce, black olives and dressing.  That was it.  I was done.  I was full but left room for my next buffet...  Tip: Always ask to be seated next to the Flamingo's.  It doesn't hurt to try to get the best seat in the house... you earned it after walking through Jean Nate's gambling section

zyfUvNQ9AcrcuzQElfJstQ.text: Wow....had breakfast at this buffet on Friday and was really impressed.  I'm surprised to read the reviews.  We got right in about 9:00am and sat by the window.  The view was very enjoyable.  Our server was nice although we were missing one place setting for our party of 6 and she missed 1 coffee but brought it immediately afterwards.  The food was a good selection and everything was very fresh.  We enjoyed scrambled eggs, cheese blintzes, crepes, fresh fruit, salmon, eggs benedict and more.  We all enjoyed our meal and would return without an issue.  This was breakfast though and it seems like the other reviews are more for dinner. It was not noisy and the lines were not long at all.  Maybe we just hit it at a good time but I will definitely return to this buffet.

u06NVTfaE5GauCqFoLJ7jg.text: For the price it is edible. I guess if you were drunk you might think the food was good but we got there right when it opened and the food was already cold and dried out.

2OnvUg9RPynWL6IDIBSnlA.text: If i could give 0 stars I would. The main reason why I came here was because it says bottomless mimosas. The waitress never came to our table to give us refills. After my first mimosa I had to get up and walk around the restaurant to look for the waitress to ask for a refill every time. And there were only like two other people eating in the restaurant when I was there!!! It wasn't busy she was just lazy, and very rude whenever I asked her for one. I said please and thank you and she never said you're welcome, she would just give me a dirty look. It's just very frustrating being at a restaurant and feeling like a nuisance when all I am asking for is someone to do their job. Oh and the food wasn't very good either. Don't go here. I know the "bottomless mimosas" are tempting, but it takes about 20 min to get each one and that's when you chase down the waitress every time. There are so many great food places in Vegas, don't make the same mistake I did

IAafdrBuNWaKsLgFi8ZiZQ.text: Best breakfast buffet we've ever been to! The selection is outstanding. Also, bottomless mimosas... Couldn't be better than that! Also, bf almost left wallet on table while we went to grab a plate and the most kind waitress flagged us down and reminded us of the wallet. (of course the leaving of the wallet was a total accident.)

5GxaduV4ER8EwZ0b8ViI9w.text: Is this place one of the few inexpensive buffet spots on the strip? Yes. Is the food comparable to other buffets on the strip? No. Why? Well, everything my wife and I had during the breakfast buffet was bland, dry and cold.   The selection here is very limited compared to other breakfast buffets we've attended. So if you're looking for a place that has an overwhelming number of options ready for you to dive into, let me save you the time and tell you look elsewhere. Yes, other buffets can be pricey, but at least at those buffets the food quality is far better and you have a bigger selection of items to choose from.  The only real benefits of coming to this buffet is saving a few extra bucks.

V55f5SDElD0wCXm6f-KL-Q.text: We went here for breakfast last Saturday and used our Buffet of Buffet pass.  I was pleasantly surprised.  We were seated right away, the waitress who was helping us kept our drinks refilled and kept coming around to check on us.  They had the typical breakfast fare, sausage links, patties, bacon, biscuits and your choice of sausage gravy or creamed chipped beef gravy.  My favorite was the corned beef hash - definitely not from a can.  There was an omelet station and a crepe station.  The food that I did try was flavorful, hot (temperature wise) and fresh.  I haven't tried their lunch or dinner, but I might the next time I take a trip to Sin City.

6U-GwpJxkdbakdcByESI8A.text: Blech!  I had a buffet of buffet pass and ate three meals here (only because I was staying in the hotel).  The food was luke-warm at best.    Golden Coral's buffet is MUCH better than this.  I guess that's what I get for trying to find a bargain in Vegas - there just isn't a bargain when it comes to food.  If you are looking for decent food in Vegas, expect to pay high prices for it - don't skimp!

JgucWgQ2onZ2GNSl0FJKJw.text: Minerva who took or money was very nice, and our waiter who's name escapes me was also nice. The hostess who seated us was a trainwreck. Agnes, refused to let us sit by the Windows claiming there was no open seats, when there clearly was. In fact the next three groups of people she took all got seated by the Windows. Instead we got seated in quite frankly the worst seats in the house. I was literally sitting in the main aisle right at the entrance/exit to the seating area so it was fun to get bumped into like twenty times. Her claim is that since it was before nine they weren't all the way open. Well if you open at seven you need to let people know you're not going to be ready to work at nine...or make up a better story Agnes. Watched her pull similar crap with several other parties as well. Aside from her basically being rude and nasty, the food had also gone way down in quality since the last time we were here. The ham was good, but easy staples like bacon and eggs were downright nasty. Salad bar accounts for about half of all items. It's not so bad if you can get a seat by the birds and stay awhile and have a few drinks, but I could barely eat seeing as I had to dodge other patrons coming right at me. We just up and left, wasn't worth our time. We had a whole morning/early afternoon planned at flamingo, but decided to go elsewhere after this experience.

fPhOyGwYnA7g18JVkxPQaw.text: Went for breakfast, very underwhelmed. Despite a crepe station and an omelette station and bottomless bloody Mary's and mimosas, this place still failed to impress. The service was the best part. The staff was great, the view of flamingos was ok, but the food was no better than an old country buffet and the bloodys were terrible.

67ewnewquua3GHcpKlhn-w.text: We used a coupon code and got to skip the line for the lunch buffet on a Friday. The atmosphere was good, service friendly, etc. lots of food options. We left very satisfied. It was really nice to stroll through the sanctuary outside after eating.

2nndrzCSh04MXyvxAa2J6g.text: We had a 20% off coupon from Bally's, so my family and I decided to go there for brunch. When we got there, there was a long line, but we still decided to wait. Finally got to the hostess desk 30 minutes later and then we had form ANOTHER line to be seated! So many lines, such a hungry stomach.  Wide varieties of breakfast/brunch items from yogurt and granola to eggs benedict. Everything was fresh, including the cocktail shrimp and crawfish, which sounds a tad bit weird for a morning meal. Service was pretty slow and we had piles of plates on the side of our table which made it difficult to put our new plates down. Can't leave the buffet without having some dessert! As my favorite part of the meal, I went hog wild and took a sample of each dessert item. The crepe is made to order, but nothing special (varieties of fruit "preserves", chocolate syrup, and whipped cream). The cannoli, soft serve ice cream cone and fondue were delicious, but the red velvet cookie wasn't something I was crazy about.  Very decent buffet, but definitely look out for coupons!

photos.caption: Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fondue, mini lemon meringue, and canolli. Delightful.
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Always save room for dessert!
Photo of Paradise Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. O HAI

xWgqZTlQpRdQ54facghNhQ.text: We stayed at the Flamingo hotel the first week of July and decided to go here for brunch on our second day of vacation. The price was reasonable, especially considering you get bottomless mimosas included in the pricing. Brunch selections were decent, but there wasn't a whole lot to choose from. The good news is that everything they had was delicious and hot. We saw them changing out pans even if they weren't empty which makes you feel good about the safety and quality. The location is awesome, with a view outside to the flamingos and it's quite bright (anyone notice that most Vegas buffets seem so dark?). The Flamingo is our favorite hotel in Vegas and we will definitely be returning to the Paradise Garden Buffet on our next trip there.

QMbm2uFFFgXdMahcVykIqw.text: It's one of the worst Buffett that I ever had in Las Vegas!   Not so much selection of food and they were serving he prime rib RAW  that is why they needed up cooking it in the grill.     It took us half an hour on the line inside the restaurant just to get a steak.  The curvier got pissed on use because I asked 6 slices of steak good for 3 people.   I asked for medium well but the curvier was so kissed and threw RAW STEAK.   I complained and I waited another 10 minutes for them to give me the right cook of the steak.   DON't Come here even your starving to death!

RZ7bgymvXI8CnAnTil4UiA.text: Excellent breakfast. Excellent Service! Very good coffee. Wonderful Blintz, CRISPY bacon (not a huge fan of bacon, but they offer two choices of how they cooked their bacon), Mimosa bar included, chicken fried steak was better than that at the Paris Breakfast buffet, fluffy biscuits, tasty country gravy, hot maple syrup and even the pancakes in the warmer were especially good. Over-all very nice atmosphere for a breakfast meal. Only thing I noticed is the hostess tried to seat a party at a dirty table, our waitress wasn't amused but had a hilarious attitude about the situation.

IKJ5wbQBFeiu9zCf_qQ74Q.text: One of Las Vegas' claims to fame are their buffets.  Long stations filled with anything that your heart desires...  Happy people taking pictures of food with their cell phones, and talking about how great their food is...
